أبوالدرداء - أيّ حكيم كان

بينما كانت جيوش الاسلام تضرب في مناكب الأرض.. هادر ظافرة.. كان يقيم بالمدينة فيلسوف عجيب.. وحكيم تتفجر الحكمة من جوانبه في كلمات تناهت نضرة وبهاء...وكان لا يفتأ يقول لمن حوله: " ألا أخبركم بخير أعمالكم، وأزكاها عند باريكم، وأنماها في درجاتكم، وخير من أن تغزو عدوّكم، فترضبوا رقابهم ويضربوا رقابكم، وخير من الدراهم والدنانير".؟؟ وتشرئب أعناق الذين ينصتون له.. ويسارعون بسؤاله: " أي شيء هو.. يا أبا الدرداء"..؟؟ ويستأنف أبو الدرداء حديثه فيقول ووجهه يتألق تحت أضوء الايمان والحكمة: " ذكر الله... ولذكر الله أكبر".. 
** 
لم يكن هذا الحكيم العجيب يبشر بفلسفة انعزالية ولم يكن بكلماته هذه يبشر بالسلبية، ولا بالانسحاب من تبعات الدين الجديد.. تلك التبعات التي يأخذ الجهاد مكان الصدارة منها... أجل.. ما كان أبو الدرداء ذلك الرجل، وهو الذي حمل سيفه مجاهدا مع رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم منذ أسلم، حتى جاء نصر الله والفتح.. بيد أنه كان من ذلك الطراز الذي يجد نفسه في وجودها الممتلئ الحيّ، كلما خلا الى التأمل، وأوى الى محراب الحكمة، ونذر حياته لنشدان الحقيقة واليقين..؟؟ ولقد كان حكيم تلك الأيام العظيمة أبو الدرداء رضي الله عنه انسانا يتملكه شوق عارم الى رؤية الحقيقة واللقاء بها.. واذ قد آمن بالله وبرسوله ايمانا وثيقا، فقد آمن كذلك بأن هذا الايمان بما يمليه من واجبات وفهم، هو طريقه الأمثل والأوحد الى الحقيقة.. وهكذا عكف على ايمانه مسلما الى نفسه، وعلى حياته يصوغها وفق هذا الايمان في عزم، ورشد، وعظمة.. ومضى على الدرب حتى وصل.. وعلى الطريق حتى بلغ مستوى الصدق الوثيق.. وحتى كان يأخذ مكانه العالي مع الصادقين تماما حين يناجي ربه مرتلا آته.. ( ان صلاتى ونسكى ومحياى ومماتى لله رب العالمين). أجل.. لقد انتهى جهاد أبي الدرداء ضدّ نفسه، ومع نفسه الى تلك الذروة العالية.. الى ذلك التفوق البعيد.. الى ذلك التفاني الرهباني، الذي جعل حياته، كل حياته لله رب العالمين..!! 
** 
والآن تعالوا نقترب من الحكيم والقدّيس.. ألا تبصرون الضياء الذي يتلألأ حول جبينه..؟ ألا تشمّون العبير الفوّاح القادم من ناحيته..؟؟ انه ضياء الحكمة، وعبير الايمان.. ولقد التقى الايمان والحكمة في هذا الرجل الأوّاب لقاء سعيدا، أيّ سعيد..!! سئلت أمه عن أفضل ما كان يحب من عمل.. فأجابت: " التفكر والاعتبار". أجل لقد وعى قول الله في أكثر من آية: (فاعتبروا يا أولي الأبصار)... وكان هو يحضّ اخوانه على التأمل والتفكّر يقول لهم: " تفكّر ساعة خير من عبادة ليلة".. لقد استولت العبادة والتأمل ونشدان الحقيقة على كل نفسه.. وكل حياته.. ويوم اقتنع بالاسلام دينا، وبايع الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم على هذا الدين الكريم، كان تاجرا ناجحا من تجار المدينة النابهين، وكان قد قضى شطر حياته في التجارة قبل أن يسلم، بل وقبل أن يأتي الرسول والمسلمون المدينة مهاجرين.. بيد أنه لم يمض على اسلامه غير وقت وجيز حتى.. ولكن لندعه هو يكمل لنا الحديث: " أسلمت مع النبي صلى الله عليه وسلم وأنا تاجر.. وأردت أن تجتمع لي العبادة والتجارة فلم يجتمعا.. فرفضت التجارة وأقبلت على العبادة. وما يسرّني اليوم أن أبيع وأشتري فأربح كل يوم ثلاثمائة دينار، حتى لو يكون حانوتي على باب المسجد.. ألا اني لا أقول لكم: ان الله حرّم البيع.. ولكني أحبّ أن أكون من الذين لا تلهيهم تجارة ولا بيع عن ذكر الله"..!! أرأيتم كيف يتكلّم فيوفي القضيّة حقها، وتشرق الحكمة والصدق من خلال كلماته..؟؟ انه يسارع قبل أن نسأله: وهل حرّم الله التجارة يا أبا الدرداء...؟؟ يسارع فينفض عن خواطرنا هذا التساؤول، ويشير الى الهدف الأسمى الذي كان ينشده، ومن أجله ترك التجارة برغم نجاحه فيها.. لقد كان رجلا ينشد تخصصا روحيا وتفوقا يرنو الى أقصى درجات الكمال الميسور لبني الانسان.. لقد أراد العبادة كمعراج يرفعه الى عالم الخير الأسمى، ويشارف به الحق في جلاله، والحقيقة في مشرقها، ولو أرادها مجرّد تكاليف تؤدّى، ومحظورات تترك، لاستطاع أن يجمع بينها وبين تجارته وأعماله... فكم من تجار صالحين.. وكم من صالحين تجار... ولقد كان من أصحاب رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم من لم تلههم تجارتهم ولا بيعهم عن ذكر الله.. بل اجتهدوا في انماء تجارتهم وأموالهم ليخدموا بها قضية الاسلام، ويكفوا بها حاجات المسلمين.. ولكن منهج هؤلاء الأصحاب، لا يغمز منهج أبو الدرداء، كما أن منهجه لا يغمز منهجهم، فكل ميسّر لما خلق له.. وأبو الدرداء يحسّ احساسا صادقا أنه خلق لما نذر له حياته.. التخصص في نشدان الحقيقة بممارسة أقصى حالات التبتل وفق الايمان الذي هداه اليه ربه، ورسوله والاسلام.. سمّوه ان شئتم تصوّفا.. ولكنه تصوّف رجل توفّر له فطنة المؤمن، وقدرة الفيلسوف، وتجربة المحارب، وفقه الصحابي، ما جعل تصوّفه حركة حيّة في ل\بناء الروح، لا مجرّد ظلال صالحة لهذا البناء..!! أجل.. ذلك هو أبو الدرداء، صاحب رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم وتلميذه.. وذلكم هو أبو الدرداء، الحكيم، القدّيس.. ورجل دفع الدنيا بكلتا راحتيه، وزادها بصدره.. رجل عكف على نفسه وصقلها وزكّاها، وحتى صارت مرآة صافية انعكس عليها من الحكمة، والصواب، والخير، ما جعل من أبي الدرداء معلما عظيما وحكيما قويما.. سعداء، أولئك الذين يقبلون عليه، ويصغون اليه.. ألا تعالوا نف\قترب من حكمته يا أولي الألباب.. ولنبدأ بفلسفته تجاه الدنيا وتجاه مباهجها وزخارفها.. انه متأثر حتى أعماق روحه بآيات القرآن الرادعة عن: ( الذي جمع مالا وعدّده.. يحسب أن ماله اخلده)... ومتأثر حتى أعماق روحه بقول الرسول: " ما قلّ وكفى، خير مما كثر وألهى".. ويقول عليه السلام: " تفرّغوا من هموم الدنيا ما استطعتم، فانه من كانت الدنيا أكبر همّه، فرّق الله شمله، وجعل فقره بين عينيه.. ومن كانت الآخرة أكبر همّه جمع شمله، وجعل غناه في قلبه، وكان الله اليه بكل خير أسرع". من أجل ذلك، كان يرثي لأولئك الذين وقعوا أسرى طموح الثروة ويقول: " اللهم اني أعوذ بك من شتات القلب".. سئل: وما شتات القلب يا أبا الدرداء..؟؟ فأجاب: أن يكون لي في كل واد مال"..!! وهو يدعو الناس الى امتلاك الدنيا والاستغناء عنها.. فذلك هو الامتلاك الحقيقي لها.. أما الجري وراء أطماعها التي لا تؤذن بالانتهاء، فذلك شر ألوان العبودية والرّق. هنالك يقول: " من لم يكن غنيا عن الدنيا، فلا دنيا له".. والمال عنده وسيلة للعيش القنوع تامعتدل ليس غير. ومن ثم فان على الناس أن يأخذوه من حلال، وأن يكسبوه في رفق واعتدال، لا في جشع وتهالك. فهو يقول: " لا تأكل الا طيّبا.. ولا تكسب الا طيّبا.. ولا تدخل بيتك الا طيّبا". ويكتب لصاحب له فيقول: ".. أما بعد، فلست في شيء من عرض الدنيا، والا وقد كان لغيرك قبلك.. وهو صائر لغيرك بعدك.. وليس لك منه الا ما قدّمت لنفسك... فآثرها على من تجمع المال له من ولدك ليكون له ارثا، فأنت انما تجمع لواحد من اثنين: اما ولد صالح يعمل فيه بطاعة الله، فيسعد بما شقيت به.. واما ولد عاص، يعمل فيه بمعصية الله، فتشقى بما جمعت له، فثق لهم بما عند الله من رزق، وانج بنفسك"..! كانت الدنيا كلها في عين أبي الدرداء مجرّد عارية.. عندما فتحت قبرص وحملت غنائم الحرب الى المدينة رأى الناس أبا الدرداء يبكي... واقتربوا دهشين يسألونه، وتولى توجيه السؤال اليه:" جبير بن نفير": قال له: " يا أبا الدرداء، ما يبكيك في يوم أعز الله فيه الاسلام وأهله"..؟؟ فأجاب أبو الدرداء في حكمة بالغة وفهم عميق: ويحك يا جبير.. ما أهون الخلق على الله اذا هم تركوا أمره.. بينما هي أمة، ظاهرة، قاهرة، لها الملك، تركت أمر الله، فصارت الى ما ترى"..! أجل.. وبهذا كان يعلل الانهيار السريع الذي تلحقه جيوش الاسلام بالبلاد المفتوحة، افلاس تلك البلاد من روحانية صادقة تعصمها، ودين صحيح يصلها بالله.. ومن هنا أيضا، كان يخشى على المسلمين أياما تنحلّ فيها عرى الايمان، وتضعف روابطهم بالله، وبالحق، وبالصلاح، فتنتقل العارية من أيديهم، بنفس السهولة التي انتقلت بها من قبل اليهم..!! 
** 
وكما كانت الدنيا بأسرها مجرّد عارية في يقينه، كذلك كانت جسرا الى حياة أبقى وأروع.. دخل عليه أصحابه يعودونه وهو مريض، فوجدوه نائما على فراش من جلد.. فقالوا له:" لو شئت كان لك فراش أطيب وأنعم.." فأجابهم وهو يشير بسبّابته، وبريق عينيه صوب الأمام البعيد: " ان دارنا هناك.. لها نجمع.. واليها نرجع.. نظعن اليها. ونعمل لها"..!! وهذه النظرة الى الدنيا ليست عند أبي الدرداء وجهة نظر فحسب بل ومنهج حياة كذلك.. خطب يزيد بن معاوية ابنته الدرداء فردّه، ولم يقبل خطبته، ثم خطبها واحد من فقراء المسلمين وصالحيهم، فزوّجها أبو الدرداء منه. وعجب الناس لهذا التصرّف، فعلّمهم أبو الدرداء قائلا: " ما ظنّكم بالدرداء، اذا قام على رأسها الخدم والخصيا وبهرها زخرف القصور.. أين دينها منها يومئذ"..؟! هذا حكيم قويم النفس، ذكي الفؤاد.. وهو يرفض من الدنيا ومن متاعها كل ما يشدّ النفس اليها، ويولّه القلب بها.. وهو بهذا لا يهرب من السعادة بل اليها.. فالسعادة الحقة عتده هي أن تمتلك الدنيا، لا أن تمتلكك أنت الدنيا.. وكلما وقفت مطالب الناس في الحياة عند حدود القناعة والاعتدال وكلما أدركوا حقيقة الدنيا كجسر يعبرون عليه الى دار القرار والمآل والخلود، كلما صنعوا هذا، كان نصيبهم من السعادة الحقة أوفى وأعظم.. وانه ليقول: " ليس الخير أن يكثر مالك وولدك، ولكن الخير أن يعظم حلمك، ويكثر علمك، وأن تباري الناس في عبادة الله تعالى".. وفي خلافة عثمان رضي الله عنه، وكان معاوية أميرا على الشام نزل أبو الدرداء على رغبة الخليفة في أن يلي القضاء.. وهناك في الشام وقف بالمرصاد لجميع الذين أغرّتهم مباهج الدنيا، وراح يذكّر بمنهج الرسول في حياته، وزهده، وبمنهج الرعيل الأول من الشهداء والصدّيقين.. وكانت الشام يومئذ حاضرة تموج بالمباهج والنعيم.. وكأن أهلها ضاقوا ذرعا بهذا الذي ينغصّ عليهم بمواعظه متاعهم ودنياهم.. فجمعهم أبو الدرداء، وقام فيهم خطيبا: " يا أهل الشام.. أنتم الاخوان في الدين، والجيران في الدار، والأنصار على الأعداء.. ولكن مالي أراكم لا تستحيون..؟؟ تجمعون ما لا تأكلون.. وتبنون ما لا تسكنون.. وترجون ما لا تبلّغون.. وقد كانت القرون من قبلكم يجمعون، فيوعون.. ويؤمّلون، فيطيلون.. ويبنون، فيوثقون.. فأصبح جمعهم بورا.. وأماهم غرورا.. وبيوتهم قبورا.. أولئك قوم عاد، ملؤا ما بين عدن الى عمان أموالا وأولادا..". ثم ارتسمت على شفتيه بسمة عريضة ساخرة، ولوّح بذراعه في الجمع الذاهل، وصاح في سخرية لا فحة: " من يشتري مني تركة آل عاد بدرهمين"..؟! رجل باهر، رائع، مضيء، حكمته مؤمنة، ومشاعره ورعة، ومنطقه سديد ورشيد..!! العبادة عند أبي الدرداء ليست غرورا ولا تأليا. انما هي التماس للخير، وتعرّض لرحمة الله، وضراعة دائمة تذكّر الانسان بضعفه. وبفضل ربه عليه: انه يقول: التمسوا الخير دهركم كله.. وتعرّضوا لنفجات رحمة الله، فان للله نفحات من رحمته يصيب بها من يشاء من عباده.. " وسلوا الله أن يستر عوراتكم، ويؤمّن روعاتكم"... كان ذلك الحكيم مفتوح العينين دائما على غرور العبادة، يحذّر منه الناس. هذا الغرور الذي يصيب بعض الضعاف في ايمانهم حين يأخذهم الزهو بعبادتهم، فيتألّون بها على الآخرين ويدلّون.. فلنستمع له ما يقول: " مثقال ذرّة من برّ صاحب تقوى ويقين، أرجح وأفضل من أمثال الجبال من عبادة النغترّين".. ويقول أيضا: "لا تكلفوا الناس ما لم يكلفوا.. ولا تحاسبوهم دون ربهم عليكم أنفسكم، فان من تتبع ما يرى في الانس يطل حزنه"..! انه لا يريد للعابد مهما يعل في العبادة شأوه أن يجرّد من نفسه ديّانا تجاه العبد. عليه أن يحمد الله على توفيقه، وأن يعاون بدعائه وبنبل مشاعره ونواياه أولئك الذين لم يدركوا مثل هذا التوفيق. هل تعرفون حكمة أنضر وأبهى من حكمة هذا الحكيم..؟؟ يحدثنا صاحبه أبو قلابة فيقول: " مرّ أبو الدرداء يوما على رجل قد أصاب ذنبا، والناس يسبّونه، فنهاهم وقال: أرأيتم لو وجدتموه في حفرة.. ألم تكونوا مخرجيه منها..؟ قالوا بلى.. قال: فلا تسبّوه اذن، وحمدوا الله الذي عافاكم. قالوا: أنبغضه..؟ قال: انما أبغضوا عمله، فاذا تركه فهو أخي"..!! 
** 
واذاكان هذا أحد وجهي العبادة عند أبي الدرداء، فان وجهها الآخر هو العلم والمعرفة.. ان أبا الدرداء يقدّس العلم تقديسا بعيدا.. يقدّسه كحكيم، ويقدّسه كعابد فيقول: " لا يكون أحدكم تقيا جتى يكون عالما.. ولن يكون بالعلم جميلا، حتى يكون به عاملا". أجل.. فالعلم عنده فهم، وسلوك.. معرفة، ومنهج.. فكرة حياة.. ولأن تقديسه هذا تقديس رجل حكيم، نراه ينادي بأن العلم كالمتعلم كلاهما سواء في الفضل، والمكانة، والمثوبة.. ويرى أن عظمة الحياة منوطة بالعلم الخيّر قبل أي شيء سواه.. ها هو ذا يقول: " مالي أرى العلماء كم يذهبون، وجهّالكم لا يتعلمون؟؟ ألا ان معلّم الخير والمتعلّم في الأجر سواء.. ولا خير في سائر الناس بعدهما".. ويقول أيضا: " الناس ثلاثة.. عالم.. ومتعلم.. والثالث همج لا خير فيه". وكما رأينا من قبل، لا ينفصل العلم في حكمة أبي الدرداء رضي الله عنه عن العمل. يقول: " ان أخشى ما أخشاه على نفسي أن يقال لي يوم القيامة على رؤوس الخلائق: يا عويمر، هل علمت؟؟ فأقول نعم.. فيقال لي: فماذا عملت فيما علمت"..؟ وكان يجلّ العلماء العاملين ويوقرهم توقيرا كبيرا، بل كان يدعو ربّه ويقول: " اللهم اني أعوذ بك أن تلعنني قلوب العلماء.." قيل له: وكيف تلعنك قلوبهم؟ قال رضي الله عنه: " تكرهني"..! أرأيتم؟؟ انه يرى في كراهيّة العالم لعنة لا يطيقها.. ومن ثمّ فهو يضرع الى ربه أن يعيذه منها.. وتستوصي حكمة أبي الدرداء بالاخاء خيرا، وتبنى علاقة الانسان بالانسان على أساس من واقع الطبيعة الانسانية ذاتها فيقول: " معاتبة الأخ خير لك من فقده، ومن لك بأخيك كله..؟ أعط أخاك ولن له.. ولا تطع فيه حاسدا، فتكون مثله. غدا يأتيك الموت، فيكفيك فقده.. وكيف تبكيه بعد الموت، وفي الحياة ما كنت أديت حقه"..؟؟ ومراقبة الله في عباده قاعدة صلبة يبني عليها أبو الدرداء حقوق الاخاء.. يقول رضي الله عنه وأرضاه: " اني أبغض أن أظلم أحدا.. ولكني أبغض أكثر وأكثر، أن أظلم من لا يستعين عليّ الا بالله العليّ الكبير"..!! يل لعظمة نفسك، واشراق روحك يا أبا الدرداء..!! انه يحذّر الناس من خداع الوهك، حين يظنون أن المستضعفين العزّل أقرب منالا من أيديهم، ومن بأسهم..! ويذكّرهم أن هؤلاء في ضعفهم يملكون قوّة ماحقة حين يتوسلون الى الله عز وجل بعجزهم، ويطرحون بين يديه قضيتهم، وهو أنهم على الناس..!! هذا هو أبو الدرداء الحكيم..! هذا هو أبو الدرداء الزاهد، العابد، الأوّاب.. هذا هو أبو الدرداء الذي كان اذا أطرى الناس تقاه، وسألوه الدعاء، أجابهم في تواضع وثيق قائلا: " لا أحسن السباحة.. وأخاف الغرق"..!! 
** 
كل هذا، ولا تحسن السباحة يا أبا الدرداء..؟؟ ولكن أي عجب، وأنت تربية الرسول عليه الصلاة والسلام... وتلميذ القرآن.. وابن الاسلام الأوّل وصاحب أبي بكر وعمر، وبقيّة الرجال..!؟
number-en: The story of Abu Darda
label-en:
Abu Dardaa - whoever was wise

While the armies of Islam were attacking the earth... roaring in victory... there was residing in the city a wondrous philosopher... and a sage whose wisdom exploded from his sides in words that were infinitely fresh and splendid... and he kept saying to those around him: “Shall I not inform you of the best of your deeds, the purest in the eyes of your Creator, the highest in your ranks, and better than attacking your enemy, so that you strike their necks and they strike your necks, and better than dirhams? And dinars.”?? The necks of those who listen to him shudder, and they rush to ask him: “What is it?” O Abu Al-Darda’..?? Abu Al-Darda’ resumes his speech and says, his face shining under the light of faith and wisdom: “The remembrance of God... and the remembrance of God is greater.” 
** 
This amazing sage did not preach an isolationist philosophy, nor did he, with his words, preach negativity, nor withdrawal from the consequences of the new religion... those consequences of which jihad takes the lead... Yes... Abu Dardaa was not that man, and he was the one who carried his sword, struggling with the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, since he converted to Islam, until God’s victory and conquest came. However, he was of that type who found himself in her full, living presence, whenever he retreated to contemplation, took refuge in the sanctuary of wisdom, and dedicated his life to the pursuit of truth and certainty..?? The sage of those great days, Abu Darda, may God be pleased with him, was a man possessed by an overwhelming longing to see the truth and encounter it. And since he believed in God and His Messenger with a firm faith, he also believed that this faith, with the duties and understanding it dictated, was the best and only path to the truth. And so he devoted himself to his faith, surrendering to himself, and shaping his life according to this faith with determination, guidance, and greatness. He continued on the path until he reached.. and on the path until he reached the level of solid honesty.. and until he took his high place among the completely truthful when he addressed his Lord as a supplicant who came to him.. (Indeed, my prayer and my sacrifice, and my living and my dying, belong to God, Lord of the worlds). Yes... Abu Al-Darda''s struggle against himself, and with himself, has reached that high peak... to that distant superiority... to that monastic devotion, in which he devoted his life, all his life, to God, Lord of the Worlds...!! 
** 
Now let us approach the wise and the saint. Do you not see the light that sparkles around his forehead? Don't you smell the fragrant aroma coming from him? He is the light of wisdom, and the fragrance of faith.. Faith and wisdom met in this man who was steadfast in a happy meeting, that is, happy..!! His mother was asked about the work he liked best. She replied: “Contemplation and consideration.” Yes, he was aware of God’s words in more than one verse: (So consider, O possessors of sight)... And he was urging his brothers to meditate and contemplate, saying to them: “An hour’s contemplation is better than a night’s worship.” Worship, contemplation, and the pursuit of truth took over his entire soul...and his entire life.. The day he became convinced of Islam as a religion, and pledged allegiance to the Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace, on this noble religion, he was a successful merchant, one of the brilliant merchants of Medina, and he had spent half of his life in trade before he converted to Islam, and even before the Messenger and the Muslims came to Medina as immigrants... However, only a short time had passed since he converted to Islam... but let him complete the hadith for us: “I converted to Islam with the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, and I was a merchant... and I wanted worship and trade to be combined for me, so I did not They meet.. and she refuses trade and accepts worship. And what pleases me today is to buy and sell, and I earn three hundred dinars every day, even if my shop is at the door of the mosque.. However, I am not telling you: God has forbidden selling.. but I would like to be among those who are not distracted by trade or sale from mentioning God..!! Have you seen how he speaks so that he does justice to the cause, and wisdom and honesty shine through his words..?? He hastens before we ask him: Did God forbid trade, Abu Darda...?? He quickly puts this question out of our minds and points to the ultimate goal he was pursuing, for which he left trading despite his success in it. He was a man who sought spiritual specialization and excellence and aspired to the utmost degree of perfection accessible to human beings. He wanted worship as an ascension that would raise him to the world of the highest good, and bring him closer to the truth in its majesty and the truth in its brightness. If he had wanted it merely as expenses to be paid and prohibitions to be abandoned, he would have been able to combine it with his trade and deeds... How many good merchants... How many good merchants... And he was among the companions of the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace. Their trade and selling did not distract them from the remembrance of God. Rather, they worked hard to grow their trade and their money in order to serve the cause of Islam and satisfy the needs of Muslims. However, the approach of these companions does not wink at the approach of Abu Darda, just as his approach does not wink at their approach, for everyone is facilitating what he was created for. And His Messenger and Islam... call him Sufism if you wish... But it was the Sufism of a man who had the intelligence of a believer, the ability of a philosopher, the experience of a warrior, and the jurisprudence of a companion, which made his Sufism a living movement in the building of the soul, not just valid shadows of this building..!! Yes.. That is Abu Darda, the companion and student of the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace.. That is Abu Darda, the wise, the saint.. And a man who pushed the world with both his palms and increased it with his chest.. A man who devoted himself to himself, polishing it, and purifying it, until it became a clear mirror in which wisdom, truth, and goodness were reflected, which made Abu Darda a great teacher and an upright sage.. Happy are those who come to him and listen to him... Come, come closer to his wisdom, O people of understanding... And let us begin with his philosophy towards the world and towards its joys and adornments... He is influenced to the depths of his soul by the deterrent verses of the Qur’an about: (He who has accumulated wealth and enumerated it... thinks that his wealth is immortal)... and he is influenced to the depths of his soul by the words of the Messenger: “What is little and sufficient is better than what is abundant and distracting”... and he says of him. Peace: “Be free of the worries of the world as much as you can, for whoever’s greatest concern is the world, God will separate him and place his poverty before his eyes. And whoever has the afterlife as his greatest concern, he will be united, and his wealth will be placed in his heart, and God will grant him all goodness more quickly.” For this reason, he would sympathize with those who fell captive to the ambition of wealth and say: “O God, I seek refuge in You from the dispersion of the heart.” He was asked: What is the dispersion of the heart, O Abu Dardaa..?? He replied: That I have money in every valley..!! He calls on people to possess the world and dispense with it...that is true possession of it...as for running after its ambitions that do not indicate an end, that is the worst form of slavery and slavery. There he says: “Whoever is not rich in this world has no world.” For him, money is a means of living in complete contentment and moderation and nothing else. Hence, people must take it from what is permissible, and earn it with kindness and moderation, not with greed and frivolity. He says: “Do not eat anything but what is good.. and do not earn anything but what is good.. and do not enter your house except what is good.” He writes to a friend of his and says: “...as for now, you are not in possession of any of the worldly goods, otherwise it belonged to someone else before you.. and it will belong to someone else after you.. and you do not have any of it except what you have given for yourself... so give it preference over whomever you collect money for from among your children so that he may have an inheritance, for you are only collecting for one of two things: as for a righteous child who works in it in obedience to God, and he will be happy with what you made miserable with.. And as for a disobedient child, who acts in disobedience to God, you will be miserable with what you have collected for him, so trust in them with the provision that God has, and save yourself.”...! In Abu Darda’s eyes, the whole world was just bare... When Cyprus was conquered and the spoils of war were carried to the city, people saw Abu Darda’ crying... and they approached in amazement asking him, and he took up directing the question to him: “Jubayr bin Nufayr”: He said to him: “O Abu Darda, what makes you cry on a most precious day? In God is Islam and its people..?? Abu Darda’ replied with great wisdom and deep understanding: Woe to you, O mighty one.. How easy are creations to God if they abandon His command.. While it is a nation, visible, compelling, with dominion, it left the command of God, and became what you see..! Yes... and this was the explanation for the rapid collapse that the armies of Islam inflicted on the conquered countries, the bankruptcy of those countries from a true spirituality that protects them, and a true religion that connects them to God... From here, too, he feared for the Muslims days in which the bonds of faith would be loosened, and their ties to God, to truth, and to righteousness would weaken, so that the nakedness would pass from their hands, With the same ease with which I moved to them before..!! 
** 
Just as the entire world was merely bare in his certainty, so it was a bridge to a more lasting and wonderful life. His friends came in to visit him while he was sick, and they found him sleeping on a leather bed.. They said to him: “If you wish, you could have a better and softer bed...” He answered them, pointing with his index finger, and with the twinkle in his eyes towards the far ahead: “Our house is there... for it we gather... and to it we will return... to lay down to it.. and to work for it”..!! For Abu Darda, this view of the world is not only a point of view, but also a way of life. Yazid bin Muawiya proposed to his daughter, Darda, but he rejected him, but he did not accept his proposal. Then one of the poor and righteous Muslims proposed to her, so Abu Darda married her to him. The people were astonished at this behavior, so Abu Al-Darda taught them, saying: “What do you think of Al-Darda’, if servants and eunuchs appeared on her head and she was dazzled by the adornment of palaces... where would her religion be from her on that day?”..?! This is a wise man with a strong soul and an intelligent heart. He rejects everything from the world and its enjoyments that draws the soul to it and makes the heart yearn for it. In this way, he does not run away from happiness, but rather towards it. True happiness is his equipment: owning the world, not having the world own you. The more people’s demands in life stand at the limits of contentment and moderation, and the more they realize the reality of the world as a bridge on which they can cross to the abode of stability, wealth, and eternity, the more they do this, the fuller and greater their share of true happiness will be. And it is said: “It is not good that your wealth and children increase, but good is that your dreams become great, your knowledge increases, and you compete with people in worshiping God Almighty.” And during the caliphate of Othman, may God be pleased with him, and Muawiyah was the emir of the Levant, he descended. Abu Darda on the Caliph’s desire to follow the judiciary.. And there in the Levant, he stood on the lookout for all those who were tempted by the joys of the world, and he began to remind of the Messenger’s approach to his life, his asceticism, and the approach of the first generation of martyrs and truthful people. At that time, the Levant was a metropolis filled with joys and bliss. It was as if its people were fed up with this one who was disturbing them with his sermons about their enjoyment and their worldly. So Abu Darda gathered them together, and he spoke among them: “O people The Levant.. You are brothers in religion, neighbors at home, and supporters against the enemies.. But why do I see you not feeling ashamed..?? And the centuries before you used to gather, and they were patient... and they hoped, and they lengthened... and they built, and they were strengthened... and their gatherings became barrens... and their mothers were arrogance... and their homes were graves... These are the people of Aad, who filled what was between Aden and Amman with wealth and children...” Then a broad, sarcastic smile appeared on his lips, and he waved his arm at the astonished crowd, and shouted in unflattering sarcasm: “ “Who will buy from me the legacy of the Aad family for two dirhams?”..?! A brilliant, wonderful, and luminous man, whose wisdom is faithful, whose feelings are pious, and whose reasoning is sound and rational..!! Worship according to Abu Darda is neither arrogance nor idolatry. Rather, it is a search for goodness, an exposure to God’s mercy, and a constant supplication that reminds a person of his weakness. And by the grace of his Lord upon him: He says: Seek goodness all your life... and be exposed to the outbursts of God’s mercy, for God has outbursts of His mercy that He bestows upon whomever He wishes of His servants... “And ask God to cover your faults and secure your splendors”... That wise man was always open-eyed to the deceitfulness of worship, warning people against it. This is the arrogance that afflicts some people who are weak in their faith when pride takes them in their worship, so they inflict it on others and show it.. Let us listen to what he says: “An atom’s weight of righteousness from one who has piety and certainty is more likely and better than the likes of mountains than the worship of the ignorant.” He also says: “Do not burden people with what they are not burdened with. And do not hold them accountable to their Lord rather than yourselves, for whoever follows what he sees in people will be greatly distressed.” He does not want the worshiper, no matter how much he desires in worship, to deprive himself of himself as a judge towards the servant. He should thank God for his success, and help through his prayers and the nobility of his feelings and intentions those who have not achieved such success. Do you know wisdom that is fresher and more beautiful than the wisdom of this sage..?? His friend Abu Qilabah tells us, saying: “One day Abu Darda passed by a man who had committed a sin, and the people were cursing him. He forbade them and said: Did you see that if you found him in a hole... would you not have taken him out of it...? They said, ‘Yes..’ He said: ‘Do not curse him then, and praise God who has pardoned you.’ They said: ‘I hate him..’? He said: ‘They only hate his work, so if he abandons it then he is my brother’..!! 
** 
If this is one of the two aspects of worship according to Abu Darda, then its other aspect is knowledge and knowledge. Abu Darda sanctifies knowledge to a great extent. He sanctifies him as a sage, and sanctifies him as a worshiper, saying: “None of you will be pious until he is knowledgeable... and he will not be beautiful with knowledge until he does it.” Yes... science has understanding, behavior... knowledge, and a method... an idea of life... and because this sanctification of him is the sanctification of a wise man, we see him calling for knowledge to be like the learner, both equal in virtue, status, and reward... and he sees that the greatness of life is attributed to good knowledge before anything else... Here he is saying: “Why do I see how far scholars go, and your ignorant people do not learn?? Except that the teacher of goodness and the learner are equal in reward... and there is no goodness in all people. After them... He also says: “There are three types of people: a scholar, an educated person, and the third is a savage with no good in him.” As we saw before, in the wisdom of Abu Darda, may God be pleased with him, knowledge is inseparable from work. He says: “I fear what I fear for myself, that it will be said to me on the Day of Resurrection at the heads of the creatures: O Awaimer, did you know?? So I say yes.. It would be said to me: “So what did you do in what you knew?”.. He had great reverence for the working scholars and respected them. Rather, he would pray to his Lord and say: “O God, I seek refuge in You lest the hearts of the scholars curse me.” He was told: How do their hearts curse you? He, may God be pleased with him, said: “You hate me”..! Did you see?? He saw in hating the world a curse that he could not bear.. And then he prayed to his Lord to protect him from it.. and you sought protection from him. Abu Al-Darda’’s wisdom is that brotherhood is good, and the relationship between man and man is built on the basis of the reality of human nature itself. He says: “It is better for you to blame your brother than to lose him, and for you to have all of your brother..?” Give to your brother and he will not have it. Do not obey an envious person, lest you become like him. Tomorrow death will come to you, and losing him is enough for you.. And how can you cry over him after death, when in life you have not fulfilled his rights..?? And God’s monitoring of His servants is a solid foundation upon which Abu Darda builds the rights of brotherhood.. May God be pleased with him, he says: “I hate to oppress anyone.. But I hate, more and more, to oppress those who do not seek help from me except from God, the Most High, the Great.”..!! Oh, the greatness of yourself, and the radiance of your soul, O Abu Al-Darda'..!! He warns people against the deception of weakness, when they think that the weak and defenseless are closer to their reach than their hands and their strength..! He reminds them that these people, in their weakness, have overwhelming power when they plead with God Almighty due to their inability, and present their case before Him, which is that they are over the people..!! This is Abu Dardaa Al-Hakim..! This is Abu Al-Darda’, the ascetic, the worshiper, the steadfast one.. This is Abu Al-Darda’, who, when people praised him, was pious, and they asked him to pray, he answered them in close humility, saying: “I am not good at swimming... and I am afraid of drowning”..!! 
** 
All this, and you are not good at swimming, Abu Darda..?? But what a wonder, when you are the upbringing of the Messenger, peace and blessings be upon him... and a student of the Qur’an.. And the first son of Islam and the companion of Abu Bakr and Omar, and the rest of the men..!?

أبو هريرة - ذاكرة عصر الوحي

صحيح أن ذكاء المرء محسوب عليه.. وأصحاب المواهب الخارقة كثيرا ما يدفعون الثمن في نفس الوقت الذي كان ينبغي أن يتلقوا فيه الجزاء والشكران..!! والصحابي الجليل أبو هريرة واحد من هؤلاء.. فقد كان ذا موهبة خارقة في سعة الذاكرة وقوتها.. كان رضي الله عنه يجيد فنّ الاصغاء، وكانت ذاكرته تجيد فن الحفظ والاختزان.. يسمع فيعي، فيحفظ، ثم لا يكاد ينسى مما وعى كلمة ولا حرفا مهما تطاول العمر، وتعاقبت الأيام..!! من أجل هذا هيأته موهبته ليكون أكثر أصحاب الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم حفظا لأحاديثه، وبالتالي أكثرهم رواية لها. فلما جاء عصر الوضّاعين الذين تخصصوا في الكذب على رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم، اتخذوا أبا هريرة غرضا مستغلين أسوأ استغلال سمعته العريضة في الرواية عن رسول الله عليه السلام موضع الارتياب والتساؤول. لولا تلك الجهود البارة والخارقة التي بذلها أبرار كبار نذور حياتهم وكرّسوها لخدمة الحديث النبوي ونفي كل زيف ودخيل عنه. هنالك نجا أبو هريرة رضي الله عنه من أخطبوط الأكاذيب والتلفيقات التي أراد المفسدون أن يتسللوا بها الى الاسلام عن طريقه، وأن يحمّلوه وزرها وأذاها..!! 
** 
والآن.. عندما نسمع واعظا، أو محاضرا، أو خطيب جمعة يقول تلك العبارة المأثورة:" عن أبي هريرة رضي الله عنه قال: قال رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم..". أقول: عندما تسمع هذا الاسم على هذه الصورة، أ، عندما تلقاه كثيرا، وكثيرا جدّا في كتب الحديث، والسيرة والفقه والدين بصفة عامة، فاعلم أنك تلقى شخصية من أكثر شخصيات الصحابة اغراء بالصحبة والاصغاء.. ذلك أن ثروته من الأحاديث الرائعة، والتوجيهات الحكيمة التي حفظها عن النبي عليه السلام، قلّ أن يوجد لها نظير.. وانه رضي الله عنه بما يملك من هذه الموهبة، وهذه الثروة، لمن أكثر الأصحاب مقدرة على نقلك الى تلك الأيام التي عاشها رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم وأصحابه رضي الله عنهم، والى التحليق بك، اذا كنت وثيق الايمان مرهف النفس، في تاك الآفاق التي شهدت روائع محمد وأصحابه، تعطي الحياة معناها، وتهدي اليها رشدها ونهاها. واذا كانت هذه السطور قد حرّكت أشواقك لأن تتعرّف لأبي هريرة وتسمع من أنبائه نبأ، فدونك الآن وما تريد.. انه واحد من الذين تنعكس عليهم ثروة الاسلام بكل ما أحدثته من تغيرات هائلة. فمن أجير الى سيّد.. ومن تائه في الزحام، الى علم وامام..!! ومن ساجد أمام حجارة مركومة، الى مؤمن بالله الواحد القهار.. وهاهو ذا يتحدّث ويقول: " نشأت يتيما، وهاجرت مسكينا.. وكنت أجيرا لبسرة بنت غزوان بطعام بطني..!! كنت أخدمهم اذا نزلوا، وأحدو لهم اذا ركبوا.. وهأنذا وقد زوّجنيها الله، فالحمد لله الذي جعل الدين قواما، وجعل أبا هريرة اماما"..! قدم على النبي عليه الصلاة والسلام سنة سبع وهو بخيبر، فأسلم راغبا مشتاقا.. ومنذ رأى النبي عليه الصلاة والسلام وبايعه لم يكد يفارقه قط الا في ساعات النوم.. وهكذا كانت السنوات الأربع التي عاشها مع رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم منذ أسلم الى أن ذهب النبي الى الرفيق الأعلى. نقول: كانت تلك السنوات الأربع عمرا وحدها.. كانت طويلة عريضة، ممتلئة بكل صالح من القول، والعمل، والاصغاء. 
** 
أدرك أبو هريرة بفطرته السديدة الدور الكبير الذي يستطيع أن يخدم به دين الله. ان أبطال الحرب في الصحابة كثيرون.. والفقهاء والدعاة والمعلمون كثيرون. ولكن البيئة والجماعة تفتقد الكتابة والكتّاب. ففي تلك العصور، وكانت الجماعة الانسانية كلها، لا العرب وحدهم، لا يهتمون بالكتابة، ولم تكن الكتابة من علامات التقدم في مجتمع ما.. بل انّ أوروبا نفسها كانت كذلك منذ عهد غير بعيد. وكان أكثر ملوكها وعلى رأسهم شارلمان أميّين لا يقرءون ولا يكتبون، مع أنهم في نفس الوقت كانوا على حظ كبير من الذكاء والمقدرة.. 
** 
نعود الى حديثنا لنرى أبا هريرة يدرك بفطرته حاجة المجتمع الجديد الذي يبنيه الاسلام الى من يحفظن تراثه وتعاليمه، كان هناك يومئذ من الصحابة كتّاب يكتبون ولكنهم قليلون، ثم ان بعضهم لا يملك من الفراغ ما يمكّنه من تسجيل كل ما ينطق به الرسول من حديث. لم يكن أبا هريرة كاتبا، ولكنه كان حافظا، وكان يملك هذا الفراغ، أو هذا الفراغ المنشود، فليس له أرض يزرعها ولا تجارة يتبعها!! وهو اذا رأى نفسه وقد أسلم متأخرا، عزم على أن يعوّض ما فاته، وذلك بأن يواظب على متابعة الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم وعلى مجالسته.. ثم انه يعرف من نفسه هذه الموهبة التي أنعم الله بها عليه، وهي ذاكرته الرحبة القوية، والتي زادت مضاء ورحابة وقوة، بدعوة الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم لصاحبها أن يبارك الله له فيها.. فلماذا اذن لا يكون واحدا من الذين يأخذون على عاتقهم حفظ هذا التراث ونقله لللأجيال..؟؟ أجل.. هذا دوره الذي تهيئه للقيام به مواهبه، وعليه أن يقوم به في غير توان.. 
** 
ولم يكن أبو هريرة ممن يكتبون، ولكنه كان كما ذكرنا سريع الحفظ قوي الذاكرة.. ولم تكن له أرض يزرعها، ولا تجارة تشغله، ومن ثمّ لم يكن يفارق الرسول في سفر ولا في حضر.. وهكذا راح يكرّس نفسه ودقة ذاكرته لحفظ أحاديث رسول الله عليه الصلاة والسلام وتوجيهاته.. فلما انتقل النبي صلى الله عليه وسلم الى الرفيق الأعلى، راح أبو هريرة يحدث، مما جعل بعض أصحابه يعجبون: أنّى له كل هذه الحاديث، ومتى سمعها ووعاها.. ولقد ألقى أبوهريرة رضي الله عنه الضوء على هذه الظاهرة، وكانه يدفع عن نفسه مغبة تلك الشكوك التي ساورت بعض أصحابه فقال: " انكم لتقولون أكثر أبو هريرة في حديثه عن النبي صلى الله عليه وسلم.. وتقولون: ان المهاجرين الذين سبقوه الى الاسلام لا يحدثون هذه الأحاديث..؟؟ ألا ان أصحابي من المهاجرين، كانت تشغلهم صفقاتهم بالسوق، وان أصحابي من الأنصار كانت تشغلهم أرضهم.. واني كنت أميرا مسكينا، أكثر مجالسة رسول الله، فأحضر اذا غابوا، وأحفظ اذا نسوا.. وان النبي صلى الله عليه وسلم حدثنا يوما فقال: من يبسط رداءه حتى يفرغ من حديثي ثم يقبضه اليه فلا ينسى شيئا كان قد سمعه مني..! فبسطت ثزبي فحدثني ثم ضممته اليّ فوالله ما كنت نسيت شيئا سمعته منه.. وأيم والله، لولا آية في كتاب الله ما حدثتكم بشيء أبدا، وهي: ( ان الذين يكتمون ما أنزلنا من البينات والهدى من بعد ما بيّناه للناس في الكتاب، أولئك يلعنهم الله ويلعنهم اللاعنون)..". هكذا يفسر أبو هريرة سر تفرّده بكثرة الرواية عن الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم. فهو أولا كان متفرغا لصحبة النبي أكثر من غيره.. وهو ثانيا كان يحمل ذاكرة قوية، باركها الرسول فزادت قوة.. وهو ثالثا لا يحدّث رغبة في أن يحدّث، بل لأن افشاء هذه الأحاديث مسؤولية دينه وحياته، والا كان كاتما للخير والحق، وكان مفرطا ينتظره جزاء المفرّطين.. من أجل هذا راح يحدّث ويحدّث، لا يصدّه عن الحديث صادّ، ولا يعتاقه عائق.. حتى قال له عمر يوما وهو أمير المؤمنين: " لتتركنّ الحديث عن رسول الله،أو لألحقنك بأرض دوس".. أي أرض قومه وأهله.. على أن هذا النهي من أمير المؤمنين لا يشكل اتهاما لأبي هريرة، بل هو دعم لنظرية كان عمر يتبنّاها ويؤكدها، تلك هي: أن على المسلمين في تلك الفترة بالذات ألا يقرؤوا، وألا يحفظوا شيئا سوى القرآن حتى يقرّ وثبت في الأفئدة والعقول.. فالقرآن كتاب الله، ودستور الاسلام، وقاموس الدين، وكثرة الحديث عن رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم، لا سيما في تلك التي أعقبت وفاته عليه الصلاة والسلام، والتي يجمع القرآن خلالها قد تسبب بلبلة لا داعي لها ولا جدوى منها.. من أجل هذا كان عمر يقول: " اشتغلوا بالقرآن، فان القرآن كلام الله".. ويقول: " أقلوا الرواية عن رسول الله الا فيما يعمل به".. وحين أرسل أبو موسى الأشعري الى العراق قال له: " انك تأتي قوما لهم في مساجدهم دويّ القرآن كدويّ النحل، فدعهم على ما هم عليه، ولا تشغلهم بالحديث، وأنا شريكك في ذلك".. كان القرآن قد جمع بطريقة مضمونة دون أن يتسرب اليه ما ليس منه.. اما الأحاديث فليس يضمن عمر أن تحرّف أو تزوّر، أو تخذ سبيل للكذب على رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم، والنيل من الاسلام.. وكان أبو هريرة يقدّر وجهة نظر عمر، ولكنه أيضا كان واثقا من نفسه ومن أمانته، وكان لا يريد أن يكتم من الحديث والعلم ما يعتقد أن كتمانه اثم وبوار. وهكذا.. لم يكن يجد فرصة لافراغ ما في صدره من حديث سنعه ووعاه الا حدّث وقال.. 
** 
على أن هناك سببا هامّا، كان له دور في اثارة المتاعب حول أبي هريرة لكثرة تحدثه وحديثه. ذلك أنه كان هناك يومئذ محدّث آخر يحدّث عن الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم ويكثر ويسرف، ولم يكن المسلمون الأصحاب يطمئنون كثيرا لأحاديثه ذلكم هو كعب الأحبار الذي كان يهوديا وأسلم. 
** 
أراد مروان بن الحكم يوما أن يبلو مقدرة أبي هريرة على الحفظ، فدعاه اليه وأجلسه معه، وطلب منه أن يحدثه عن رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم، في حين أجلس كاتبه وراء حجاب، وأمره أن يكتب كل ما يقول أبو هريرة.. وبعد مرور عام، دعاه مروان بن الحكم مرة أخرى، أخذ يستقرئه نفس الأحاديث التي كان كاتبه قد سطرها، فما نسي أبو هريرة كلمة منها!! وكان يقول عن نفسه: " ما من أحد من أصحاب رسول الله أكثر حديثا عنه مني، الا ما كان من عبدالله بن عمرو بن العاص، فانه كان يكتب، ولا أكتب".. وقال عنه الامام الشافعي أيضا: " أبو هريرة أحفظ من روى الحديث في دهره". وقال البخاري رضي الله عنه: " روي عن أبو هريرة مدرسة كبيرة يكتب لها البقاء والخلود.. وكان أبو هريرة رضي الله عنه من العابدين الأوّابين، يتناوب مع زوجته وابنته قيام الليل كله.. فيقوم هو ثلثه، وتقوم زوجته ثلثه، وتقوم ابنته ثلثله. وهكذا لا تمر من الليل ساعة الا وفي بيت أبي هريرة عبادة وذكر وصلاة!! وفي سبيل أن يتفرّغ لصحبة رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم عانى من قسوة الجوع ما لم يعاني مثله أحد.. وانه ليحدثنا: كيف كان الجوع يعض أمعاءه فيشدّ على بطمه حجرا ويعتصر كبده بيديه، ويسقط في المسجد وهو يتلوى حتى يظن بعض أصحابه أن به صرعا وما هو بمصروع..! ولما أسلم لم يكن يئوده ويضنيه من مشاكل حياته سوى مشكلة واحدة لم يكن رقأ له بسببها جفن.. كانت هذه المشكلة أمه: فانها يومئذ رفضت أن تسلم.. ليس ذلك وحسب، بل كلنت تؤذي ابنها في رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم وتذكره بسوء.. وذات يوم أسمعت أبا هريرة في رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم ما يكره، فانفضّ عنها باكيا محزونا، وذهب الى مسجد الرسول.. ولنصغ اليه وهو يروي لنا بقيّة النبأ: ".. فجئت الى رسول الله وأنا أبكي، فقلت: يا رسول الله، كنت أدعو أم أبي هريرة الى الاسلام فتأبى علي، واني دعوتها اليوم فأسمعتني فيك ما أكره، فادع الله أن يهدي أم أبا هريرةالى الاسلام.. فقال رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم: اللهم اهد أم أبي هريرة.. فخرجت أعدو أبشرها بدعاء رسول الله، فلما أتيت الباب اذا هو مجاف، أي مغلق، وسمعت خضخضة ماء، ونادتني يا أبا هريرة مكانك.. ثم لبست درعها، وعجلت عن خمارها وخرجت وهي تقول: أشهد أن لا اله الا الله، وأِهد أن محمدا عبده ورسوله.. فجئت أسعى الى رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم أبكي من الفرح، كما بكيت من الحزن، وقلت: أبشر يا رسول الله، فقد أجاب الله دعوتك.. قد هدى أم أبي هريرة الى الاسلام.. ثم قلت يا رسول الله: ادع الله أن يحبّبني وأمي الى المؤمنين والمؤمنات.. فقال: اللهم حبّب عبيدك هذا وأمه الى كل مؤمن ومؤمنة".. 
** 
وعاش أبو هريرة عابدا، ومجاهدا.. لا يتخلف عن غزوة ولا عن طاعة. وفي خلافة عمر بن الخطاب رضي الله عنه ولاه امارة البحرين. وعمر كما نعلم شديد المحاسبة لولاته. اذا ولّى أحدهم وهو يملك ثوبين، فيجب أن يترك الولاية وهو لا يملك من دنياه سوى ثوبيه.. ويكون من الأفضل أن يتركها وله ثوب واحد..!!! أما اذا خرج من الولاية وقد ظهرت عليه أعراض الثراء، فآنئذ لا يفلت من حساب عمر، مهما يكن مصدر ثرائه حلالا مشروعا! دنيا أخرى.. ملاءها همر روعة واعجازا..!! وحين وليّ أبو هريرة البحرين ادّخر مالا، من مصادره الحلال، وعلم عمر فدعاه الى المدينة.. ولندع أبو هريرة يروي لنا ما حدث بينهما من حوار سريع: " قال لي عمر: يا عدو الله وعدو كتابه، أسرقت مال الله..؟؟ قلت: ما أنا بعدو لله ولا عدو لكتابه،.. لكني عدو من عاداهما.. ولا أنا من يسرق مال الله..! قال: فمن أين اجتمعت لك عشرة آلاف..؟؟ قلت: خيل لي تناسلت، وعطايا تلاحقت.. قال عمر: فادفعها الى بيت مال المسلمين"..!! ودفع أبو هريرة المال الى عمر ثم رفع يديه الى السماء وقال: اللهم اغفر لأمير المؤمنين".. وبعد حين دعا عمر أبا هريرة، وعرض عليه الولاية من حديد، فأباها واعتذر عنها.. قال له عمر: ولماذا؟ قال أبو هريرة: حتى لا يشتم عرضي، ويؤخذ مالي، ويضرب ظهري.. ثم قال: وأخاف أن أقضي بغير علم وأقول بغير حلم.. 
** 
وذات يوم اشتد شوقه الى لقاء الله.. وبينما كان عوّاده يدعون له بالشفاء من مرضه، كان هو يلحّ على الله قائلا: " اللهم اني أحب لقاءك، فأحب لقائي".. وعن ثماني وسبعين سنة مات في العام التاسع والخمسين للهجرة. ولبن ساكني البقيع الأبرار ب\تبوأ جثمانه الوديع مكانا مباركا.. وبينما كان مشيعوه عائدين من جنازته، كانت ألسنتهم ترتل الكثير من الأحاديث التي حفظها لهم عن رسولهم الكريم. ولعل واحدا من المسلمين الجدد كان يميل على صاحبه ويسأله: لماذا كنّى شيخنا الراحل بأبي هريرة..؟؟ فيجيبه صاحبه وهو الخبير بالأمر: لقد كان اسمه في الجاهلية عبد شمس، ولما أسلك سمّاه الرسول عبدالرحمن.. ولقد كان عطوفا على الحيوان، واكنت له هرة، يطعمها، ويحملها، وينظفها، ويؤويها.. وكانت تلازمه كظله.. وهكذا دعي: أبا هريرة رضي الله عنه وأرضاه..
number-en: The story of Abu Hurairah
label-en:
Abu Hurairah - Memory of the Age of Revelation

It is true that a person's intelligence is counted on him... and those with extraordinary talents often pay the price at the same time they should have received reward and gratitude...!! The great companion Abu Hurairah is one of these.. He had an extraordinary talent in the breadth and strength of his memory.. He, may God be pleased with him, was good at the art of listening, and his memory was good at the art of memorization and storage.. He hears and is conscious, and memorizes, and then he hardly forgets a word or a letter of what he is aware of, no matter how long his life is, or how many days pass by..!! For this reason, his talent prepared him to be the one among the companions of the Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace, who memorized his hadiths the most, and therefore the most narrated of them. When the era of the hypocrites came, who specialized in lying to the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, they took Abu Hurairah as a target, taking the worst advantage of his wide reputation in narrating the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, a subject of suspicion and questioning. Had it not been for those righteous and extraordinary efforts made by the great righteous people, they would have vowed their lives and dedicated them to serving the Prophet’s hadith and banishing all falsehood and extraneous things from it. There, Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, escaped from the octopus of lies and fabrications with which the corruptors wanted to infiltrate Islam through him, and to make him bear the burden and harm of it..!! 
** 
And now... when we hear a preacher, lecturer, or Friday preacher say that well-known phrase: “On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said...” I say: When you hear this name in this way, or when you encounter it many times, and very often in the books of hadith, biography, jurisprudence, and religion in general, know that you are meeting a personality among the Companions who was most tempting to keep company and listen to. This is because his wealth of wonderful hadiths and wise guidance that he preserved from the Prophet, peace be upon him, is rarely matched by anyone else. And he, may God be pleased with him, with what he possesses of this talent and this wealth, is one of the companions most capable of transporting you to those days that the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, and his companions, may God be pleased with them, lived, and to soaring with you, if you are close in faith and sensitive in soul, in those horizons that witnessed the masterpieces of Muhammad and his companions, giving life its meaning, and guiding it to its guidance and guidance. If these lines have stirred your longing to get to know Abu Hurairah and hear from his news, then write down what you want now... He is one of those on whom the wealth of Islam is reflected, with all the tremendous changes it has brought about. From a hired worker to a master.. and from lost in the crowd, to knowledge and an imam..!! And from one who prostrates in front of piled stones, to a believer in God, the One, the All-Mighty... and here he is speaking and saying: “I grew up as an orphan, and I emigrated as a poor person... and I was a hired hand for Busra bint Ghazwan with the food of my stomach..!! I used to serve them when they dismounted, and I used to walk with them when they rode... and here I am, and God has married her to me. Praise be to God, who made the religion a foundation, and made Abu Hurairah an Imam”..! He came to the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, in the year seven of him while he was in Khaybar, and he converted to Islam, willing and longing. Since he saw the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, and pledged allegiance to him, he had hardly ever left him except during hours of sleep. Thus were the four years that he lived with the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, from the time he converted to Islam until the Prophet went to the Supreme Comrade. We say: Those four years were a lifetime alone.. They were long and broad, filled with every good word, deed, and listening. 
** 
Abu Hurairah realized, with his good nature, the great role in which he could serve the religion of God. There are many war heroes among the Companions... and the jurists, preachers, and teachers are many. But the environment and community miss writing and writers. In those eras, the entire human community, not just the Arabs, did not care about writing, and writing was not a sign of progress in any society. Rather, Europe itself was like that not long ago. Most of its kings, led by Charlemagne, were illiterate and could not read or write, although at the same time they were highly intelligent and capable. ** 
We return to our conversation to see that Abu Hurairah innately understood the need of the new society that Islam was building for those who would preserve its heritage and teachings. At that time, there were writers who wrote, but they were few, and some of them did not have enough spare time to record every hadith uttered by the Messenger. Abu Hurairah was not a writer, but he was a memorizer, and he had this leisure, or this desired leisure, for he had no land to cultivate and no trade to pursue!! If he sees himself having converted to Islam late, he resolves to make up for what he missed, by continuing to follow the Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace, and to be with him. Then he knows from himself this talent that God has bestowed on him, which is his vast and strong memory, which increased in light, spaciousness and strength, with the Messenger’s invitation, may God bless him and grant him peace, to its owner that God bless him with it.. So why should he not be one of those who take it upon themselves to preserve this heritage and pass it on to generations..?? Yes.. this is his role that his talents have prepared him to perform, and he must perform it without delay.. 
** 
Abu Hurairah was not one of those who wrote, but as we mentioned, he was quick to memorize and had a strong memory. He had no land to cultivate, nor any trade to occupy him, and therefore he did not leave the Messenger when he was traveling or at home. Thus, he began to devote himself and the precision of his memory to memorizing the hadiths of the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, and his instructions. When the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, moved to the highest companion, Abu Hurairah began speaking, which made some of his companions wonder: How did he get all these hadiths, and when did he hear them and become aware of them? Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, shed light on this phenomenon, and as if he was defending himself from the doubts that some of his companions had, he said: “You say more about Abu Hurairah in his hadiths on the authority of the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace.. And you say: The immigrants who preceded him to Islam did not narrate these hadiths..?? But my companions among the immigrants were preoccupied with their deals in the market, and my companions among the Ansar were preoccupied with their land... And I was a poor prince, more Sitting with the Messenger of God, be present when they are absent, and memorize if they forget. The Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, spoke to us one day and said: Whoever spreads his robe until he finishes speaking to me and then holds it to himself will not forget anything he had heard from me..! So I spread out my mouth and he spoke to me, then I hugged him to me. By God, I had not forgotten anything I heard from him... And by God, if it were not for a verse in the Book of God, I would never have told you anything, which is: (Indeed, those who conceal the proofs and the guidance We have sent down after We have made it clear to the people in the Book - those are cursed by God and cursed by those who curse)...” This is how Abu Hurairah explains the secret of his uniqueness in the abundance of narrations from the Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace. Firstly, he was free. He accompanied the Prophet more than anyone else. Secondly, he had a strong memory, which the Messenger blessed and it increased his strength. Thirdly, he did not narrate out of a desire to narrate, but rather because divulging these hadiths was the responsibility of his religion and his life. Otherwise, he would be concealing goodness and truth, and he was negligent, awaiting the punishment of those who neglected. For this reason, he began narrating and narrating, without an obstacle preventing him from narrating, and no obstacle preventing him from escaping.. until one day Omar, the Commander of the Faithful, said to him: “Let you stop talking about the Messenger of God, or To inject you into the land of Dos.. that is, the land of his people and his people.. However, this prohibition from the Commander of the Faithful does not constitute an accusation against Abu Hurairah, but rather it is a support for a theory that Omar adopted and confirmed, which is: that Muslims in that particular period should not read, and should not memorize anything except the Qur’an until it is approved and established in the hearts and minds.. The Qur’an is the book of God, the constitution of Islam, the dictionary of religion, and the many hadiths about the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, especially in those that followed his death, may God bless him and grant him peace, which Collecting the Qur’an through it may cause unnecessary and useless confusion. For this reason, Omar used to say: “Be occupied with the Qur’an, for the Qur’an is the word of God.” And he said: “Receive the narration from the Messenger of God except in what he does with it.” And when Abu Musa al-Ash’ari was sent to Iraq, he said to him: “You are coming to a people who have the sound of the Qur’an in their mosques like the sound of bees, so leave them as they are, and do not occupy them with hadith, and I am your partner in that.” The Qur’an had been compiled in a reliable way without anything that was not from it leaking into it.. As for the hadiths. Omar does not guarantee that it will be distorted or falsified, or that it will be used to lie to the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, and to undermine Islam. Abu Hurairah appreciated Omar's point of view, but he was also confident of himself and his honesty, and he did not want to conceal hadith and knowledge that he believed was sinful and destructive to conceal. Thus, he did not find an opportunity to empty the hadith that he had heard and understood in his heart, except that he spoke and said.. 
** 
However, there is an important reason, which played a role in causing trouble around Abu Hurairah because of his excessive talk and talk. This is because at that time there was another narrator who spoke about the Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace, and he spoke a lot and was extravagant, and the Muslim companions were not very reassured by his hadiths. This was Ka’b Al-Ahbar, who was a Jew and converted to Islam. ** 
One day, Marwan bin Al-Hakam wanted to test Abu Hurairah’s ability to memorize, so he invited him to him and sat him with him, and asked him to tell him about the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, while his scribe sat him behind a screen, and ordered him to write down everything that Abu Hurairah said. A year later, Marwan bin Al-Hakam invited him again, and he began to read from him the same hadiths that his scribe had written down, and Abu Hurairah did not forget a word of it!! He used to say about himself: “None of the companions of the Messenger of God spoke more about him than me, except for Abdullah bin Amr bin Al-Aas, for he used to write, but I do not write.” Imam Al-Shafi’i also said about him: “Abu Hurairah had the best memory of anyone who narrated hadith in his time.” Al-Bukhari, may God be pleased with him, said: “It was narrated on the authority of Abu Hurairah that a great school was destined for its survival and eternity. Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, was one of the steadfast worshipers. He took turns with his wife and daughter in praying the whole night. He would stand for a third of him, his wife would stand for a third of him, and his daughter would stand for a third of him. Thus, not an hour of the night would pass without worship, remembrance, and prayer in the house of Abu Hurairah. In order to devote himself to the company of the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, he suffered from severe hunger. No one has suffered like him. And he would tell us: How hunger was gnawing at his intestines, causing him to hold a stone in his stomach, squeezing his liver with his hands, and falling in the mosque writhing to the point that some of his companions thought he had epilepsy, but he was not..! When he converted to Islam, none of the problems in his life bothered him or bothered him except for one problem because of which he did not lose his eyelid. This problem was his mother. On that day, she refused to convert to Islam. Not only that, but she used to hurt her son about the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, and used to remind him of bad things. One day, I heard Abu Hurairah say something about the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, and he separated from her, crying and sad, and went to the Prophet’s mosque. Let us listen to him as he narrates the rest of the news to us: “...So I came to the Messenger of God crying, and said: O Messenger of God, I was inviting Abu Hurairah’s mother to Islam, but she refused me, and I invited her today, and she made me hear about you what I hate, so I pray to God to guide Abu Hurairah’s mother to Islam... Then the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: Oh God, guide Abu Hurairah’s mother... So I went out running to give her the good news of a supplication. Messenger of God, when I came to the door, it was empty, that is, closed, and I heard the rushing of water, and she called me, O Abu Hurairah, in your place.. Then she put on her armor, quickly removed her veil, and went out, saying: I bear witness that there is no god but God, and I testify that Muhammad is His servant and His Messenger.. So I came running to the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, crying from joy, just as I cried from sadness, and I said: Good news, O Messenger of God, for God has answered your call. He has guided Abu Hurairah’s mother to Islam. Then I said, O Messenger of God: Pray to God to make me and my mother love the believing men and women. He said: Oh God, make this male and female servant of yours love him. 
** 
Abu Hurairah lived as a worshiper and a mujahideen, never neglecting a campaign or an act of obedience. During the succession of Omar bin Al-Khattab, may God be pleased with him, he appointed him the Emirate of Bahrain. Omar, as we know, was very accountable for his loyalty. If one of them takes office while he owns two clothes, then he must leave the guardianship while he only owns two clothes in this world.. and it would be better for him to leave it while having one dress..!!! But if he leaves the state and shows symptoms of wealth, then he will not escape from Omar’s account, no matter how lawful and lawful the source of his wealth is! Another world.. its fill is full of splendor and miracles..!! When Abu Hurairah took charge of Bahrain, he saved money, from lawful sources, and found out about Omar, so he invited him to Medina. Let us let Abu Hurairah narrate to us a quick conversation that took place between them: “Omar said to me: O enemy of God and enemy of His Book, you have stolen God’s money..? I said: I am neither an enemy of God nor an enemy of His Book.. But I am an enemy of those who are hostile to them.. Nor am I the one who steals God’s money..! He said: Where did you get ten thousand from?? I said: I imagine that you have reproduced, and gifts have followed one another.. Omar said: So give it to the Muslim treasury..!! Abu Hurairah paid the money to Omar, then raised his hands to the sky and said: Oh God, forgive the Commander of the Faithful. After a while, Omar called Abu Hurairah and offered him an iron guardianship, but he refused and apologized for it. Omar said to him: Why? Abu Hurairah said: So that my honor will not be insulted, my money will be taken, and my back will be beaten.. Then he said: I fear that I will judge without knowledge and say without forethought.. 
** 
One day his longing to meet God intensified. While his visitors were praying for him to recover from his illness, he was insisting on God, saying: “Oh God, I love meeting you, so love meeting me.” And at the age of seventy-eight, he died in the fifty-ninth year of the Hijra. May his humble body rest in a blessed place.. While his mourners were returning from his funeral, their tongues were repeating many of the hadiths that he had memorized for them from their noble Messenger. Perhaps one of the new Muslims was leaning towards his friend and asking him: Why did our late sheikh call him Abu Hurairah..?? Then his friend, who is knowledgeable about the matter, answers him: His name in pre-Islamic times was Abd Shams, and when he took his path, the Messenger named him Abd al-Rahman. He was kind to animals, and I had a cat that he fed, carried, cleaned, and housed. It stayed with him like his shadow. Thus, he was called: Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him and pleased with him.
