خالد بن سعيد - فدائيّ، من الرعيل الأول

في بيت وارف النعمة، مزهو بالسيادة، ولأب له في قريش صدارة وزعامة، ولد خالد بن سعيد بن العاص، وان شئتم مزيدا من نسبه فقولوا: ابن اميّة بن عبد شمس بن عبد مناف.. ويوم بدأت خيوط النور تسري في أنحاء مكة على استحياء، هامسة بأن محمدا الأمين يتحدث عن وحي جاءه في غار حراء، وعن رسالة تلقاها من الله ليبلغها الى عباده، كان قلب خالد يلقي للنور الهامس سنعه وهو شهيد..!! وطارت نفسه فرحا، كأنما كان وهذه الرسالة على موعد.. وأخذ يتابع خيوط النور في سيرها ومسراها.. وكلما سمع ملأ من قومه يتحدثون عن الدين الجديد، جلس اليهم وأصغى في حبور مكتوم، وبين الحين والحين يطعّم الحديث بكلمة منه، أو كلمات تدفعه في طريق الذيوع، والتأثير، والايحاء..! كان الذي يراه أنئذ، يبصر شابا هادئ السمت، ذكيّ الصمت، بينما هو في باطنه وداخله، مهرجان حافل بلحركة والفرح.. فيه طبول تدق.. ورايات ترتفع.. وأبواق تدوّي.. وأناشيد تصلي.. وأغاريد تسبّح.. عيد بكل جمال العيد، وبهجة العيد وحماسة العيد، وضجة العيد..!!! وكان الفنى يطوي علىهذا العيد الكبير صدره، ويكتم سرّه، فان أباه لو علم أنه يحمل في سريرته كل هذه الحفاوة بدعوة محمد، لأزهق حياته قربانا لآلهة عبد مناف..!! ولكن أنفسنا الباطنة حين تفعم بأمر، ويبلغ منها حدّ الامتلاء فانها لا تمبك لافاضته دفعا.. وذات يوم.. ولكن لا.. فان انلاهر لم يطلع بعد، وخالد ما زال في نومه اليقظان، يعالج رؤيا شديدة الوطأة، حادة التأثير، نفاذة العبير.. نقول اذن: ذات ليلة، رأى خالد بن سعيد في نومه أنه واقف على شفير نار عظيمة، وأبوه من ورائه يدفعه بكلتا يديه، ويريد أن يطرحه فيها، ثم رأى رسول الله يقبل عليه، ويجذبه بيمينه المباركة من ازاره فيأخذه بعيدا عن النار واللهب.. ويصحو من نومه مزوّدا بخطة العمل في يومه الجديد، فيسارع من فوره الى دار أبي بكر، ويقصّ عليه الرؤيا.. وما كانت الرؤيا بحاجة الى تعبير..د وقال له أبو بكر: " انه الخير أريد لك.. وهذا رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم فاتبعه، فان الااسلام حاجزك عن النار". وينطلق خالد باحثا عن رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم حتى يهتدي الى مكانه فيلقاه، ويسأل النبي عن دعوته، فيجيبه عليه السلام: " تؤمن بالله وحده، ولا تشرك به شيئا.. وتؤمن بمحمد عبده ورسوله.. وتخلع عبادة الأوثان التي لا يسمع ولا تبصر، ولا تضر ولا تنفع".. ويبسط خالد يمينه، فتلقاها يمين رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم في حفاوة، ويقول خالد: " اني أشهد أن لا اله الا الله... وأشهد أن محمدا رسول الله"..!! وتنطلق أغاريد نفسه وأناشيدها.. ينطلق لمهرجان كله الذي كان في باطنه.. ويبلغ النبأ أباه. 
** 
يوم أسلم سعيد، لم يكن قد سبقه الى الاسلام سور اربعة أو خمسة،فهو اذن من الخمسة الأوائل المبكرين الى الاسلام. وحين يباكر بالاسلام واحد من ولد سعيد بن العاص، فان ذلك في رأي سعيد، عمل يعرّضه للسخرية والهوان من قريش، ويهز الأرض تحت زعامته. وهكذا دعا اليه خالد، وقال له:" أصحيح أنك اتبعت محمدا وأنت تسمعه يهيب آلهتنا"..؟؟ قال خالد: " انه والله لصادق.. ولقد آمنت به واتبعته".. هنالك انهال عليه أبوه ضربا، ثم زجّ به في غرفة مظلمة من داره، حيث صار حبيسها، ثم راح يضنيه ويرهقه جوعا وظكأ.. وخالد يصرخ فيهم من وراء الباب المغلق عليه: " والله انه لصادق، واني به لمؤمن". وبدا لسعيد أن ما أنزل بولده من ضرر لا يكفي، فخرج به الى رمضاء مكة، حيث دسّه بين حجارتها الثقيلة الفادحة الملتهبة ثلاثة أيام لا يواريه فيها ظل..!! ولا يبلل شفتيه قطرة ماء..!! ويئس الوالد من ولده، فعاد به الى داره، وراح يغريه، ويرهبه.. يعده، ويتوعّده.. وخالد صامد كالحق، يقول لأبيه: " لن أدع الاسلام لشيء، وسأحيا به وأموت عليه".. وصاح سعيد: " اذن فاذهب عني يا لكع، فواللات لأمنعنّك القوت".. وأجابه خالد: ".. والله خير الرازقين"..!! وغادر الدار التي تعجّ بالرغد، من مطعم وملبس وراحة.. غادرها الى الخصاصة والحرمان.. ولكن أي بأس..؟؟ أليس ايمانه معه..؟؟ ألم يحتفظ بكل سيادة ضميره، وبكل حقه في مصيره..؟؟ ما الجوع اذن، وما الحرمان، وما العذاب..؟؟ واذا وجد انسان نفسه مع حق عظيم كهذا الحق الذي يدعو اليه محمد رسول الله، فهل بقي في العالم كله شيء ثمين لم يمتلكه من ربح نفسه في صفقة، الله صاحبها وواهبها...؟؟ وهكذا راح خالد بن سعيد يقهر العذاب بالتضحية، ويتفوق على الحرمان بالايمان.. وحين أمر رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم أصحابه المؤمنين بالهجرة الثانية الى الحبشة، كان خالد بن سعيد، ممن شدّوا رحالهم اليها.. ويمكث خالد هناك الى ما شاء الله ان يمكث، ثم يعود مع اخوانه راجعين الى بلادهم، سنة سبع، فيجدون المسلمين قد فرغوا لتوهم من فتح خيبر.. ويقيم خالد بالمدينة وسط المجتمع المسلم الجديد الذي كان أحد الخمسة الأوائل الذين شهدوا ميلاده، وأسسوا بناءه، ولا يغزو النبي غزوة، ولا يشهد مشهدا، الا وخالد بن سعيد من السابقين.. وكان خالد بسبقه الى الاسلام، وباستقامة ضميره ونهجه موضع الحب والتكريم.. كان يحترم اقتناعه فلا يزيفه ولا يضعه موضع المساومة. قبل وفاة الرسول جعله عليه السلام واليا على اليمن.. ولما ترامت اليه أنباء استخلاف أبي بكر، ومبايعته غادر عمله قادما الى المدينة.. وكانه يعرف لأبي بكر الفضل الذي لا يطاول.. بيد أنه كان يرى أن أحق المسلمين بالخلافة واحد من بين هاشم: العباس مثلا، أو عليّ ابن أبي طالب.. ووقف الى جانب اقتناعه فلم يبايع أبا بكر.. وظل أبو بكر على حبه له، وتقديره اياه لا يكرهه على أن يبايع، ولا يكرهه لأنه لم يبايع، ولا يأتي ذكره بين المسلمين الا أطراه الخليفة العظيم، وأثنى عليه بما هو أهله.. ثم تغيّر اقتناع خالد بن سعيد، فاذا هو يشق الصفوف في المسجد يوما وأبو بكر فوق المنبر، فيبايعه بيعة صادقة وثقى.. 
** 
ويسيّر أبا بكر جيوشه الى الشام، ويعقد لخالد بن سعيد لواء، فيصير أحد أمراء الجيش.. ولكن يحدث قبل أن تتحرك القوات من المدينة أن يعارض عمر في امارة خالد بن سعيد، ويظل يلح على الخليفة أن يغيّر قراره بشأن امارة خالد.. ويبلغ النبأ خالد، فلا يزيد على قول: " والله ما سرّتنا ولايتكم، ولا ساءنا عزلكم"..!! ويخفّ الصدّيق رضي الله عنه الى دار خالد معتذرا له، ومفسرا له موقفه الجديد، ويسأله مع من من القوّاد والأمراء يجب أن يكون: مع عمرو بن العاص وهو ابن عمه، أ/ مع شرحبيل بن حسنة؟ فيجيب خالد اجابة تنمّ على عظمة نفسه وتقاها: " ابن عمّي أحبّ اليّ في قرابته، وشرحبيل أحبّ في أحبّ اليّ في دينه".. ثم اختار أن يكون جنديا في كتيبة شرحبيل بن حسنة.. ودعا ابو بكر شرحبيل اليه قبل أ، ستحرّك الجيش، وقال له: " انظر خالد بن سعيد، فاعرف له من الحق عليك، مثل مل كنت تحبّ أن يعرف من الحق لك، لو كنت مكانه، وكلن مكانك.. انك لتعرف مكانته في الاسلام.. وتعلم أن رسول الله توفى وهو له وال.. ولقد كنت وليته ثم رأيت غير ذلك.. وعسى أن يكون ذلك خيرا له في دينه، فما أغبط أحد بالامارة..!! وقد خيّرته في أمراء الجند فاختارك على ابن عمّه.. فاذا نزل بك أمر تحتاج فيه الى رأي التقي الناصح، فليكن أول من تبدأ به: أبو عبيدة بن الجرّاح، ومعاذ بن جبل.. وليك خالد بن سعيد ثالثا، فانك واجد عندهم نصحا وخيرا.. واياك واستبداد الرأي دونهم، أو اخفاءه عنهم".. وفي موقعه مرج الصفر بأرض الشام، حيث كانت المعارك تدور بين المسلمين والروم، رهيبة ضارية، كان في مقدمة الذين وقع أجرهم على اله، شهيد جليل، قطع طريق حياته منذ شبابه الباكر حتى لحظة استشهاده في مسيرة صادقة مؤمنة شجاعة.. ورآه المسلمون وهم يفحصون شهداء المعركة، كما كان دائما، هادئ الّمت، ذكي الصمت، قوي التصميم، فقاول: " اللهم ارض عن خالد بن سعيد"..!!
number-en: The story of Khaled bin Saeed
label-en:
Khaled bin Saeed - guerrilla, from the first generation

In a house full of grace, proud of his sovereignty, and with a father of Quraysh preeminence and leadership, Khalid bin Saeed bin Al-Aas was born, and if you want more of his lineage, say: Ibn Umayyah bin Abd Shams bin Abd Manaf... And on the day the threads of light began to timidly spread throughout Mecca, whispering that Muhammad Al-Amin was talking about a revelation that came to him in the cave of Hira, and about a message that he received from God to convey to his servants, Khaled’s heart was casting light. The whisperer is a martyr..!! His soul was filled with joy, as if this message was on time... and he began to follow the threads of light in their movement and path... Whenever he heard members of his people talking about the new religion, he would sit down and listen in silent awe, and every now and then he would pepper the conversation with a word of his own, or words that would push it on the path of dissemination, influence, and revelation...! What he saw at that time was a young man with a calm disposition, intelligent silence, while inside him and inside him, he was a festival full of movement and joy... with drums beating... banners rising... trumpets sounding... chants of prayer... and songs of praise... Eid with all the beauty of Eid, the joy of Eid, the enthusiasm of Eid, and the noise of Eid..!!! Al-Fanni was holding this great holiday close to him and keeping his secrets. If his father knew that he was carrying all this warmth in his heart due to Muhammad’s call, he would have sacrificed his life as an offering to the gods of Abd Manaf..!! But when our inner self is filled with something, and it reaches the point of being full, it does not cry to overflow it.. And one day.. but no.. Annihil has not yet risen, and Khaled is still in his awake sleep, dealing with a vision that is extremely heavy, intense in its impact, and strong in scent.. So we say: One night, Khaled bin Saeed saw in his sleep that he was standing on the brink of a great fire, and his father was behind him, pushing him with both hands and wanting to throw him into it. Then he saw the Messenger of God approaching him, pulling him with his blessed right hand by his garment and taking him away from the fire and flame... He woke up from his sleep equipped with a plan of action for his new day, so he immediately rushed to Abu Bakr’s house, and told him the vision... and the vision did not need anything else. Expression..d. Abu Bakr said to him: “It is the best thing I want for you...and this is the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, so follow him, for Islam is your protection from Hell.” Khaled goes off in search of the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, until he is guided to his place and meets him. He asks the Prophet about his call, and he, peace be upon him, answers him: “You believe in God alone, and do not associate anything with Him... and you believe in Muhammad, His servant and Messenger... and you abandon the worship of idols that neither hear nor see, nor do harm or benefit.” Khaled extends his right hand, and the right hand of the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, receives it with warmth, and Khaled says: “I bear witness.” There is no god but God... and I bear witness that Muhammad is the Messenger of God..!! And his soul's songs and chants begin... He goes off to celebrate the whole thing that was inside him... and the news reaches his father. ** 
On the day Saeed converted to Islam, there were no four or five surahs before him to convert to Islam, so he is one of the first five early converts to Islam. When one of the sons of Saeed bin Al-Aas converts to Islam early, this, in Saeed’s opinion, is an act that exposes him to ridicule and humiliation from the Quraysh, and shakes the ground under his leadership. Thus, Khaled called him and said to him: “Is it true that you followed Muhammad while you heard him reverence our gods?”..?? Khaled said: “By God, he is truthful... and I believed in him and followed him.” There, his father beat him, then threw him into a dark room in his house, where he became confined, and then began to wear him down and exhaust him from hunger and deprivation. Khaled shouted at them from behind the closed door: “By God, he is truthful, and I am a believer in him.” It seemed to Saeed that the harm he had inflicted on his son was not enough, so he took him to Ramadan in Mecca, where he buried him among its heavy, heavy, burning stones for three days without a shadow covering him..!! Not a drop of water wets his lips..!! The father despaired of his son, so he brought him back to his home, and began to tempt him and terrorize him... promising him, threatening him... and Khaled was steadfast as the truth, saying to his father: “I will not abandon Islam for anything, and I will live by it and die by it.” Saeed shouted: “Then go away from me, you idiot, for by God I will prevent you from sustenance.” And Khaled answered him: “... And God is the Best of Providers..!! And he left the house full of prosperity, food, clothing, and comfort.. He left it for poverty and deprivation.. But what harm..?? Isn’t his faith with him..?? Didn’t he retain all the sovereignty of his conscience, and all his right to his fate..?? What then is hunger, what is deprivation, and what is torment..?? And if a person finds himself with a great right like this right that Muhammad, the Messenger of God, calls for, does he remain in The whole world is a precious thing that was not possessed by the one who won his soul in a deal. God is the owner and giver of it...? When the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, ordered his faithful companions to undertake the second migration to Abyssinia, Khalid bin Saeed was among those who set out on their journey there. Khaled stayed there for as long as God wished for him to stay, then returned with his brothers to their country in the year seven, and they found the Muslims had just finished conquering Khaybar. Khaled resided in Medina in the midst of the new Muslim community, which was one of the first five who witnessed his birth and founded its building, and the Prophet did not invade. A battle, and no one would witness a scene except Khalid bin Saeed, one of the first. Khaled was loved and honored by his early conversion to Islam, his upright conscience and his approach. He respected his conviction and did not falsify it or put it in a position of bargaining. Before the death of the Messenger, peace be upon him, he made him governor of Yemen. When news reached him of Abu Bakr’s succession and his pledge of allegiance, he left his work and came to Medina. As if he knew Abu Bakr’s unsurpassable credit. However, he believed that the Muslims most deserving of the caliphate was one among Hashim: Al-Abbas, for example, or Ali Ibn Abi Talib. He stood by his conviction and did not pledge allegiance to Abu Bakr. Abu Bakr continued his love for him and his appreciation for him. He did not force him to pledge allegiance, nor did he hate him because he did not pledge allegiance. He would not be mentioned among the Muslims except that the great Caliph praised him and praised him for what he deserved. Then Khalid bin Saeed’s conviction changed, and one day he was crossing the rows in the mosque and Abu Bakr was on the pulpit, so he pledged allegiance to him with a sincere and trustworthy pledge of allegiance. 
** 
Abu Bakr marches his armies to the Levant, appoints Khalid bin Saeed as a general, and becomes one of the army’s amirs. But it happens that before the forces move from Medina, he opposes Omar regarding the emirate of Khaled bin Saeed, and continues to insist on the Caliph to change his decision regarding the emirate of Khalid. The news was conveyed to Khalid, and he did not go beyond saying: “By God, we are not pleased with your mandate, and we are not displeased with your isolation”..!! Al-Siddiq, may God be pleased with him, goes to Khaled’s house, apologizing to him, explaining his new position, and asking him who of the commanders and princes he should be with: with Amr bin Al-Aas, who is his cousin, or with Sharhabeel bin Hasna? Khaled gives an answer that reflects his greatness and piety: “My cousin is dearest to me in his kinship, and Sharhabeel is dearest to me in his religion.” Then he chose to be a soldier in the Sharhabeel bin Hasna battalion. Abu Bakr called Sharhabeel to him before the army moved, and he said to him: “Look at Khalid bin Saeed, and find out who has a right over you, just as you would have liked him to know who has a right over you, if you were in his place, and everyone is in your place.. You know his position in Islam.. and you know that the Messenger of God died while he was his.. and I was his guardian and then I saw otherwise.. and perhaps that will be good for him in his religion, so no one would be happy with the leadership..!! And I gave him the choice. Among the commanders of the soldiers, he chose you over his cousin.. If a matter befalls you in which you need the opinion of a pious and advised person, let the first person to start with be: Abu Ubaidah bin al-Jarrah and Muadh bin Jabal.. Thirdly, Khalid bin Saeed, for you will find advice and goodness with them... and beware of tyrannizing opinion against them, or concealing it from them.”... And in his location, Marj Al-Safar in the land of the Levant, where the battles were taking place between the Muslims and the Romans, terrible and fierce, he was at the forefront of those whose reward fell upon his God, a venerable martyr, who crossed the path of his life from his early youth until the moment of his martyrdom in an honest, faithful and courageous path... and the Muslims saw him as they examined him as martyrs. The battle was, as it always was, calm and painful, smart in silence, and strong in determination, so he said: “Oh God, protect me from Khalid bin Saeed”..!!

زيد بن حارثة - لم يحبّ حبّه أحد

وقف رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم يودع جيش الاسلام الذاهب لملاقاة الروم في غزوة مؤتة ويعلن أسماء أمراء الجيش الثلاثة، قائلا: " عليكم زيد بن حارئة.. فان أصيب زيد فجعفر بن أبي طاب.. فان أصيب جعفر، فعبدالله بن رواحة". فمن هو زيد بن حارثة"..؟؟ من هذا الذي حمل دون سواه لقب الحبّ.. حبّ رسول الله..؟ أما مظهره وشكله، فكان كما وصفه المؤرخون والرواة: " قصير، آدم، أي أسمر، شديد الأدمة، في أنفه فطس".. أمّا نبؤه، فعظيم جدّ عظيم..!! 
** 
أعدّ حارثة أبو زيد الراحلة والمتاع لزوجته سعدى التي كانت تزمع زيارة أهلها في بني معن. وخرج يودع زوجته التي كانت تحمل بين يديها طفلهما الصغير زيد بن حارثة، وكلما همّ أن يستودعهما القافلة التي خرجت الزوجة في صحبتها ويعود هو الى داره وعمله، ودفعه حنان خفيّ وعجيب لمواصلة السير مع زوجته وولده.. لكنّ الشقّة بعدت، والقافلة أغذّت سيرها، وآن لحارثة أن يودّع الوليد وأمّه، ويعود.. وكذا ودّعهما ودموعه تسيل.. ووقف طويلا مسمرا في مكانه حتى غابا عن بصره، وأحسّ كأن قلبه لم يعد في مكانه.. كأنه رحل مع الراحلين..!! 
** 
ومكثت سعدى في قومها ما شاء الله لها أن تمكث.. وذات يوم فوجئ الحيّ، حي بني معن، باحدى القبائل المناوئة له تغير عليه، وتنزل الهزيمة ببني معن، ثم تحمل فيما حملت من الأسرى ذلك الطفل اليفع، زيد بن حارثة.. وعادت الأم الى زوجها وحيدة. ولم يكد حارثة يعرف النبأ حتى خرّ صعقا، وحمل عصاه على كاهله، ومضى يجوب الديار، ويقطع الصحارى، ويسائل القبائل والقوافل عن ولده وحبّة قلبه زيد، مسايّا نفسه، وحاديا ناقته بهذا الشعر الذي راح ينشده من بديهته ومن مآقيه: بكيت على زيد ولم ادر ما فعل أحيّ فثرجى؟ أم أتى دونه الأجل فوالله ما أدري، واني لسائل أغالك بعدي السهل؟ أم غالك الجبل تذكرينه الشمس عنج طلوعها وتعرض ذكراه اذا غربع\ها أفل وان هبّت الأرواح هيّجن ذكره فيا طول حزني عليه، ويا وجل 
** 
كان الرّق في ذلك الزمان البعيد يفرض نفسه كظرف اجتماعي يحاول أن يكون ضرورة.. كان ذلك في أثينا، حتى في أزهى عصور حريّتها ورقيّها.. وكذلك كان في روما.. وفي العالم القديم كله.. وبالتالي في جزيرة العرب أيضا.. وعندما اختطفت القبيلة المغيرة على بني معن نصرها، وعادت حاملة أسراها، ذهبت الى سوق عكاظ التي كانت منعقدة أنئذ، وباعوا الأسرى.. ووقع الطفل زيد في يد حكيم بن حزام الذي وهبه بعد أن اشتراه لعمته خديجة. وكانت خديجة رضي الله عنها، قد صارت زوجة لمحمد بن عبدالله، الذي لم يكن الوحي قد جاءه بعد. بيد أنه كان يحمل كل الصفات العظيمة التي أهلته بها الأقدار ليكون غدا من المرسلين.. ووهبت خديجة بدورها خادمها زيد لزوجها رسول اله فتقبله مسرورا وأعتقه من فوره،وراح يمنحه من نفسه العظيمة ومن قلبه الكبير كل عطف ورعاية.. وفي أحد مواسم الحج. التقى تفر من حيّ حارثة بزيد في مكة، ونقلوا اليه لوعة والديه، وحمّلهم زيد سلامه وحنانه وشوقه لأمه وأبيه، وقال للحجّاج من قومه" " أخبوا أبي أني هنا مع أكرم والد".. ولم يكن والد زيد يعلم مستقر ولده حتى أغذّ السير اليه، ومعه أخوه.. وفي مكة مضيا يسألان عن محمد الأمين.. ولما لقياه قالا له: "يا بن عبدالمطلب.. يا لن سيّد قومه، أنتم أهل حرم، تفكون العاني، وتطعمون الأسير.. جئناك في ولدنا، فامنن علينا وأحسن في فدائه".. كان الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم يعلم تعلق زيد به، وكان في نفس الوقت يقدّر حق ابيه فيه.. هنالك قال حارثة: "ادعوا زيدا، وخيّروه، فان اختاركم فهو لكم بغير فداء.. وان اختارني فوالله ما أنا بالذي أختار على من اختارني فداء"..!! وتهلل وجه حارثة الذي لك يكن يتوقع كل هذا السماح وقال: " لقد أنصفتنا، وزدتنا عن النصف".. ثم بعث النبي صلى الله عليه وسلم الى زيد، ولما جاء سأله: " هل تعرف هؤلاء"..؟ قال زيد: نعم.. هذا أبي.. وهذا عمّي. وأعاد عليه الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم ما قاله لحارثة.. وهنا قال زيد: " ما أنا بالذي أختار عليك أحدا، أنت الأب والعم"..!! ونديت عينا رسول الله بدموعشاكرة وحانية، ثم أمسك بيد زيد، وخرج به الى فناء الكعبة، حيث قريش مجتمعة هناك، ونادى الرسول: " اشهدوا أن زيدا ابني.. يرثني وأرثه"..!! وكاد قلب حارثة يطير من الفرح.. فابنه لم يعد حرّا فحسب، بل وابنا للرجل الذي تسمّيه قريش الصادق الأمين سليل بني هاشم وموضع حفاوة مكة كلها.. وعاد الأب والعم الى قومهما، مطمئنين على ولدهما والذي تركاه سيّدا في مكة، آمنا معافى، بعد أن كان أبوه لا يدري: أغاله السهل، أم غاله الجبل..!! 
** 
تبنّى الرسول زيدا.. وصار لا يعرف في مكة كلها الا باسمه هذا زيد بن محمد.. وفي يوم باهر الشروق، نادى الوحي محمدا: ( اقرأ باسم ربك الذي خلق خلق الإنسان من علق اقرأ وربك الأكرم الذي علم بالقلم علم الإنسان ما لم يعلم)... ثم تتابعت نجاءاته وكلماته: ( يا أيها المدثر قم فأنذر وربك فكبر وثيابك فطهر)... (ياأيها الرسول بلغ ما أنزل إليك من ربك وإن لم تفعل فما بلغت رسالته والله يعصمك من الناس إن الله لا يهدي القوم الكافرين)... وما ان حمل رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم تبعة الرسالة حتى كان زيد ثاني المسلمين.. بل قيل انه كان أول المسلمين...!! 
** 
أحبّه رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم حبا عظيما، وكان بهذا الحب خليقا وجديرا.. فوفاؤه الذي لا نظير له، وعظمة روحه، وعفّة ضميره ولسانه ويده... كل ذلك وأكثر من ذلك كان يزين خصال زيد بن حارثة أو زيد الحبّ كما كان يلقبه أصحاب رسول الله عليه الصلاة والسلام.. تقول السيّدة عائشة رضي الله عنها: " ما بعث الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم في جيش قط الا أمّره عليهم، ولو بقي حيّا بعد رسول اللهلاستخلفه... الى هذا المدى كانت منزلة زيد عند رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم.. فمن كان زيد هذا..؟؟ انه كما قلنا ذلك الطفل الذي سبي، ثم بيع، ثم حرره الرسول وأعتقه.. وانه ذلك الرجال القصير، الأسمر، الأفطس الأنف، بيد أنه أيضا ذلك الانسان الذي" قلبه جميع وروحه حر".. ومن ثم وجد له في الاسلام، وفي قلب رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم أعلى منزلة وأرفع مكان، فلا الاسلام ولا رسوله من يعبأ لحظه بجاه النسب، ولا بوجاهة المظهر. ففي رحاب هذا الدين العظيم، يتألق بلال، ويتألق صهيب، ويتألق عمار وخبّاب وأسامة وزيد... يتألقون جميعا كأبرا، وقادة.. لقد صحح الاسلام قيم الاسلام، قيم الحياة حين قال في كتابه الكريم: ( انّ أكرمكم عند الله أتقاكم)... وفتح الأبواب والرحاب للمواهب الخيّرة، وللكفايات النظيفة، الأمينة، المعطية.. وزوّج رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم زيدا من ابنة عمته زينب، ويبدو أن زينب رضي الله عنها قد قبلت هذا الزواج تحت وطأة حيائها أن ترفض شفاعة رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم، أو ترغب بنفسها عن نفسه.. ولكن الحياة الزوجية أخذت تتعثر، وتستنفد عوامل بقائها، فانفصل زيد عن زينب. وحمل الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم مسؤوليته تجاه هذا الزواج الذي كان مسؤولا عن امضائه، والذي انتهى بالانفصال، فضمّ ابنة عمته اليه واختارها زوجة له، ثم اختار لزيد زوجة جديدة هي أم كلثوم بنت عقبة.. وذهب الشنئون يرجفون المدينة: كيف يتزوّج محمد مطلقة ابنه زيد؟؟ فأجابهم القرآن مفرّقا بين الأدعياء والأبنياء.. بين التبني والبنّوة، ومقررا الغاء عادة التبني، ومعلنا: ( "مَا كَانَ مُحَمدٌ أَبَا أَحَدٍ مِن رِجَالِكُمْ وَلَكِن رَسُولَ اللِّه وَخاَتم النَبِيِّينَ وَكَانَ اللَّهُ بِكُل شَيءٍ عَليِماً"). وهكذا عاد لزيد اسمه الأول:" زيد بن حارثة". 
** 
والآن.. هل ترون هذه اقوات المسلمة الخارجة الى معارك، الطرف، أو العيص، وحسمي، وغيرها.. ان أميرها جميعا، هو زيد بن حارثة.. فهو كما سمعنا السيدة عائشة رضي الله عنها تقول:" لم يبعثه النبي صلى الله عليه وسلم في جيش قط، الا جعله أميرا هلى هذا الجيش".. حتى جاءت غزوة مؤتة.. كان الروم بأمبراطوريتهم الهرمة، قد بدأوا يوجسون من الاسلام خيفة..بل صاروا يرون فيها خطرا يهدد وجودهم، ولا سيما في بلاد الشام التي يستعمرونها، والتي تتاخم بلاد هذا الدين الجديد، المنطلق في عنفوان واكتساح.. وهكذا راحوا يتخذون من الشام نقطة وثوب على الجزيرة العربية، وبلاد الاسلام... 
** 
وأدرك رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم هدف المناوشات التي بدأها الروم ليعجموا بها عود الاسلام، فقرر أن يبادرهم، ويقنعهم بتصميم الاسلام الى أرض البلقاء بالشام، حتى اذا بلغوا تخومها لقيتهم جيوش هرقل من الروم ومن القبائل المستعربة التي كانت تقطن الحدود.. ونزل جيش الروم في مكان يسمّى مشارف.. في حين نزل جيش الاسلام يجوار بلدة تسمّى مؤتة، حيث سمّيت الغزوة باسمها... 
** 
كان رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم يدرك أهمية هذه الغزوة وخطرها فاختار لها ثلاثة من الرهبان في الليل، والفرسان في النهار.. ثلاثة من الذين باعوا أنفسهم لله فلم يعد لهم مطمع ولا أمنية الا في استشهاد عظيم يصافحون اثره رضوان الله تعالى، ويطالعون وجهه الكريم.. وكان هؤلاء الثلاثة وفق ترتيبهم في امارة الجيش هم: زيد بن حارثة، جعفر بن أبي طالب، عبدالله بن رواحة. رضي الله عنهم وأرضاهم، ورضي الله عن الصحابوة أجمعين... وهكذا رأينا رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم عندما وقف يودّع الجيش يلقي أمره السالف: " عليكم زيد بن حارثة.. فان أصيب زيد، فجعفر بن أبي طالب،... فان أصيب جعفر، فعبدالله بن رواحة"... وعلى الرغم من أن جعفر بن أبي طالب كان من أقرب الناس الى قلب ابن عمّه رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم.. وعلى الرغم من شجاعته، وجسارته، وحسبه ونسبه، فقد جعله رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم الأمير التالي لزيد، وجعل زيدا الأمير الأول للجيش... وبمثل هذا، كان الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم يقرر دوما حقيقة أن الاسلام دين جديد جاء يلغي العلاقات الانسانية الفاسدة، والقائمة على أسس من التمايز الفارغ الباطل، لينشئ مكانها علاقات جديدة، رشيدة، قوامها انسانية الانسان...!!
** 
ولكأنما كان رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم يقرأ غيب المعركة المقبلة حين وضع امراء الجيش على هذا الترتيب: زيد فجعفر، فابن رواحة.. فقد لقوا ربّهم جميعا وفق هذا الترتيب أيضا..!! ولم يكد المسلمون يطالعون جيش الروم الذي حزروه بمائتي ألف مقاتل حتى أذهلهم العدد الذي لم يكن لهم في حساب.. ولكن متى كانت معارك الايمان معارك كثرة..؟؟ هنالك أقدموا ولم يبالوا.. وأمامهم قائدهم زيد حاملا راية رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم، مقتحما رماح العدو زنباله وسيوفه، لا يبحث عن النصر، بقدر ما يبحث عن المضجع الذي ترسو عنده صفقته مع الله الذي اشترى من المؤمنين أنفسهم وأموالهم بأن لهم الجنة. لم يكن زيد يرى حواليه رمال البلقاء، ولا جيوش الروم بل كانت روابي الجنة، ورفرفها الأخضر، تخفق أمام عينيه كالأعلام، تنبئه أن اليوم يوم زفافه.. وكان هو يضرب، ويقاتل، لا يطوّح رؤوس مقاتليه، انما يفتح الأبواب، ويفضّ الأغلاق التي تحول بينه وبين الباب الكبير الواسع، الي سيدلف منه الى دار السلام، وجنات الخلد، وجوار الله.. وعانق زيد مصيره... وكانت روحه وهي في طريقها الى الجنة تبتسم محبورة وهي تبصر جثمان صاحبها، لا يلفه الحرير الناعم، بل يضخّمه دم طهور سال في سبيل الله.. ثم تتسع ابتساماتها المطمئنة الهانئة، وهي تبصر ثاني الأمراء جعفرا يندفع كالسهم صوب الراية ليتسلمها، وليحملها قبل أن تغيب في التراب....
number-en: The story of Zaid bin Haritha
label-en:
Zaid bin Haritha - No one loved him

The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, stood and bid farewell to the army of Islam that was going to meet the Romans in the Battle of Mu’tah and announced the names of the three commanders of the army, saying: “Upon you is Zaid bin Hari’ah... If Zaid is injured, then Ja’far bin Abi Taab... and if Ja’far is wounded, then Abdullah bin Rawahah.” Who is Zaid bin Haritha? “Who is this who alone bore the title of love...Love of the Messenger of God...? As for his appearance and shape, he was as described by historians and narrators: “Short, Adam, that is, dark, thick-skinned, with a snub nose.” As for his prophecy, it is very great..!! 
** 
Haritha Abu Zeid prepared the deceased and the belongings for his wife Saada, who was planning to visit her family in Bani Ma'an. He went out to bid farewell to his wife, who was carrying their young child, Zaid ibn Haritha, in her arms. Whenever he was about to bid farewell to the caravan that his wife had left with, he would return to his home and work. A hidden and amazing tenderness prompted him to continue walking with his wife and child. But the apartment was far away, and the caravan resumed its journey, and it was time for Haritha to bid farewell to the newborn and his mother and return. And so he bid them farewell while his tears flowed. He stood for a long time, fixed in his place until he disappeared from his sight, and he felt as if his heart was no longer in its place... as if he had left with the departed..!! 
** 
Saadi stayed with her people as long as God wished for her to stay.. One day the neighborhood, the neighborhood of Banu Ma’n, was surprised by one of the tribes opposing it attacking it, and the Banu Ma’an was defeated. Then, among the captives she carried, she carried that young child, Zaid ibn Haritha.. and the mother returned to her husband alone. Hardly had Haritha learned the news before he collapsed dumbfounded, carried his staff on his shoulder, and proceeded to roam the lands, cross the deserts, and ask the tribes and caravans about his son and the love of his heart, Zaid. Or has the term come before him? By God, I do not know, and I am asking you if I will make it easy for you after me? Or is the mountain dear to you? You remember the sun at its rising, and its memory is displayed when it sets, and if the spirits blow, its remembrance will be stirred. How long will my grief be for it, and oh Glory be to Him. 
** 
In that distant time, slavery was imposing itself as a social condition that was trying to become a necessity. This was in Athens, even in the most flourishing eras of its freedom and sophistication. And so it was in Rome.. and in the entire ancient world.. and therefore in the Arabian Peninsula as well.. When the tribe raiding the Banu Ma’an kidnapped its victory and returned carrying its captives, it went to the Okaz market that was in session at that time, and they sold the captives. The child Zaid fell into the hands of Hakim bin Hizam, who gave him away after buying him for his aunt Khadija. Khadija, may God be pleased with her, had become the wife of Muhammad bin Abdullah, to whom the revelation had not yet come. However, he had all the great qualities that fate had qualified him to be one of the messengers tomorrow. Khadija, in turn, gave her servant Zaid to her husband, the Messenger of God, so he gladly accepted him and freed him immediately, and began to give him all kindness and care from his great soul and from his great heart.. and in one of the seasons of Hajj. A group of people from the Haritha neighborhood met Zaid in Mecca, and they conveyed to him the grief of his parents. Zaid conveyed to them his peace, affection, and longing for his mother and father, and said to the pilgrims from his people, “Hide my father, for I am here with the most honorable father.” Zaid’s father did not know where his son was staying until he started walking to him, with his brother with him. In Mecca, they went to ask about Muhammad al-Amin. And when they met him, they said to him: “O son of Abd al-Muttalib... O master of his people, you are the people of a sanctuary. You free the slave and feed the captive... We came to you regarding our son, so be gracious to us and do well in ransoming him.” The Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace, was aware of Zaid’s attachment to him, and at the same time he appreciated his father’s right to him. There, Haritha said: “Call Zaid, and give him a choice. If he chooses you, then he is yours without ransom. And if he chooses me, then by God, I am not the one he chooses over the one who chooses me as a ransom.”!! The face of Haritha, who had not expected all this tolerance, lit up and said: “You have done justice to us, and you have given us more than half.” Then the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, sent for Zaid, and when he came, he asked him: “Do you know these people?” Zaid said: Yes, this is my father, and this is my uncle. The Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace, repeated to him what he had said to Haritha. Here Zaid said: “I am not the one who chooses anyone over you, you are the father and the uncle”..!! The eyes of the Messenger of God filled with grateful and tender tears, then he took Zaid’s hand and took him out to the courtyard of the Kaaba, where the Quraysh were gathered there, and the Messenger called out: “Bear witness that Zaid is my son...he inherits from me and I inherit from him”..!! Haritha's heart was almost bursting with joy.. His son was no longer only free, but also the son of the man whom the Quraysh called the Truthful and Trustworthy, the descendant of Banu Hashim and the object of the warmth of all of Mecca.. The father and uncle returned to their people, reassured about their son, whom they had left as master in Mecca. He was safe and sound, after his father did not know whether he was loved by the plain, or by the mountain..!! 
** 
The Messenger adopted Zaid.. and he became known in all of Mecca except by his name, Zaid bin Muhammad.. On a bright day at sunrise, the revelation called to Muhammad: (Read in the name of your Lord who created. He created man from a clot. Read. And your Lord is the Most Generous, who taught with the pen. He taught man what he did not know)... Then his prayers and words continued: (O you who cover up, arise and warn, and your Lord, so enlarge, and your clothes, and purify)... (O Messenger, convey what has been revealed to you from your Lord, and if you do not do so, then you have not conveyed his message. And God will protect you from the people. Indeed, God does not guide the disbelieving people)... And as soon as the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, carried the burden of the message, Zaid was the second of the Muslims.. In fact, it was said that he was the first of the Muslims...!! 
** 
The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, loved him with a great love, and he was worthy and worthy of this love. His unparalleled loyalty, the greatness of his soul, the chastity of his conscience, his tongue, and his hand... All of that and more adorned the qualities of Zaid bin Haritha, or Zaid of love, as the companions of the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, called him. Lady Aisha, may God be pleased with her, says: “The Messenger, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, was never sent into an army except that he commanded it over them, and if he had remained alive after the Messenger of God, he would have succeeded him... To this extent was Zaid’s status with the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him... So who was this Zaid...?? He is, as we said, that child who was taken captive, then sold, then the Messenger freed him and freed him... And he is that short, dark-skinned, snub-nosed man, but he is also that human being. Whose heart is whole and whose spirit is free. Then he found for him in Islam, and in the heart of the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, the highest status and the highest place. Neither Islam nor its Messenger cared about his moment due to the prestige of his lineage, nor the prestige of his appearance. Within the scope of this great religion, Bilal shines, Suhaib shines, and Ammar, Khabbab, Osama, and Zaid shine... They all shine as virtuous people and leaders. Islam has corrected the values ​​of Islam, the values ​​of life, when it said in its noble book: (The most honorable of you in the sight of God is the most pious of you)... and opened doors and spaces for good talents, and for clean, honest, and giving competencies.. The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, married Zaid to the daughter of his paternal aunt Zainab, and it seems that Zainab, may God be pleased with her, accepted this marriage under the pressure of her modesty, to reject the intercession of the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, or to desire her life for him.. But marital life began to falter, and the factors for its survival were exhausted, so Zaid separated from Zainab. The Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace, shouldered his responsibility for this marriage, which he was responsible for signing, and which ended in separation, so he joined his cousin’s daughter to him and chose her as his wife, then he chose for Zaid a new wife, Umm Kulthum bint Uqba.. And the angry people started shaking the city: How could Muhammad marry the divorced woman of his son Zaid?? The Qur’an responded to them, distinguishing between pretenders and sons... between adoption and sonship, and deciding to abolish the custom of adoption, and declaring: “Muhammad is not the father of any of your men, but the Messenger of God and the Seal of the Prophets, and God is in all things.” “Knowing.” Thus, Zaid returned to his first name: “Zaid bin Haritha.” 
** 
Now.. Do you see these Muslim forces going out to the battles of Al-Tarf, Al-Ais, Hasmi, and others? The commander of all of them is Zaid bin Haritha. It is as we heard Mrs. Aisha, may God be pleased with her, say: “The Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, never sent him into an army, except that he made him the commander of this army.” Until the Battle of Mu’tah came... the Romans, with their aging empire, had begun to fear Islam... in fact, they began to see it as a threat to their existence, especially in the Levant, which they colonized, and which bordered the countries of this new religion, emerging with vigour. And sweep... and thus they began to take the Levant as a jumping off point on the Arabian Peninsula and the countries of Islam... ** 
The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, realized the goal of the skirmishes that the Romans had begun to destroy the return of Islam, so he decided to take the initiative and convince them of the determination of Islam to the land of Balqa in the Levant, until when they reached its borders, they were met by the armies of Heraclius from the Romans and from the Mozarab tribes that were inhabiting the borders... The Roman army camped in a place called the outskirts... while the army of Islam camped next to a town called Mu’tah, where The invasion was named after her... 
** 
The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, was aware of the importance and danger of this raid, so he chose three monks for it at night, and knights during the day. Three of those who sold themselves to God and no longer had any ambition or wish except for a great martyrdom, shaking hands after the satisfaction of God Almighty, and looking at his honorable face.. And these three, according to their order in the leadership of the army, were: Zaid bin Haritha, Jaafar bin Abi Talib, and Abdullah bin Rawahah. May God be pleased with them and please them, and may God be pleased with all the Companions... And thus we saw the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, when he stood bidding farewell to the army, giving his previous order: “On you is Zaid bin Haritha... if Zaid is injured, then Ja’far bin Abi Talib... and if Ja’far is wounded, then Abdullah bin Rawahah”... Although Jaafar bin Abi Talib was one of the people closest to the heart of his cousin, the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace... and despite his courage, boldness, sufficiency and lineage, the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, made him the next prince of Zaid, and made Zaid the first prince of the army... And in this way, the Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace, was always stating the fact that Islam is a new religion that came to abolish corrupt human relations, based on foundations of empty distinction. Falsehood, to create in its place new, rational relationships. Its foundation is human humanity...!!
** 
It is as if the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, was reading the unseen of the coming battle when he placed the commanders of the army in this order: Zaid, Jaafar, then Ibn Rawahah.. They all met their Lord according to this order as well..!! No sooner had the Muslims looked at the Roman army, which they had gathered with two hundred thousand fighters, than they were astonished by the number that they could not calculate.. But when did the battles of faith become battles of many..?? There they came forward and did not care. In front of them is their leader Zaid, carrying the banner of the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, plowing through the enemy’s spears, spears and swords. He is not looking for victory, as much as he is looking for the resting place where his deal with God will be anchored, who bought from the believers their souls and their wealth by granting them Paradise. Zaid did not see around him the sands of Balqa, nor the armies of the Romans. Rather, the hills of Paradise and their green flaps were fluttering before his eyes like flags, informing him that today was his wedding day. He was striking and fighting, not knocking down the heads of his fighters. Rather, he opened the doors and loosened the locks that prevented him from the great, wide door, through which he would enter the abode of peace, the gardens of eternity, and the neighborhood of God... Zaid embraced his fate... and his soul, on its way to Paradise, was smiling sadly as it saw the body of its owner, not wrapped in soft silk, but magnified by the pure blood shed for the sake of God... Then her reassuring, blissful smiles widened, as she You see the second of the princes, Jaafar, rushing like an arrow towards the banner to receive it and carry it before it disappears into the dust....

زيد بن ثابت - جامع القرآن

اذا حملت المصحف بيمينك، واستقبلته بوجهك، ومضيت تتأنق في روضاته اليانعات، سورة سورة، وآية آية، فاعلم أن من بين الذين يدينونك بالشكر والعرفان على هذا الصنع العظيم، رجل كبير اسمه: زيد بن ثابت...!! وان وقائع جمع القرآن في مصحف، لا تذكر الا ويذكر معها هذا الصحابي الجليل.. وحين تنثر زهور التكريم على ذكرى المباركين الذين يرجع اليهم فضل جمع القرآن وترتيبه وحفظه، فان حظ زيد بن ثابت من تلك الزهور، لحظ عظيم.. 

هو أنصاري من الدينة.. وكان سنّه يوم قدمها النبي صلى الله عليه وسلم مهاجرا، احدى عشرة سنة، وأسلم الصبي الصغير مع المسلمين من أهله، وبورك بدعوة من الرسول له.. وصحبه آباؤه معهم الى غزوة بدر، لكن رسول الله ردّه لصغر سنه وحجمه، وفي غوزوة أحد ذهب مع جماعة من اترابه الى الرسول يحملون اليه ضراعتهم كي يقبلهم في أي مكان من صفوف المجاهدين.. وكان أهلوهم أكثر ضراعة والحاحا ورجاء.. ألقى الرسول على الفرسان الصغار نظرة شاكرة، وبدا كأنه سيعتذر عن تجنيدهم في هذه الغزوة أيضا.. لكن أحدهم وهو رافع بن خديج، تقدم بين يدي رسول الله، يحمل حربة، ويحركها بيمينه حركات بارعة،وقال للرسول عليه الصلاة والسلام: " اني كما ترى رام، أجيد الرمي فأذن لي".. وحيا الرسول هذه البطولة الناشئة، النضرة، بابتسامة راضية، ثم أذن له.. وانتفضت عروق أتلاتبه.. وتقد ثانيهم وهو سمرة بن جندب، وراح يلوّح في أدب بذراعيه المفتولين، وقال بعض اهله للرسول: " ان سمرة يصرع رافعا".. وحيّاه الرسول بابتسامته الحانية، وأذن له.. كانت سن كل من رافع وسمرة قد بلغت الخامسة عشرة، الى جانب نموهما الجسماني القوي.. وبقي من الأتراب ستة أشبال، منهم زيد بن ثابت، وعبدالله بن عمر.. ولقد راحوا يبذلون جهدهم وضراعتهم بالرجاء تارة، وبالدمع تارة، وباستعراض عضلاتهم تارة.. لكن أعمارهم كانت باكرة، وأجسامهم غضة، فوعدهم الرسول بالغزوة المقبلة.. بدأ زيد مع اخزانه دوره كمقاتل في سبي لالله بدءا من غزوة الخندق، سنة خمس من الهجرة. كانت شخصيته المسلمة المؤمنة تنمو نموّا سريعا وباهرا، فهو لم يبرع كمجاهد فحسب، بل كمثقف متنوع المزايا أيضا، فهو يتابع القرآن حفظا، ويكتب الوحي لرسوله، ويتفوق في العلم والحكمة، وحين يبدأ رسول الله في ابلاغ دعوته للعالم الخارجي كله، وارسال كتبه لملوك الأرض وقياصرتها، يأمر زيدا أن يتعلم بعض لغاتهم فيتعلمها في وقت وجيز.. وهكذا تألقت شخصية زيد بن ثابت وتبوأ في المجتمع مكانا عليّا، وصار موضع احترام المسلمين وتوقيرهم.. يقول الشعبي: " ذهب زيد بن ثابت ليركب، فأمسك ابن عباس بالرّكاب. فقال له زيد: تنحّ يا ابن عم رسول الله.. فأجابه ابن عباس: لا، هكذا نصنع بعلمائنا".. ويقول قبيصة: " كان زيدا رأسا بالمدينة في القضاء، والفتوى والقراءة، والفرائض".. ويقول ثابت بن عبيد: " ما رأيت رجلا أفكه في بيته، ولا أوقر في مجلسه من زيد". ويقول ابن عباس: " لقد علم المحفوظن من أصحاب محمد أن زيد بن ثابت كان من الراسخين في العلم".. ان هذه النعوت التي يرددها عنه أصحابه لتزيدنا معرفة بالرجل الذي تدّخر له المقادير شرف مهمة من أنبل المهام في تاريخ الاسلام كله.. مهمة جمع القرآن.. 
** 
منذ بدأ الوحي يأخذ طريقه الى رسول الله ليكون من المنذرين، مستهلا موكب القرآن والدعوة بهذه الآيات الرائعة.. ( اقرأ باسم ربك الذي خلق، خلق الانسان من علق، اقرأ وربك الأكرم، الذي علم بالقلم، علم الانسان ما لم يعلم).. منذ تلك البداية، والوحي يصاحب رسول الله عليه الصلاة والسلام، ويخف اليه كلما ولّى وجهه شطر الله راجيا نوره وهداه.. وخلال سنوات الرسالة كلها، حيث يفرغ النبي من غزوة ليبدأ بأخرى، وحيث يحبط مكيدة وحربا، ليواجه خصومة بأخرى، وأخرى. وحيث يبني عالما جديدا بكل ما تحمله من الجدّة من معنى.. كان الوحي يتنزل، والرسول يتلو، ويبلّغ، وكان هناك ثلة مباركة تحرّك حرصها على القرآن من أول يوم، فراح بعضهم يحفظ منه ما استطاع، وراح البعض الآخر ممن يجيدون الكتابة، يحتفظون بالآيات مسطورة. وخلال احدى وعشرين سنة تقريبا، نزل القرآن خلالها آية آية، أو آيات، تلو آيات، ملبيا مناسبات النزول وأسبابها، كان أولئك الحفظة، والمسجلون، يوالون عملهم في توفيق من الله كبير.. ولم يجيء القرآن مرة واحدة وجكلة واحدة، لأنه ليس كتابا مؤلفا، ولا موضوعا. انما هو دليل أمة جديدة تبني على الطبيعة، لبنة لبنة، ويوما يوما، تنهض عقيدتها، ويتشكل قلبها، وفكرها، وارادتها وفق مشيئة الهية، لا تفرض نفسها من عل، وانما تقود التجربة البشرية لهذه الأمة في طريق الاقتناع الكامل بهذه المشيئة.. ومن ثمّ، كان لا بد للقرآن أن يجيء منجّما، ومجرأ، ليتابع التجربة في سيرها النامي، ومواقفها المتجددة. وأزماتها المتصديّة. توافر الحفاظ، والكتبة، كما ذكرنا من قبل، على حفظ القرآن وتسجيله،وكان على رأسهم علي ابن ابي طالب، وأبيّ بن كعب، وعبدالله ابن مسعود، وعبدالله بن عباس، وصاحب الشخصية الجليلة التي نتحدث عنها الآن زيد بن ثابت رضي الله عنهم أجمعين.. 
** 
وبعد أن تمّ نزولا، وخلال الفترة الأخيرة من فترات تنزيله، كان الرسول يقرؤه على المسلمين.. مرتبا سوره وآياته. وبعد وفاته عليه الصلاة والسلام شغل المسلمون من فورهم بحروب الردّة.. وفي معركة اليمامة.. التي تحدثنا عنها من قبل خلال حديثنا عن خالد بن الوليد وعن زيد بن الخطاب كان عدد الشهدا من قرّاء القرآن وحفظته كبيرا.. فما كادت نار الردّة تخبو وتنطفئ حتى فزع عمر الى الخليفة أبي بكر رضي الله عنهما راغبا اليه في الحاح أن يسارعوا الى جمع القرآن قبلما يدرك الموت والشهادة بقية القرّاء والحفاظ. واستخار الخليفة ربه.. وشاور صحبه.. ثم دعا زيد بن ثابت وقال له: " انك شاب عاقل لا نتهمك". وأمره أن يبدأ بجمع القرآن الكريم، مستعينا بذوي الخبرة في هذا الموضوع.. ونهض زيد بالعمل الذي توقف عليه مصير الاسلام كله كدين..! وأبلى بلاء عظيما في انجاز أشق المهام وأعظمها، فمضى يجمع الآيات والسور من صدور الحفاظ، ومن مواطنها المكتوبة، ويقبابل، ويعارض، ويتحرّى، حتى جمع القرآن مرتبا ومنسقا.. ولقد زكّى عمله اجماع الصحابة رضي الله عنهم الذين عاشوا يسمعونه من رسولهم صلى الله عليه وسلم خلال سنوات الرسالة جميعها، لا سيّما العلماء منهم والحفاظ والكتبة.. وقال زيد وهو يصوّر الصعوبة الكبرى التي شكلتها قداسة المهمة وجلالها.. " والله لو كلفوني نقل جبل من مكانه، لكان أهون عليّ مما أمروني به من جمع القرآن"..!! أجل.. فلأن يحمل زيد فوق كاهله جبلا، أو جبالا، أرضى لنفسه من أن يخطئ أدنى خطأ، في نقل آية أو اتمام سورة.. كل هول يصمد له ضميره ودينه.. الا خطأ كهذا مهما يكن ضعيفا وغير مقصزد.. ولكن توفيق الله كان معه، كان معه كذلك وعده القائل: ( انا نحن نزلنا الذكر وان له لحافظون).. فنجح في مهمته، وأنجز على خير وجه مسؤوليته وواجبه. 
** 
كانت هذه هي المرحلة الأولى في جمع القرآن.. بيد أنه جمع هذه المرة مكتوبا في أكثر من مصحف.. وعلى لرغم من أن مظاهر التفاوت والاختلاف بين هذه المصاحف كانت شكلية، فان التجربة أكّدت لأصحاب الرسول عليه الصلاة والسلام وجوب توحيدها جميعها في مصحف واحد. ففي خلافة عثمان رضي الله عنه، والمسلمون يواصلون فتوحاتهم وزحوفهم، مبتعدين عن المدين، مغتربين عنها.. في تلك الأيام، والاسلام يستقبل كل يوم أفواجا تلو أفواج من الداخلين فيه، المبايعين اياه، ظهر جليّا ما يمكن أن يفضي اليه تعدد المصاحف من خطر حين بدأت الألسنة تختلف على القرآن حتى بين الصحابة الأقدمين والأولين.. هنالك تقدم الى الخليفة عثمان فريق من الأصحاب رضي الله عنهم على رأسهم حذيفة بن اليمان مفسرين الضرورة التي تحتم توحيد المصحف.. واستخار الخليفة ربه وشاور صحبه.. وكما استنجد أبو بكر الصديق من قبل بزيد بن ثابت، استنجد به عثمان أيضا.. فجمع زيد أصحابه وأعوانه، وجاؤوا بالمصاحف من بيت حفصة بنت عمر رضي الله عنها، وكانت محفوظة لديها، وباشر ويد وصحبه مهمتهم العظيمة الجليلة.. كان كل الذين يعونون زيدا من كتاب الوحي، ومن حفظة القرآن.. ومع هذا فما كانوا يختلفون ، وقلما كانوا يختلفون، الا جعلوا رأي زيد وكلمته هي الحجة والفيصل. 
** 
والآن نحن نقرأ القرآن العظيم ميسّرا، أو نسمعه مرتلا، فان الصعوبات الهائلة التي عاناها الذين اصطنعهم الله لجمعه وحفظه لا تخطر لنا على بال..!! تماما مثل الأهوال التي كابدوها، والأرواح التي بذلوها، وهم يجاهدون في سبيل الله، ليقرّوا فوق الأرض دينا قيّما، وليبددوا ظلامها بنوره المبين..
number-en: The story of Zaid bin Thabit
label-en:
Zaid bin Thabit - the compiler of the Qur’an

If you hold the Qur’an in your right hand, face it with your face, and go on to adorn yourself in its lush gardens, surah by surah, verse by verse, know that among those who extend thanks and gratitude to you for this great work, is a great man named: Zaid bin Thabit...!! And the facts of the compilation of the Qur’an in a Qur’an are not mentioned unless this great companion is mentioned with them.. And when flowers of honor are scattered on the memory of the blessed ones to whom the merit of compiling, arranging and preserving the Qur’an is due, then Zaid bin Thabit’s luck among those flowers is a great luck.. 

He is a supporter of the religion. On the day the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, he was an immigrant, he was eleven years old. The little boy converted to Islam with the Muslims from his family, and he was blessed at the invitation of the Messenger for him. His parents accompanied him to the Battle of Badr, but the Messenger of God turned him back due to his young age and size. In the Battle of Uhud, he went with a group of his peers to the Messenger, bringing to him their prayers so that he would accept them in any place in the ranks of the Mujahideen. Their families were more diligent, urgent, and hopeful. The Messenger gave the young knights a grateful look, and looked as if he was going to apologize for recruiting them in this raid as well.. But one of them, Rafi’ ibn Khadij, came forward before the Messenger of God, carrying a spear and moving it with his right hand in skillful movements. He said to the Messenger, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him: “As you can see, I am an archer. I am good at throwing, so give me permission.” The Messenger saluted this emerging heroism, with a satisfied smile, and then gave him permission. Some of his family told the Messenger: “Samra is struggling with Rafi’.” The Messenger greeted him with a tender smile and gave him permission. The age of both Rafi’ and Samra had reached fifteen, in addition to their strong physical growth. Six cubs remained from the group, including Zaid bin Thabit and Abdullah bin Omar. They began to exert their efforts and supplication, sometimes with hope, with tears at times, and with flexing of their muscles. But their ages were young, and their bodies were young, so the Messenger promised them the next battle. With his guards, Zaid began his role as a fighter in the captivity of God, starting with the Battle of the Trench, in the fifth year of the Hijra. His faithful Muslim personality was growing rapidly and brilliantly. He not only excelled as a mujahid, but also as an intellectual with diverse qualities. He memorized the Qur’an, wrote down the revelations to his Messenger, and excelled in knowledge and wisdom. When the Messenger of God began to communicate his call to the entire outside world and send his books to the kings and tsars of the earth, he ordered Zaid to learn some of their languages, and he learned them in a short time. Thus, Zayd bin Thabit’s personality shone and he became prominent in society. A high place, and became an object of respect and reverence for Muslims. Al-Sha’bi says: “Zayd bin Thabit went to ride, but Ibn Abbas grabbed the stirrup. Zaid said to him: Step aside, cousin of the Messenger of God. Ibn Abbas replied: No, this is what we do with our scholars. These epithets that his companions say about him increase our knowledge of the man for whom the honor of one of the noblest tasks in the entire history of Islam is reserved.. the task of compiling the Qur’an. ** 
Since the revelation began to take its way to the Messenger of God to be among the warners, beginning the procession of the Qur’an and the call with these wonderful verses.. (Read in the name of your Lord who created, He created man from a clot. Read. And your Lord is Most Generous, who taught by the pen. He taught man what he did not know)... From that beginning, revelation accompanied the Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him, and it eased toward him whenever he turned his face toward God, hoping for His light and guidance.. and during all the years of the message, as the Prophet finished his conquest to begin. With another, and as he thwarts a plot and a war, he faces one rivalry with another, and another. Where he builds a new world with all the novelty meaning it carries. Revelation was coming, the Messenger was reciting and conveying, and there was a blessed group whose interest in the Qur’an was stirred from the first day. Some of them began to memorize as much of it as they could, and others who were good at writing began to keep the verses written down. During the course of approximately twenty-one years, during which the Qur’an was revealed verse by verse, or verses, after verses, fulfilling the occasions and reasons for its revelation, those memorizers and recorders carried out their work with great grace from God.. The Qur’an did not come all at once and in one piece, because it is not a composed book, nor a fabricated one. Rather, it is the evidence of a new nation that is building on nature, brick by brick, and day by day, its belief is rising, and its heart, thought, and will are being shaped according to a divine will, which does not impose itself from above, but rather leads the human experience of this nation on the path of complete conviction of this will.. Hence, it was necessary for the Qur’an to come as an astrologer and a guide, to follow the experience in its developing course and renewed positions. And its confronting crises. The availability of memorizers and scribes, as we mentioned before, to memorize and record the Qur’an, and among them were Ali Ibn Abi Talib, Ubayy Ibn Ka’b, Abdullah Ibn Masoud, Abdullah Ibn Abbas, and the great personality we are talking about now, Zaid Ibn Thabit, may God be pleased with them all. 
** 
After it was revealed, and during the last period of its revelation, the Messenger used to recite it to the Muslims... arranging its surahs and verses. After his death, peace and blessings be upon him, the Muslims were immediately occupied with the wars of apostasy... and in the Battle of Al-Yamamah... Which we talked about before during our conversation about Khalid bin Al-Walid and Zaid bin Al-Khattab. The number of martyrs among the reciters and memorizers of the Qur’an was large. The fire of apostasy had hardly faded and been extinguished until Omar went to Caliph Abu Bakr, may God be pleased with them both, urging him urgently to hasten to compile the Qur’an before death and martyrdom overtook the rest of the reciters and memorizers. The Caliph sought advice from his Lord... and consulted with his companions... then he called Zaid bin Thabit and said to him: “You are a sensible young man, and we do not accuse you.” He ordered him to begin collecting the Holy Qur’an, seeking the help of those with expertise in this subject. Zaid carried out the work on which the entire fate of Islam as a religion depended..! He performed a great affliction in accomplishing the most difficult and greatest of tasks. He went on collecting verses and surahs from the issuances of the hadith scholars and from their written sources, examining, examining, and investigating, until he collected the Qur’an in order and order. His work was praised by the consensus of the Companions, may God be pleased with them, who lived to hear it from their Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace, during all the years of the message, especially the scholars among them, the hadith scholars, and the scribes.. Zaid said as he depicted the great difficulty posed by the sanctity of the task. And its majesty.. “By God, if they had ordered me to move a mountain from its place, it would have been easier for me than what they ordered me to do of collecting the Qur’an.” Yes... for Zaid to carry a mountain, or mountains, on his shoulders, he was satisfied with himself not to make the slightest mistake, in quoting a verse or completing a surah... every horror his conscience and religion would endure... except for a mistake like this, no matter how weak and unintentional... but the grace of God was with him, and so was his promise that said: (It is We who sent down the Reminder, and indeed He has guardians)... So he succeeded in his mission, and fulfilled well the face of his responsibility and duty. 
** 
This was the first stage in compiling the Qur’an.. However, this time it was compiled written in more than one Qur’an.. Although the manifestations of disparity and difference between these Qur’an were formal, the experience confirmed to the Companions of the Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace, the necessity of unifying them all in one Qur’an. During the caliphate of Othman, may God be pleased with him, while the Muslims continued their conquests and advances, moving away from Medina, estranging from it... In those days, and Islam received every day groups after groups of those entering it, pledging allegiance to it, the danger that the multiplicity of the Qur’an could lead to became clearly apparent when tongues began to differ over the Qur’an even among the oldest and first companions. There, a group of companions came to Caliph Othman, may God be pleased with them, headed by Hudhayfah bin Al-Yaman, explaining the necessity that necessitated the unification of the Qur’an. The Caliph sought the advice of his Lord and consulted with his companions. Just as Abu Bakr al-Siddiq had previously sought help from Zayd bin Thabit, Othman also sought help from him. So Zaid gathered his companions and his assistants, and they brought the Qur’an from the house of Hafsa bint Omar, may God be pleased with her, which had been kept in her possession. And his companions carried out a great and noble mission. All those who helped Zaid were among the writers of revelation and memorizers of the Qur’an. Despite this, they did not disagree, and they rarely disagreed, except that they made Zaid's opinion and his word the proof and decisive factor. 
** 
Now that we read the Great Qur’an in a simplified form, or hear it recited, the enormous difficulties suffered by those whom God created to compile and preserve it do not occur to us..!! Just like the horrors they endured, and the lives they sacrificed, as they struggled for the sake of God, to establish a valuable religion on earth, and to dispel its darkness with His clear light..
