سهيل بن عمرو - من الطلقاء الى الشهداء

عندما وقع أسيرا بأيدي المسلمين في غزوة بدر اقترب عمر بن الخطاب من رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم وقال: " يا رسول الله.. دعني أنزع ثنيّتي سهيل بن عمرو حتى لا يقوم عليك خطيبا بعد اليوم".. فأجابه الرسول العظيم: " كلا يا عمر.. لا أمثل بأحد، فيمثل الله بي، وان كنت نبيا"..! ثم أدنى عمر منه وقال عليه السلام: " يا عمر.. لعل سهيلا غدا يقف موقفا يسرّك"..!! 
** 
ودارت نبوءة الرسول.. وتحوّل أعظم خطباء قريش سهيل بن عمرو الى خطيب باهرمن خطباء الاسلام.. وتحوّل المشرك اللدود.. الى مؤمن أوّاب، لا تكف عيناه من البكاء من خشية الله..!! وتحوّل واحد من كبار زعماء قرسش وقادة جيوشها الى مقاتل صلب في سبيل الاسلام.. مقاتل عاهد نفسه أن يظل في رباط وجهاد حتى يدركه الموت على ذلك، عسى الله أن يغفر ما تقدم من ذنبه..!! فمن كان ذلك المشرك العنيد، والمؤمن التقي الشهيد..؟؟ 
** 
انه سهيل بن عمرو.. واحد من زعماء قريش المبرّرين، ومن حكمائها وذوي الفطنة والرأي فيها.. وهو الذي انتدبته قريش ليقنع الرسول بالعدول عن دخول مكة عام الحديبية.. ففي أخريات العام الهجري السادس خرج الرسول وأصحابه الى مكة ليزوروا البيت الحرام، وينشؤا عمرة، لا يريدون حربا، وليسوا مستعدين لقتال.. وعلمت قريش بمسيرهم الى مكة، فخرجت لتقطععليهم الطريق، وتصدّهم عن وجهتهم.. وتأزم الموقف، وتوترت الأنفس.. وقال الرسول لأصحابه: " لا تدعوني قريش اليوم الى خطة يسألونني فيها صلة الرحم الا أعطيتهم اياها".. وراحت قريش ترسل رسلها ومندوبيها الى النبي عليه الصلاة والسلام، فيخبرهم جميعا أنه لم يأت لقتال، انما جاء يزور البيت الحرام، ويعظم حرماته: وكلما عاد الى قريش أحد مندوبيها، أرسلوا من بعده آخر أقوى شكيمة، وأشد اقناعا حتى اختاروا عروة بن مسعود الثقفي وكان من أقواهم وأفطنهم.. وظنت قريش أن عروة قادر على اقناع الرسول بالعودة. ولكنه سرعان ما رجع اليهم يقول لهم: " يا معشر قريش.. اني قد جئت كسرى في ملكه، وقيصر في ملكه، والنجاشي في ملكه.. واني والله ما رأيت ملكا قط يعظمه قومه، كما يعظم أصحاب محمد محمدا..!! ولقد رأيت حوله قوما لن يسلموه لسوء أبدا.. فانظروا رأيكم"..!! 
** 
عندئذ آمنت قريش أنه لا جدوى من محاولاتها وقررت أن تلجأ الى المفاوضة والصلح.. واختارت لهذه المهمة أصلح زعمائها لها.. وكان سهيل بن عمرو.. رأى المسلمون سهيلا وهو مقبل عليهم فعرفوه، وأدركوا أن قريشا آثرت طريق التفاهم والمصالحة، ما دامت قد بعثت آخر الأمر سهيلا.. وجلس سهيل بين يدي الرسول، ودار حوار طويل انتهى بالصلح.. وحاول سهيل أن يكسب لقريش الكثير.. وساعده على ذلك، التسامح النبيل والمجيد الذي كان الرسول عليه الصلاة والسلام يديره في التفاوض والصلح.. ومضت الأيام، ينادي بعضها بعضا، جتى جاءت السنة الثامنة من الهجرة.. وخرج الرسول والمسلمون لفتح مكة بعد أن نفضت قريش عهدها وميثاقها مع رسول الله. وعاد المهاجرون الى وطنهم الذين أخرجهم بالأمس كارهين.. عادوا، ومعهم الأنصار الذين آووهم في مينتهم وآثروهم على أنفسهم.. وعاد الاسلام كله، تخفق في جو السماء راياته الظافرة.. وفتحت مكة جميع أبوابها.. ووقف المشركون في ذهول.. ترى ماذا سيكون اليوم مصيرهم، وهم الذين أعملوا بأسهم في المسلمين من قبل قتلا، وحرقا، وتعذيبا، وتجويعا..؟! ولم يشأ الرسول الرحيم أن يتركهم طويلا تحت وطأة هذه المشاعر المذلة المنهكة. فاستقبل وجوههم في تسامح وأناة، وقال لهم ونبرات صوته الرحيم تقطر حنانا ورفقا: " يا معشر قريش.. ما تظنون أني فاعل بكم"..؟؟ هنالك تقدم خصم الاسلام بالأمس سهيل بن عمرو وقال مجيبا: " نظن خيرا، أخ كريم، وابن أخ كريم". وتألقت ابتسامة من نور على شفتي حبيب الله وناداهم: " اذهبوا... فأنتم الطلقاء"..!! لم تكن هذه الكلمات من الرسول المنتصر لتدع انسانا حيّ المشاعر الا أحالته ذوبا من طاعة وخجل، بل وندم.. وفي نفس اللحظة استجاش هذا الموقف الممتلئ نبلا وعظمة، كل مشاعر سهيل بن عمرو فأسلم لله رب العالمين. ولم يكن اسلامه ساعتئذ، اسلام رجل منهزم مستسلم للمقادير. بل كان كما سيكشف عنه مستقبله فيما بعد اسلام رجل بهرته وأسرته عظمة محمد وعظمة الدين الذي يتصرّف محمد وفق تعاليمه، ويحمل في ولاء هائل رايته ولواءه..!! 
** 
أطلق على الذين أسلموا يوم الفتح اسم الطلقاء.. أي الذين نقلهم عفو الرسول من الشرك الى الاسلام حين قال لهم: " اذهبوا فأنتم الطلقاء" بيد أن نفرا من أولئك الطلقاء جاوزوا هذا الخط باخلاصهم الوثيق، وسموا الى آفاق بعيدة من التضحية والعبادة والطهر، وضعتهم في الصفوف الأولى بين أصحاب النبي الأبرار ومن هؤلاء سهيل بن عمرو. 
** 
لقد صاغه الاسلام من جديد. وصقل كل مواهبه الأولى، وأضاف اليها، ثم وضعها جميعا في خدمة الحق، والخير، والايمان.. ولقد نعتوه في كلمات فقالوا: " السّمح، الجواد.. كثير الصلاة، والصوم، والصدقة، وقراءة القرآن، والبكاء من خشية الله"..!! وتلك هي عظمة سهيل. فعلى الرغم من أنه أسلم يوم الفتح، لا قبله، نراه يصدق في اسلامه وفي يقينه، الى مدى الذي يتفوّق فيه على كل نفسه، ويتحوّل الى عابد، زاهد والى فدائي مجاهد في سبيل الله والاسلام. ولما انتقل الرسول الى الرفيق الأعلى، لم يكد النبأ يبلغ مكة، وكان سهيل يومئذ مقيما بها، حتى غشي المسلمين هناك من الهرج والذهول ما غشي المسلمين بالمدينة. واذا كان ذهول المدينة، قد بدّده أبو بكر رضي الله عنه ساعتئذ بكلماته الحاسمة: " من كان يعبد محمد، فان محمدا قد مات.. ومن كان يعبد الله، فان الله حيّ لا يموت".. فسيأخذنا العجب حين نرى سهيلا رضي الله عنه هو الذي وقف بمكة، نفس موقف أبي بكر بالمدينة. فقد جمع المسلمين كلهم هناك، ووقف يبهرهم بكلماته الناجعة، يخبرهم أن محمدا كان رسول الله حقا.. وأنه لم يمت حتى أدّى الأمانة، وبلّغ الرسالة. وأنه واجب المؤمنين به أن يمعنوا من بعده السير على منهجه. وبموقف سهيل هذا، وبكلماته الرشيدة وايمانه الوثيق، درأ الفتنة التي كادت تقلع ايمان بعض الناس بمكة حين بلغهم نبأ وفاة الرسول..!! وفي هذا اليوم أكثر من سواه تألقت نبوءة رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم. ألم يكن لعمر يوم استأذنه في نزع ثنيتي سهيل أثناء أسره ببدر: " دعها فلعلها تسرك يوما"..؟! ففي هذا اليوم.. وحين بلغ المسلمين بالمدينة موقف سهيل بمكة وخطابه الباهر الذي ثبت الايمان في الأفئدة، تذكر عمر بن الخطاب نبوءة الرسول.. وضحك طويلا، اذ جاء اليوم الذي انتفع فيه الاسلام بثنيتي سهيل اللتين كان عمر يريد تهشيمهما واقتلاعهما..!! 
** 
عندما أسلم سهيل يوم الفتح. وبعد أن ذاق حلاوة الايمان، أخذ على نفسه عهدا لخصه في هذه الكلمات: " والله لا أدع موقفا من المشركين، الا وقفت مع المسلمين مثله... ولا نفقة أنفقتها مع المشركين الا أنفقت مع المسلمين مثلها، لعل أمري أن يتلو بعضه بعضا"..!! ولقد وقف مع المشركين طويلا أمام أصنامهم.. فليقف الآن طويلا وطويلا مع المؤمنين بين يدي الله الواحد الأحد. وهكذا راح يصلي.. ويصلي.. ويصوم.. ويصوم.. ولا يدع عبادة تجلو روحه، وتقربه من ربه الأعلى الا أخذ منها حظا وافيا.. وكذلك كان في أمسه يقف مع المشركين في مواطن العدوان والحرب ضد الاسلام. فليأخذ الآن مكانه في جيش الاسلام، مقاتلا شجاعا، يطفئ مع كتائب الحق نار فارس التي يعبدونها من دون الله، ويحرقون فيها مصاير الشعوب التي يستعبدونها. ويدمدم مع كتائب الحق أيضا على ظلمات الرومان وظلمهم.. وينشر كلمة التوحيد والتقوى في كل مكان. وهكذا خرج الى الشام مع جيوش المسلمين، مشاركا في حروبها. ويوم اليرموك حيث خاض المسلمون موقعة تناهت في الضراوة والعنف والمخاطرة.. كان سهيل بن عمرو يكاد يطير من الفرح، اذ وجد هذه الفرصة الدسمة لكي يبذل من ذات نفسه في هذا اليوم العصيب ما يمحق به خطايا جاهليته وشركه.. 
** 
وكان يحب وطنه مكة حبا ينسيه نفسه.. ومع ذلك، فقد أبى أن يرجع اليها بعد انتصار المسلمين بالشام وقال: " سمعت رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم يقول: مقام أحدكم في سبيل الله ساعة، خير له من عمله طوال عمره.. واني لمرابط في سبيل الله حتى أموت، ولن أرجع الى مكة"..!! 
** 
ووفى سهيل عهده.. وظل بقيّة حياته مرابطا، حتى جاء موعد رحيله، فطارت روحه مسرعة الى رحمة من الله ورضوان..
number-en: The story of Suhail bin Amr
label-en:
Suhail bin Amr - from freedmen to martyrs

When he was captured by the Muslims in the Battle of Badr, Omar ibn al-Khattab approached the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, and said: “O Messenger of God... let me remove my hair from Suhail ibn Amr so that he will not preach against you after today.” The great Messenger replied to him: “No, O Omar... I do not mutilate anyone, so God mutilates me, even if I am a prophet”..! Then Omar approached him and said, peace be upon him: “O Omar, perhaps Suhail will take a position tomorrow that will please you.” 
** 
The Messenger’s prophecy came true... and the greatest orator of the Quraysh, Suhail bin Amr, turned into one of the most brilliant orators of Islam... The arch-polytheist turned into a reciprocating believer, whose eyes never stopped crying out of fear of God..!! One of the senior leaders of Qarash and the commanders of its armies turned into a solid fighter for the sake of Islam.. A fighter who pledged to himself to remain in steadfastness and jihad until death overtook him for that. May God forgive his previous sins..!! Who was that stubborn polytheist, pious believer and martyr..?? 
** 
He is Suhail bin Amr... one of the justified leaders of Quraysh, one of its wise men and those with intelligence and opinion in it... and he was the one whom Quraysh appointed to persuade the Messenger not to enter Mecca in the year of Hudaybiyyah.. At the end of the sixth Hijri year, the Messenger and his companions went out to Mecca to visit the Sacred House and perform Umrah. They did not want war, and were not prepared for a fight. The Quraysh learned of their march to Mecca, so they went out to block their way and prevent them from their destination. The situation became tense, and people became tense. The Messenger said to his companions: “The Quraysh do not invite me today to a plan in which they ask me to maintain ties of kinship unless I give it to them.” The Quraysh began sending their messengers and representatives to the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, and he told them all that he had not come to fight, but had come to visit the Sacred House, and to venerate its sanctities. Whenever one of their representatives returned to the Quraysh, they sent after him another who was stronger and more persuasive, until they chose Urwa bin Masoud Al-Thaqafi, who was one of the strongest and most intelligent among them.. And the Quraysh thought that Urwa was capable of convincing the Messenger to return. But he quickly returned to them and said to them: “O people of Quraysh, I have come to Chosroes in his kingdom, Caesar in his kingdom, and the Negus in his kingdom.. By God, I have never seen a king venerated by his people as Muhammad’s companions venerated Muhammad..!! And I saw around him people who would never give him up to evil.. so see what you think..!! 
** 
Then the Quraysh believed that their attempts were futile and decided to resort to negotiation and reconciliation... and for this task they chose the most suitable of their leaders for it... and it was Suhail bin Amr... The Muslims saw Suhail coming towards them and recognized him, and they realized that the Quraysh had preferred the path of understanding and reconciliation, as long as they had sent Suhail in the end... Suhail sat in the hands of the Messenger, and a long dialogue took place that ended in reconciliation... and Suhail tried to make peace. He gains a lot for the Quraysh. He was aided in this by the noble and glorious tolerance that the Messenger, peace and blessings be upon him, used to conduct negotiations and reconciliation... Days passed, calling to each other, until the eighth year of the Hijra came... and the Messenger and the Muslims went out to conquer Mecca after the Quraysh broke their covenant and covenant with the Messenger of God. The emigrants returned to their homeland, which they had expelled yesterday against their will. They returned, and with them were the Ansar who had sheltered them in their homes and preferred them over themselves. Islam as a whole returned, its victorious banners fluttering in the sky. Mecca opened all its gates, and the polytheists stood in astonishment. Do you think what will be their fate today, when they are the ones who previously committed violence against the Muslims, killing, burning, torturing, and starving...?! The Merciful Messenger did not want to leave them for a long time under the weight of these humiliating and exhausting feelings. So he received their faces with tolerance and patience, and said to them, with the tones of his merciful voice dripping with tenderness and gentleness: “O people of Quraysh, what do you think I will do to you?”..?? Yesterday, the opponent of Islam, Suhail bin Amr, came forward and said in response: “We think well, a generous brother and a generous nephew.” A smile of light shone on Habibullah’s lips and he called them: “Go... You are the free ones.” These words from the victorious Messenger would not have left a person with lively feelings without turning him into a state of obedience, shame, and even remorse. And at the same moment, this stance, full of nobility and greatness, aroused all the feelings of Suhail bin Amr, and he submitted to God, Lord of the worlds. His Islam at that time was not the Islam of a defeated man surrendering to fate. Rather, it was, as his future would later reveal, the Islam of a man who was dazzled and captivated by the greatness and greatness of Muhammad. The religion according to whose teachings Muhammad acts, and whose banner and banner he carries with immense loyalty..!! 
** 
Those who converted to Islam on the day of the conquest were called the freedmen. That is, those who were transferred by the Messenger’s pardon from polytheism to Islam when he said to them: “Go, for you are free.” However, a group of those who were free crossed this line with their steadfast sincerity, and rose to far-reaching heights of sacrifice, worship, and purity, which placed them in the first ranks among the righteous companions of the Prophet, and among these was Suhail bin Amr. 
** 
Islam has reshaped it. He polished all his early talents, added to them, and then put them all in the service of truth, goodness, and faith... They described him in words, saying: “The forgiving, the generous... He prayed a lot, fasted, gave charity, read the Qur’an, and cried out of fear of God..!! And that is the greatness of Suhail. Even though he converted to Islam on the day of the conquest, not before it, we see him believing in his Islam and in his certainty, to the extent that he surpasses all of himself, and turns into a worshiper, an ascetic, and a guerrilla fighter for the sake of God and Islam. When the Messenger moved to the highest companion, the news could hardly reach Mecca, and Suhail was residing at that time. There, the Muslims there were as overwhelmed with confusion and astonishment as the Muslims in Medina were. If the astonishment of Medina was dissipated at that time by Abu Bakr, may God be pleased with him, with his decisive words: “Whoever worships Muhammad, then Muhammad is dead... and whoever worships God, God is alive and does not die.” We will be amazed when we see Suhail, may God be pleased with him, who stood in Mecca, the same position as Abu Bakr in Medina. He gathered all the Muslims there, and stood to impress them with his effective words, telling them that Muhammad was truly the Messenger of God... and that he did not die until he had fulfilled his trust and conveyed the message. It is the duty of those who believe in him to follow his path carefully after him. With this position of Suhail, and with his wise words and strong faith, he warded off the strife that almost uprooted some people’s faith in Mecca when they heard the news of the death of the Messenger..!! On this day, more than any other day, the prophecy of the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, shone brighter. Didn't Omar, one day when he asked permission to remove Suhail's rings during his captivity at Badr, say: "Leave it, perhaps it will please you one day"..?! On this day... when the Muslims of Medina were informed of Suhail's position in Mecca and his brilliant speech that cemented faith in the hearts, Omar bin Al-Khattab remembered the Prophet's prophecy... He laughed for a long time, as the day came when Islam benefited from Suhail’s two sons, which Omar wanted to smash and uproot..!! 
** 
When Suhail converted to Islam on the day of the conquest. After he tasted the sweetness of faith, he made a covenant with himself that he summed up in these words: “By God, I will never take a stand against the polytheists without taking a stand with the Muslims like it... And no expense I spend with the polytheists without I spend the same on the Muslims. Perhaps my command is that some of it should follow the other.”..!! He stood with the polytheists for a long time before their idols.. Now let him stand long and tall with the believers in the hands of the One and Only God. And so he began to pray... and pray... and fast... He fasts... and does not abandon an act of worship that exalts his soul and brings him closer to his Most High Lord without taking ample portion from it. Likewise, in the past, he was standing with the polytheists in times of aggression and war against Islam. Let him now take his place in the Army of Islam, a brave fighter, extinguishing with the Brigades of Truth the fire of Persia, which they worship instead of God, and in which they burn the destinies of the peoples they enslave. He also murmurs with the Al-Haqq Brigades against the injustices and oppression of the Romans... and spreads the word of monotheism and piety everywhere. Thus, he went to the Levant with the Muslim armies, participating in their wars. On the Day of Yarmouk, when the Muslims fought a battle that was extreme in ferocity, violence, and danger... Suhail bin Amr was almost bursting with joy, as he found this great opportunity to give of himself on this difficult day to erase the sins of his ignorance and polytheism. 
** 
He loved his homeland, Mecca, with a love that made him forget himself. However, he refused to return to it after the Muslims’ victory in the Levant. He said: “I heard the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, say: If one of you stays in the path of God for an hour, it is better for him than his work for the rest of his life.. And I will remain stationed in the path of God until I die, and I will not return to Mecca.”..!! 
** 
Suhail fulfilled his promise. He remained stationed for the rest of his life, until the time of his departure came, and his soul flew quickly to God’s mercy and satisfaction.

صهيب بن سنان - ربح البيع يا أبا يحيى!!.

ولد في أحضان النعيم.. فقد اكن أبوه حاكم الأبلّة ووليا عليها لكسرى.. وكان من العرب الذين نزحوا الى العراق قبل الاسلام بعهد طويل، وفي قصره القائم على شاطئ الفرات، مما يلي الجزيرة والموصل، عاش الطفل ناعما سعيدا.. وذات يوم تعرضت البلاد لهجوم الروم.. وأسر المغيرون أعدادا كثيرة وسبوا ذلك الغلام " صهيب بن سنان".. ويقتنصه تجار الرقيق، وينتهي طوافه الى مكة، حيث بيع لعبد الله بن جدعان، بعد أن قضى طفولته وشبابه في بلاد الروم، حتى أخذ لسانهم ولهجتهم. ويعجب سيده بذكائه ونشاطه واخلاصه، فيعتقه ويحرره، ويهيء له فرصة الاتجار معه. وذات يوم.. ولندع صديقع عمار بن ياسر يحدثنا عن ذلك اليوم: " لقيت صهيب بن سنان على باب دار الأرقم، ورسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم فيها.. فقلت له: ماذا تريد..؟ فأجابني وما تريد أنت..؟ قلت له: أريد أن أدخل على محمد، فأسمع ما يقول. قال: وأنا اريد ذلك.. فدخلنا على الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم، فعرض علينا الاسلام فأسلمنا. ثم مكثنا على ذلك حتى أمسينا.. ثم خرجنا ونحن مستخفيان".!! عرف صهيب طريقع اذن الى دار الأرقم.. عرف طريقه الى الهدى والنور، وأيضا الى التضحية الشاقة والفداء العظيم.. فعبور الباب الخشبي الذي كان يفصل داخل دار الأرقم عن خارجها لم يكن يعني مجرّد تخطي عتبة.. بل كان يعني تخطي حدود عالم بأسره..! عالم قديم بكل ما يمثله من دين وخلق، ونظام وحياة.. وتخطي عتبة دار الأرقم، التي لم يكن عرضها ليزيد عن قدم واحدة كان يعني في حقيقة الأمر وواقعه عبور خضمّ من الأهوال، واسع، وعريض.. واقتحام تلك العتبة، كان ايذانا بعهد زاخر بالمسؤليات الجسام..! وبالنسبة للفقراء، والغرباء، والرقيق، كان اقتحام عقبة دار الأرقم يعني تضحية تفوق كل مألوف من طاقات البشر. وان صاحبنا صهيبا لرجل غريب.. وصديقه الذي لقيه على باب الدار، عمّار بن ياسر رجل فقير.. فما بالهما يستقبلان الهول ويشمّران سواعدهما لملاقاته..؟؟ انه نداء الايمان الذي لا يقاوم.. وانها شمائل محمد عليه الصلاة والسلام، الذي يملؤ عبيرها أفئدة الأبرار هدى وحبا.. وانها روعة الجديد المشرق. تبهر عقولا سئمت عفونة القديم، وضلاله وافلاسه.. وانها قبل هذا كله رحمة الله يصيب بها من يشاء.. وهداه يهدي اليه من ينيب... أخذ صهيب مكانه في قافلة المؤمنين.. وأخذ مكانا فسيحا وعاليا بين صفوف المضطهدين والمعذبين..!! ومكانا عاليا كذلك بين صفوف الباذلين والمفتدين.. وانه ليتحدث صادقا عن ولائه العظيم لمسؤولياته كمسلم بايع الرسول، وسار تحت راية الاسلام فيقول: " لم يشهد رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم مشهدا قط الا كنت حاضره.. ولم يبايع بيعة قط الا كنت حاضرها.. ولا يسر سرية قط. الا كنت حاضرها.. ولا غزا غزاة قط، أوّل الزمان وآخره، الا منت فيها عن يمينه أ، شماله.. وما خاف المسلمون أمامهم قط، الا كنت أمامهم.. ولا خافوا وراءهم الا كنت وراءهم.. وما جعلت رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم بيني وبين االعدوّ أبدا حتى لقي ربه"..!! هذه صورة باهرة، لايمان فذ وولاء عظيم.. ولقد كان صهيب رضي الله عنه وعن اخوانه أجمعين، أهلا لهذا الايمان المتفوق من أول يوم استقبل فيه نور الله، ووضع يمينه في يكين الرسول.. يومئذ أخذت علاقاته بالناس، وبالدنيا، بل وبنفسه، طابعا جديدا. يومئذ. امتشق نفسا صلبة، زاهدة متفانية. وراح يستقبل بها الأحداث فيطوّعها. والأهوال فيروّعها. ولقد مضى يواجه تبعاته في اقدام وجسور.ز فلا يتخلف عن مشهد ولا عن خطر.. منصرفا ولعه وشغفه عن الغنائم الى المغارم.. وعن شهوة الحياة، الى عشق الخطر وحب الموت.. ولقد افتتح أيام نضاله النبيل وولائه الجليل بيوم هجرته، ففي ذلك اليوم تخلى عن كل ثروته وجميع ذهبه الذي أفاءته عليه تجارته الرابحة خلال سنوات كثيرة قضاها في مكة.. تخلى عن كل هذه الثروة وهي كل ما يملك في لحظة لم يشب جلالها تردد ولا نكوص. فعندما همّ الرسول بالهجرة، علم صهيب بها، وكان المفروض أن يكون ثالث ثلاثة، هم الرسول.. وأبو بكر.. وصهيب.. بيد أن القرشيين كانوا قد بيتوا أمرهم لمنع هجرة الرسول.. ووقع صهيب في بعض فخاخهم، فعوّق عن الهجرة بعض الوقت بينما كان الرسول وصاحبه قد اتخذا سبيلهما على بركة الله.. وحاور صهيب وداور، حتى استطاع أن يفلت من شانئيه، وامتطى ظهر ناقته، وانطلق بها الصحراء وثبا.. بيد أن قريشا أرسلت في أثره قناصتها فأدركوهخ.. ولم يكد صهيب يراهم ويواجههم من قريب حتى صاح فيهم قائلا: " يا معشر قريش.. لقد علمتم أني من أرماكم رجلا.. وأيم والله لا تصلون اليّ حتى ارمي كبل سهم معي في كنانتي ثم أضربكم بسيفي حتى لا يبقى في يدي منه شيء، فأقدموا ان شئتم.. وان شئتم دللتكم على مالي، وتتركوني وشاني".. ولقد استاموا لأنفسهم، وقبلوا أن يأخذوا ماله قائلين له: أتيتنا صعلوكا فقيرا، فكثر مالك عندنا، وبلغت بيننا ما بلغت، والآن تنطلق بنفسك وبمالك..؟؟ فدلهم على المكان الذي خبأ فيه ثروته، وتركوه وشأنه، وقفلوا الى مكة راجعين.. والعجب أنهم صدقوا قوله في غير شك، وفي غير حذر، فلم يسألوه بيّنة.. بل ولم يستحلفوه على صدقه..!! وهذا موقف يضفي على صهيب كثيرا من العظمة يستحقها كونه صادق وأمين..!! واستأنف صهيب هجرته وحيدا سعيدا، حتى أردك الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم في قباء.. كان الرسول حالسا وحوله بعض أصحابه حين أهل عليهم صهيب ولم يكد يراه الرسول حتى ناداه متهلاا: " ربح البيع أبا يحيى..!! ربح البيع أبا يحيى..!! وآنئذ نزلت الآية الكريمة: ( ومن الناس من يشري نفسه ابتغاء مرضات الله، والله رؤوف بالعباد).. أجل لقد اشترى صهيب نفسه المؤمنة ابتغاء مرضات الله بكل ثروته التي أنفق شبابه في جمعها، ولم يحس قط أنه المغبون.. فمال المال، وما الذهب وما الدنيا كلها، اذا بقي له ايمانه، واذا بقيت لضميره سيادته.. ولمصيره ارادته..؟؟ كان الرسول يحبه كثيرا.. وكان صهيب الى جانب ورعه وتقواه، خفيف الروح، حاضر النكتة.. رآه الرسول يأكل رطبا، وكان باحدى عينيه رمد.. فقال له الرسول ضاحكا:" أتأكل الرطب وفي عينيك رمد"..؟ فأجاب قائلا:" وأي بأس..؟ اني آكله بعيني الآخرى"..!! وكان جوّادا معطاء.. ينفق كل عطائه من بيت المال في سبيل الله، يعين محتاجا.. يغيث مكروبا.." ويطعم الطعام على حبه مسكينا ويتيما وأسيرا". حتى لقد أثار سخاؤه المفرط انتباه عمر فقال له: أراك تطعم كثيرا حتى انك لتسرف..؟ فأجابه صهيب لقد سمعت رسول الله يقول: " خياركم من أطعم الطعام". 
** 
ولئن كانت حياة صهيب مترعة بالمزايا والعظائم، فان اختيار عمر بن الخطاب اياه ليؤم المسلمين في الصلاة مزية تملأ حياته ألفة وعظمة.. فعندما اعتدي على أمير المؤمنين وهو يصلي بالمسلمين صلاة الفجر.. وعندما احس نهاية الأجل، فراح يلقي على اصحابه وصيته وكلماته الأخيرة قال: " وليصلّ بالناس صهيب".. لقد اختار عمر يومئذ ستة من الصحابة، ووكل اليهم أمر الخليفة الجديد.. وخليفة المسلمين هو الذي يؤمهم في الصلاة، ففي الأيام الشاغرة بين وفاة أمير المؤمنين، واختيار الخليفة الجديد، من يؤم المسلمين في الصلاة..؟ ان عمر وخاصة في تلك الللحظات التي تأخذ فيها روحه الطاهرة طريقها الى الله ليستأني ألف مرة قبل أن يختار.. فاذا اختار، فلا أحد هناك أوفر حظا ممن يقع عليه الاختيار.. ولقد اختار عمر صهيبا.. اختاره ليكون امام المسلمين في الصلاة حتى ينهض الخليفة الجديد.. بأعباء مهمته.. اختاره وهو يعلم أن في لسانه عجمة، فكان هذا الاختيار من تمام نعمة الله على عبده الصالح صهيب بن سنان..
number-en: The story of Suhaib bin Sinan
label-en:
Suhaib bin Sinan - The profit from the sale, Abu Yahya!!

He was born in the embrace of bliss. His father was the ruler of the land and its guardian for Chosroes. He was one of the Arabs who fled to Iraq long before Islam, and in his palace located on the shore of the Euphrates, next to the island and Mosul, the child lived smoothly and happily. One day the country was attacked by the Romans. The raiders captured large numbers and took captive that boy, Suhaib bin Sinan. The slave traders captured him, and his journey ended in Mecca. He was sold to Abdullah bin Jadan, after spending his childhood and youth in the Roman lands, until he took their tongue and dialect. His master admires his intelligence, activity, and sincerity, so he emancipates him, frees him, and gives him the opportunity to trade with him. And one day.. Let us let my friend Ammar bin Yasser tell us about that day: “I met Suhaib bin Sinan at the door of Dar al-Arqam, and the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, was there.. I said to him: What do you want..? He answered me and what do you want..? I said to him: I want to enter to Muhammad, and hear what he says. He said: And I want that.. So we entered to the Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace, and he offered us Islam and we converted. Then we remained like that until We spent the evening...then we went out while we were hidden."!! Then Suhaib knew his way to Dar Al-Arqam. He knew his way to guidance and light, and also to arduous sacrifice and great redemption.. Crossing the wooden door that separated the inside of Dar Al-Arqam from the outside did not mean simply crossing a threshold.. Rather, it meant crossing the borders of an entire world..! An ancient world with all that it represents in terms of religion, morals, order and life... and crossing the threshold of Dar Al-Arqam, which was not more than one foot wide, meant in reality and in reality crossing an abyss of horrors, wide and wide... Storming that threshold was the beginning of an era full of great responsibilities..! For the poor, the strangers, and the slaves, storming the Dar al-Arqam obstacle meant a sacrifice beyond all human capabilities. And our friend Suhaib is a stranger... and his friend who met him at the door of the house, Ammar bin Yasser, is a poor man... so why should they face the horror and roll up their sleeves to meet him...?? It is the irresistible call of faith.. and it is the beauty of Muhammad, peace and blessings be upon him, whose fragrance fills the hearts of the righteous with guidance and love.. and it is the splendor of the bright new. It dazzles minds that are fed up with the rot, error, and bankruptcy of the old. And before all of this, it is the mercy of God that He bestows upon whom He wills.. and His guidance guides to Him whoever repents... Suhaib took his place in the caravan of believers.. and took a spacious and high place among the ranks of the persecuted and tormented..!! And also a high place among the ranks of the sacrificers and those who were redeemed.. And to speak truthfully about his great loyalty to his responsibilities as a Muslim who pledged allegiance to the Messenger and walked under the banner of Islam, he says: “The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, never witnessed a scene without me being present at it.. He never pledged allegiance to me except that I was present at it.. And he never secreted a secret thing except that I was present at it.. And no invaders ever invaded, at the beginning of time and at the end of time, except that it went to his right or his left.. And the Muslims never feared in front of them, except that I was in front of them.. And they never feared behind them, except that I was behind them.. And I never put the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, between me and the enemy until he met his Lord..!! This is a dazzling picture, of unique faith and great loyalty.. And Suhaib, may God be pleased with him and all his brothers, was worthy of this. Superior faith from the first day he received the light of God, and placed his right hand in the heart of the Messenger. On that day, his relationships with people, with the world, and even with himself, took on a new character on that day. He began to receive events and adapt them. And the horrors are horrifying. He went on to face its consequences with courage and boldness, never abandoning a scene or a danger. He turned his love and passion away from spoils to love affairs... and from the lust of life, to the love of danger and the love of death. He opened the days of his noble struggle and solemn loyalty with the day of his migration. On that day, he gave up all his wealth and all the gold that his lucrative trade had earned him during the many years he spent in Mecca. He gave up all of these. Wealth is everything that one possesses in a moment, the majesty of which has not been subject to hesitation or reversal. When the Messenger was about to emigrate, Suhaib learned of it, and he was supposed to be the third of three, namely the Messenger... and Abu Bakr... and Suhaib... However, the Quraishis had decided to prevent the Messenger from emigrating... Suhaib fell into some of their traps, and was hindered from emigrating for a while while the Messenger and his companion had set out on their way, with God’s blessing... He talked with Suhaib and took turns, until he was able to escape from his affairs, and rode on his back. He picked up his camel and jumped off into the desert with it. However, the Quraysh sent their snipers after him and they overtook him. No sooner had Suhaib seen them and faced them from close by than he shouted at them, saying: “O people of Quraysh! You have learned that I am the one who shot you as a man... and by God, you will not reach me until I shoot an arrow cable with me in my quiver and then strike you with my sword until there is nothing left in my hand. So come forward if you wish... and if you wish, I will show you my money, and you will leave me alone.” And they were satisfied with themselves, and agreed to take his money, saying to him: You came to us as a poor tramp, and your wealth has increased with us, and you have attained what you have achieved, and now you go yourself. And with your money..?? So he showed them the place where he hid his wealth, and they left him alone, and returned to Mecca.. The surprising thing is that they believed his words without doubt, and without caution, and they did not ask him for proof.. They did not even ask him to swear on his honesty..!! This is a position that gives Suhaib a lot of greatness that he deserves for being honest and sincere..!! Suhaib resumed his migration alone and happily, until the Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace, returned you to Quba.. The Messenger was sitting and some of his companions surrounded him when Suhaib arrived at them, and no sooner had the Messenger seen him than he called to him excitedly: “The sale won, Abu Yahya..!! The sale won, Abu Yahya..!! And then the noble verse was revealed: (And among the people is he who sells himself seeking the pleasure of God, and God is compassionate to His servants)...” Yes, Suhaib bought his faithful soul, seeking the pleasure of God, with all his wealth that he had spent his youth amassing, and he never felt that he was the victim. What is money, what is gold, and what is the whole world, if his faith remains, and if his conscience remains sovereign... and his destiny is his will..?? The Messenger loved him very much.. Suhaib was besides his piety and piety, light-hearted, and good at humor.. The Messenger saw him eating fresh dates, and he had ulcers in one of his eyes.. The Messenger said to him, laughing: “Do you eat fresh dates with ulcers in your eyes?”..? He replied, "What's wrong? I eat it with my other eye." He was a generous horse.. He spends all his giving from the treasury for the sake of God, helping the needy... providing relief to the distressed... and feeding food out of his love for the poor, the orphan, and the captive. His excessive generosity even attracted the attention of Omar, and he said to him: I see you feeding so much that you are going to extravagance..? Suhaib replied: I heard the Messenger of God say: “The best of you is the one who feeds the food.” 
** 
Although Suhaib’s life was full of merits and greatness, Omar ibn al-Khattab’s choice of him to lead the Muslims in prayer was a merit that filled his life with familiarity and greatness.. When he attacked the Commander of the Faithful while he was leading the Muslims in the dawn prayer... When he sensed the end of his term, he began to deliver his will to his companions, and his last words were: “And let Suhaib lead the people in prayer.” Omar had chosen six of the companions on that day, and entrusted them with the task of the new caliph. The caliph of the Muslims is the one who leads them in prayer. In the days between the death of the Commander of the Faithful and the selection of the new caliph, who will lead the Muslims in prayer? Omar, especially in those moments when his pure soul makes its way to God, to wait a thousand times before he chooses. If he chooses, no one out there is luckier than the one who is chosen. And Omar chose Suhaib. He chose him to be in front of the Muslims in prayer so that the new caliph could carry out the burdens of his mission. He chose him knowing that he had a tongue twister, so this choice was the fulfillment of God’s blessings upon His righteous servant Suhaib bin Sinan.

طلحة بن عبيد الله - صقر يوم أحد

( من المؤمنين رجال صدقوا ما عاهدوا الله عليه فمنهم من قضى نحبه ومنهم من ينتظر، وما بدّلوا تبديلا)... تلا الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم هذه الآية الكريمة، ثم استقبل وجوه أصحابه، وقال وهو يشير الى طلحة: " من سرّه أن ينظر الى رجل يمشي على الأرض، وقد قضى نحبه، فلينظر الى طلحة"..!! ولم تكن ثمة بشرى يتمنّاها أصحاب رسول الله، وتطير قلوبهم شوقا اليها أكثر من هذه التي قلّدها النبي طلحة بن عبيد الله.. لقد اطمأن اذن الى عاقبة أمره ومصير حياته.. فسيحيا، ويموت، وهو واحد من الذين صدقوا ما عاهدوا الله عليه ولن تناله فتنة، ولن يدركه لغوب.. ولقد بشّره الرسول بالجنة، فماذا كانت حياة هذا المبشّر الكريم..؟؟ 
** 
لقد كان في تجارة له بأرض بصرى حين لقي راهبا من خيار رهبانها، وأنبأه أن النبي الذي سيخرج من بلاد الحرم، والذي تنبأ به الأنبياء الصالحون قد أهلّ عصره وأشرقت أيامه.. وحّر طلحة أن يفوته موكبه، فانه موكب الهدى والرحمة والخلاص.. وحين عاد طلحة الى بلده مكة بعد شهور قضاها في بصرى وفي السفر، الفى بين أهلها ضجيجا.. وسمعهم يتحدثون كلما التقى بأحدهم، أو بجماعة منهم عن محمد الأمين.. وعن الوحي الذي يأتيه.. وعن الرسالة التي يحملها الى العرب خاصة، والى الناس كافة.. وسأل طلحة أول ما سأل أبي بكر فعلم أنه عاد مع قافلته وتجارته من زمن غير بعيد، وأنه يقف الى جوار محمد مؤمنا منافحا، أوّابا.. وحدّث طلحة نفسه: محمد، وأبو بكر..؟؟ تالله لا يجتمع الاثنان على ضلالة أبدا.!! ولقد بلغ محمد الأربعين من عمره، وما عهدنا عليه خلال هذا العمر كذبة واحدة.. أفيكذب اليوم على الله، ويقول: أنه أرسلني وأرسل اليّ وحيا..؟؟ وهذا هو الذي يصعب تصديقه.. وأسرع طلحة الخطى ميمما وجهه شطر دار أبي بكر.. ولم يطل الحديث بينهما، فقد كان شوقه الى لقاء الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم ومبايعته أسرع من دقات قلبه.. فصحبه أبو بكر الى الرسول عليه الصلاة والسلام، حيث أسلم وأخذ مكانه في القافلة المباركة.. وهكذا كان طلحة من المسلمين المبكرين. 
** 
وعلى الرغم من جاهه في قومه، وثرائه العريض، وتجارته الناجحة فقد حمل حظه من اضطهاد قريش، اذ وكل به وبأبي بكر نوفل بن خويلد، وكان يدعى أسد قريش، بيد أن اضطهادهما لم يطل مداه، اذ سرعان ما خجلت قريش من نفسها، وخافت عاقبة أمرها.. وهاجر طلحة الى المدينة حين أمر المسلمون بالهجرة، ثم شهد المشاهد كلها مع رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم، عدا غزوة بدر، فان الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم كان قد ندبه ومعه سعيد بن زيد لمهمة خارج المدينة.. ولما أنجزاها ورجعا قافلين الى المدينة، كان النبي وصحبه عائدين من غزوة بدر، فآلم نفسيهما أن يفوتهما أجر مشاركة الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم بالجهاد في أولى غزواته.. بيد أن الرسول أهدى اليهما طمأنينة سابغة، حين انبأهما أن لهما من المثوبة والأجر مثل ما للمقاتلين تماما، بل وقسم لهما من غنائم المعركة مثل من شهدوها.. وتجيء غزوة أحد لتشهد كل جبروت قريش وكل بأسها حيث جاءت تثأر ليوم بدر وتؤمّن مصيرها بانزال هزيمة نهائية بالمسلمين، هزيمة حسبتها قريش أمرا ميسورا، وقدرا مقدورا..!! ودارت حرب طاحنة سرعان ما غطّت الأرض بحصادها الأليم.. ودارت الدائرة على المشركين.. ثم لما رآهم المسلمون ينسحبون وضعوا أسلحتهم، ونزل الرماة من مواقعهم ليحوزوا نصيبهم من الغنائم.. وفجأة عاد جيش قريش من الوراء على حين بغتة، فامتلك ناصية الحرب زمام المعركة.. واستأنف القتال ضراوته وقسوته وطحنه، وكان للمفاجأة أثرها في تشتيت صفوف المسلمين.. وأبصر طلحة جانب المعركة التي يقف فيها رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم، فألفاه قد صار هدفا لقوى الشرك والوثنية، فسارع نحو الرسول.. وراح رضي الله عنه يجتاز طريقا ما أطوله على قصره..! طريقا تعترض كل شبر منه عشرات السيوف المسعورة وعشرات من الرماح المجنونة!! ورأى رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم من بعيد يسيل من وجنته الدمو ويتحامل على نفسه، فجنّ جنونه، وقطع طريق الهول في قفزة أو قفزتين وأمام الرسول وجد ما يخشاه.. سيوف المشركين تلهث نحوه، وتحيط به تريد أن تناله بسوء.. ووقف طلحة كالجيش اللجب، يضرب بسيفه البتار يمينا وشمالا.. ورأى دم الروسل الكريم ينزف، وآلامه تئن، فسانده وحمله بعيدا عن الحفرة التي زلت فيها قدمه.. كان يساند الرسول عليه الصلاة والسلام بيسراه وصدره، متأخرا به الى مكان آمن، بينما بيمينه، بارك الله يمينه، تضرب بالسيف وتقاتل المشركين الذين أحاطوا بالرسول، وملؤا دائرة القتال مثل الجراد..!! ولندع الصدّيق أبا بكر رضي الله عنه يصف لنا المشهد.. تقول عائشة رضي الله عنها: " كان أبو بكر اذا ذكر يوم أحد يقول: ذلك كله كان يوم طلحة.. كنت أول من جاء الى النبي صلى الله عليه وسلم، فقال لي الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم ولأبي عبيدة بن الجرّاح: دونكم اخاكم.. ونظرنا واذا به بضع وسبعون بين طعنة.. وضربة ورمية.. واذا أصبعه مقطوع. فأصلحنا من شانه" . 
** 
وفي جميع المشاهد والغزوات، كان طلحة في مقدّمة الصفوف يبتغي وجه الله، ويفتدي راية رسوله. ويعيش طلحة وسط الجماعة المسلمة، يعبد الله مع العابدين، ويجاهد في سبيله مع المجاهدين، ويرسي بساعديه مع سواعد اخوانه قواعد الدين الجديد الذي جاء ليخرج الناس من الظلمات الى النور.. فاذا قضى حق ربه، راح يضرب في الأرض، ويبتغي من فضل الله منمّيا تجارته الرابحة، وأعماله الناجحة. فقد كان طلحة رضي الله عته من أكثر المسلمين ثراء، وأنماهم ثروة.. وكانت ثروته كلها في خدمة الدين الذي حمل مع رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم رايته... كان ينفق منها بغير حساب.. وكان اله ينمّيها له بغير حساب! لقد لقّبه رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم بـ طلحة الخير، وطلحة الجود، وطلحة الفيّاض اطراء لجوده المفيض. وما أكثر ما كان يخرج من ثروته مرة واحدة، فاذا الله الكريم يردها اليه مضاعفة. تحدّثنا زوجته سعدى بنت عوف فتقول: " دخلت على طلحة يوما فرأيته مهموما، فسألته ما شانك..؟ فقال المال الذي عندي.. قد كثر حتى أهمّني وأكربني.. وقلت له ما عليك.. اقسمه.. فقام ودعا الناس، واخذ يقسمه عليهم حتى ما بقي منه درهم"... ومرّة أخرى باع أرضا له بثمن مرتفع، ونظر الى كومة المال ففاضت عيناه من الدمع ثم قال: " ان رجلا تبيت هذه الأموال في بيته لا يدري ما يطرق من أمر، لمغرور بالله"... ثم دعا بعض أصحابه وحمل معهم أمواله هذه، ومضى في شوارع المدينة وبيوتها يوزعها، حتى أسحر وما عنده منها درهم..!! ويصف جابر بن عبدالله جود طلحة فيقول: " ما رأيت أحد اعطى لجزيل مال من غير مسألة، من طلحة بن عبيد الله".وكان أكثر الناس برّا بأهله وبأقربائه، فكان يعولهم جميعا على كثرتهم.. وقد قيل عنه في ذلك: ".. كان لا يدع أحدا من بني تيم عائلا الا كفاه مؤنته، ومؤنة عياله.. وكان يزوج أيامهم، ويخدم عائلهم، ويقضي دين غارمهم".. ويقول السائب بن زيد: " صجبت طلحة بن عبيدالله في السفر والحضر فما وجدت أحدا، أعمّ سخاء على الدرهم، والثوب والطعام من طلحة"..!! وتنشب الفتنة المعروفة في خلافة عثمان رضي الله عنه.. ويؤيد طلحة حجة المعارضين لعثمان، ويزكي معظمهم فيما كانوا ينشدونه من تغيير واصلاح.. أكان بموقفه هذا، يدعو الى قتل عثمان، أو يرضى به..؟؟ كلا... ولو كان يعلم أن الفتنة ستتداعى حتى تتفجر آخر الأمر حقدا مخبولا، ينفس عن نفسه في تلك الجناية البشعة التي ذهب ضحيتها ذو النورين عثمان رضي الله عنه.. نقول: لو كان يعلم أن الفتنة ستتمادى الى هذا المأزق والمنتهى لقاومها، ولقاومها معه بقية الأصحاب الذين آزروها أول أمرها باعتبارها حركة معارضة وتحذير، لا أكثر.. على أن موقف طلحة هذا، تحوّل الى عقدة حياته بعد الطريقة البشعة التي حوصر بها عثمان وقتل، فلم يكد الامام عليّ يقبل بيعة المسلمين بالمدينة ومنهم طلحة والزبير، حتى استأذن الاثنان في الخروج الى مكة للعمرة.. ومن مكة توجها الى البصرة، حيث كانت قوات كثيرة تتجمّع للأخذ بثأر عثمان.. وكانت وقعة الجمل حيث التقى الفريق المطالب بدم عثمان، والفريق الذي يناصر عليّا.. وكان عليّ كلما أدار خواطره على الموقف العسر الذي يجتازه الاسلام والمسلمون في هذه الخصومة الرهيبة، تنتفض همومه، وتهطل دموعه، ويعلو نشيجه..!! لقد اضطر الى امأزق الوعر.. فبوصفه خليفة المسلمين لا يستطيع، وليس من حقه أن يتسامح تجاه أي تمرّد على الدولة، أو أي مناهضة مسلحة للسلطة المشروعة.. وحين ينهض لقمع تمرّد من هذ النوع، فان عليه أن يواجه اخوانه وأصحابه وأصدقاءه، وأتباع رسوله ودينه، أولئك الذين طالما قاتل معهم جيوش الشرك، وخاضوا معا تحت راية التوحيد معارك صهرتهم وصقلتهم، وجعلت منهم اخوانا بل اخوة متعاضدين.. فأي مأزق هذا..؟ وأي ابتلاء عسير..؟ وفي سبيل التماس مخرج من هذا المأزق، وصون دماء المسلمين لم يترك الامام علي وسيلة الا توسّل بها، ولا رجاء الا تعلق به. ولكن العناصر التي كانت تعمل ضدّ الاسلام، وما أكثرها، والتي لقيت مصيرها الفاجع على يد الدولة المسلمة، أيام عاهلها العظيم عمر، هذه العناصر كانت قد أحكمت نسج الفتنة، وراحت تغذيها وتتابع سيرها وتفاقمها... 
** 
بكى عليّ بكاء غزيرا، عندما أبصر أم المؤمنين عائشة في هودجها على رأس الجيش الذي يخرج الآن لقتاله.. وعندما أبصر وسط الجيش طلحة والزبير، حوراييّ رسول الله.. فنادى طلحة والزبير ليخرجا اليه، فخرجا حتى اختلفت أعناق أفراسهم.. فقال لطلحة: " يا طلحة، أجئت بعرس رسول الله تقاتل بها. وخبأت عرسك في البيت"..؟؟ ثم قال للزبير: " يا زبير، نشدتك الله، أتذكر يوم مرّ بك رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم ونحن بمكان كذا، فقال لك: يا زبير، ألا تحبّ عليّا..؟ فقلت: ألا أحب ابن خالي، وابن عمي، ومن هو على ديني..؟؟ فقال لك: يا زبير، أما والله لتقاتلنه وأنت له ظالم"..!! قال الزبير رضي الله عنه: نعم أذكر الآن، وكنت قد نسيته، والله لا أقاتلك.. وأقلع الزبير وطلحة عن الاشتراك في هذه الحرب الأهلية.. أقلعا فور تبيّنهما الأمر، وعندما أبصرا عمار بن ياسر يحارب في صف عليّ، تذكرا قول رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم لعمّار: " تقتلك الفئة الباغية".. فان قتل عمّار اذن في هذه المعركة التي يشترك فيها طلحة، فسيكون طلحة باغيا... 
** 
انسحب طلحة والزبير من القتال، ودفعا ثمن ذلك الانسحاب حياتهما، ولكنهما لقيا الله قريرة أعينهما بما منّ عليهما من بصيرة وهدى.. أما الزبير فقد تعقبه رجل اسمه عمرو بن جرموز وقتله غيلة وغدرا وهو يصلي..!! وأما طلحة فقد رماه مروان بن الحكم بسهم أودى بحياته.. 
** 
كان مقتل عثمان قد تشكّل في نفسية طلحة، حتى صار عقدة حياته.. كل هذا، مع أنه لم يشترك بالقتل، ولم يحرّض عليه، وانما ناصر المعارضة ضدّه، يوم لم يكن يبدو أن المعارضة ستتمادى وتتأزم حتى تتحول الى تلك الجريمة البشعة.. وحين أخذ مكانه يوم الجمل مع الجيش المعادي لعلي بن أبي طالب والمطالب بدم عثمان، كان يرجو أن يكون في موقفه هذا كفّارة تريحه من وطأة ضميره.. وكان قبل بدء المعركة يدعو ويضرع بصوت تخنقه الدموع، ويقول: " اللهم خذ مني لعثمان اليوم حتى ترضى".. فلما واجهه عليّ هو والزبير، أضاءت كلمات عليّ جوانب نفسيهما، فرأيا الصواب وتركا أرض القتال.. بيد أن الشهادة من حظ طلحة يدركها وتدركه أيّان يكون.. ألم يقل الرسول عنه: " هذا ممن قضى نحبه، ومن سرّه أن يرى شهيدا يمشي على الأرض، فلينظر الى طلحة"..؟؟ لقي الشهيد اذن مصيره المقدور والكبير، وانتهت وقعة الجمل. وأدركت أم المؤمنين أنها تعجلت الأمور فغادرت البصرة الى البيت الحرام فالمدينة، نافضة يديها من هذا الصراع، وزوّدها الامام علي في رحلتها بكل وسائل الراحة والتكريم.. وحين كان عليّ يستعرض شهداء المعركة راح يصلي عليهم جميعا، الذين كانوا معه، والذين كانوا ضدّه.. ولما فرغ من دفن طلحة، والزبير، وقف يودعهما بكلمات جليلة، اختتمها قائلا: " اني لأرجو أن أكون أنا، وطلحة والزبير وعثمان من الذين قال الله فيهم: (ونزعنا مافي صدورهم من غل إخوانا على سرر متقابلين)".. ثم ضمّ قبريهما بنظراته الحانية الصافية الآسية وقال: " سمعت أذناي هاتان رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم يقول: " طلحة والزبير، جاراي في الجنّة"...
number-en: The story of Talha bin Ubaidullah
label-en:
Talha bin Ubaidullah - Saqr on Uhud

(Among the believers are men who are true to what they covenanted with God. Some of them have fulfilled their death, and some of them are waiting, and they have not changed anything)... The Messenger, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, recited this noble verse, then he faced the faces of his companions, and said while pointing to Talha: “Whoever is pleased to look at a man walking on the earth, and he has fulfilled his death, let him look at Talha.”..!! There was no good news that the companions of the Messenger of God wished for, and for which their hearts were filled with more longing than this which the Prophet Talha ibn Ubaid Allah imitated.. He was then reassured of the outcome of his affairs and the fate of his life.. He will live and die, and he is one of those who were true to what they promised God, and no temptation will overtake him, and no deception will overtake him.. The Messenger gave him good tidings of Paradise, so what was the life of this noble evangelist..?? 
** 
He was trading in the land of Busra when he met one of the best monks there, and he informed him that the Prophet who would emerge from the land of the Sacred Mosque, and whom the righteous prophets had predicted, had begun his era and brightened his days. Talha felt free to miss his procession, for it was the procession of guidance, mercy, and salvation. When Talha returned to his hometown of Mecca after months spent in Busra and on a journey, he found himself in a commotion among its people. And he heard them talking whenever he met one of them, or a group of them, about the trustworthy Muhammad.. and the revelation that comes to him.. and the message that he carries to the Arabs in particular, and to all people.. And he asked Talha the first thing he asked Abu Bakr, and he learned that he had returned with his caravan and his trade not long ago, and that he was standing next to Muhammad as a believer, an upholder, and an exemplary person.. And Talha himself spoke: Muhammad, and Abu Bakr..?? By God, the two will never meet on misguidance.!! Muhammad has reached forty years of age, and what we have been told during this lifetime is one lie. Would he lie to God today and say: He sent me and sent me a revelation...?? And this is what is difficult to believe.. Talha quickly walked, turning his face toward Abu Bakr’s house.. The conversation between them did not last long, as his longing to meet the Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace, and pledge allegiance to him was faster than the beating of his heart.. So Abu Bakr accompanied him to the Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace, where he converted to Islam and took his place in the blessed caravan.. Thus Talha was one of the early Muslims. ** 
Despite his prestige among his people, his vast wealth, and his successful trade, he suffered from the persecution of Quraysh, as he was assigned to him and Abu Bakr Nawfal bin Khuwaylid, and he was called the lion of Quraysh. However, their persecution did not last long, as Quraysh quickly became ashamed of themselves and feared the consequences of their affairs. Talha migrated to Medina when the Muslims ordered the migration, and then he witnessed all the scenes with the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace. And peace be upon him, except for the Battle of Badr, the Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace, had delegated him and Saeed bin Zaid with him for a mission outside Medina.. When they accomplished it and returned in a caravan to Medina, the Prophet and his companions were returning from the Battle of Badr, and they were distressed that they would miss the reward of participating with the Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace, in jihad in his first conquest. However, the Messenger gave them abundant reassurance, when he informed them that they would have a reward and reward exactly like that of the fighters, and he even divided to them the spoils of the battle like those who witnessed it. The Battle of Uhud came to witness all the tyranny of the Quraysh and all its might, as it came to avenge the Day of Badr and secure its fate by inflicting a final defeat on the Muslims, a defeat that the Quraysh considered to be an easy matter and a destined fate..!! A fierce war took place that quickly covered the earth with its painful harvest... and the battle revolved around the polytheists... Then when the Muslims saw them withdrawing, they laid down their weapons, and the archers descended from their positions to seize their share of the spoils... Suddenly the Quraish army suddenly returned from behind, and the corner of the war took control of the battle... and the fighting resumed its ferocity, cruelty and grinding, and the surprise had the effect of dispersing the ranks of the Muslims... Talha saw the side of the battle in which the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, was standing. His father had become a target for the forces of polytheism and idolatry, so he rushed towards the Messenger... and he began, may God be pleased with him, crossing a path that was longer than it was short...! A road where every inch is blocked by dozens of rabid swords and dozens of crazy spears!! He saw the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, from afar, with blood flowing from his cheeks and attacking himself. He became mad, and crossed the path of terror in one or two jumps. Before the Messenger, he found what he feared: the swords of the polytheists panting towards him, surrounding him, wanting to harm him. Talha stood like a hardened army, striking with his sharp sword right and left. He saw the noble Messenger’s blood flowing and his pain groaning, so he supported him and carried him away from the pit where his foot had fallen. He was supporting the Messenger, peace and blessings be upon him, with his left and chest, trailing him to a safe place, while with his right, may God bless his right, it struck with the sword and fought the polytheists who surrounded the Messenger, filling the battlefield like locusts..!! Let us let the friend Abu Bakr, may God be pleased with him, describe the scene for us. Aisha, may God be pleased with her, says: “When Abu Bakr mentioned the day of Uhud, he would say: All of that was the day of Talha.. I was the first to come to the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, and the Messenger, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said to me and to my father Ubaidah bin al-Jarrah: Take care of you, your brother. So we fixed his situation.” 
** 
In all the battles and battles, Talha was at the front of the ranks, seeking the face of God and ransoming the banner of His Messenger. Talha lives among the Muslim community, worships God with the worshipers, struggles in His cause with the mujahideen, and lays down with his hands and the arms of his brothers the foundations of the new religion that came to bring people out of darkness into light. If he fulfills the right of his Lord, he will travel throughout the land, seeking God’s grace, developing his profitable business and successful businesses. Talha, may God be pleased with him, was one of the wealthiest Muslims, and he increased their wealth... and all of his wealth was in the service of the religion whose banner he carried with the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace... He used to spend it without accounting... and God used to increase it for him without accounting! The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, called him Talha Al-Khair, Talha Al-Jawd, and Talha Al-Fayyad as a compliment to his overflowing generosity. How much of his wealth he took out at once, then God the Most Gracious returned it to him double. His wife, Saada bint Awf, spoke to us, saying: “I entered Talha’s house one day and saw that he was worried, so I asked him, ‘What’s the matter with you?’ He said, ‘The money I have has increased to the point that it is worrying me and distressing me.’ And I said to him, ‘What do you have to do? Divide it.’ So he got up and called the people, and began dividing it among them until there was not a dirham left of it.”... And again he sold his land for a high price, and he looked at the pile of money, and his eyes filled with tears, then he said: “ A man who spends this money spending the night in his house and does not know what is coming to him is arrogant in God... Then he called some of his friends and carried this money with them, and went through the streets and houses of the city distributing it, until dawn, and he did not have any dirhams of it..!! Jabir bin Abdullah describes Talha’s presence, saying: “I have never seen anyone give so much money to someone without asking, than Talha bin Ubaidullah.” He was the most kind person to his family and relatives, and he supported them all despite their large number. It was said about him about this: “.. He would not leave any of the Banu Taim as breadwinners unless he sufficed with his supplies and those of his dependents.. and he would marry off their families, serve their breadwinners, and pay off their debts.” He fined them.. Al-Sa’ib bin Zaid says: “I accompanied Talha bin Ubaidullah during travel and at home, and I did not find anyone more generous with dirhams, clothes, and food than Talha.”!! The well-known strife breaks out during the caliphate of Othman, may God be pleased with him. Talha supports the argument of those who oppose Othman, and approves of most of them in what they were seeking of change and reform. Was he, with this position, calling for the killing of Othman, or accepting him..?? No... even if he had known that the strife would escalate until it would eventually explode out of insane hatred, he would have vented himself in that heinous crime of which Dhul-Nurayn Othman, may God be pleased with him, became a victim. We say: If he had known that the sedition would reach this impasse and its end, he would have resisted it, and the rest of the companions who supported it would have resisted it with him at the beginning as an opposition movement and a warning, nothing more... However, this position of Talha, turned into the complication of his life after the horrific way in which Othman was besieged and killed. No sooner had Imam Ali accepted the pledge of allegiance from the Muslims in Medina, including Talha and Al-Zubayr, than the two of them asked permission to go out to Mecca for Umrah... and from Mecca they headed To Basra, where many forces were gathering to take revenge on Uthman. The Battle of the Camel was where the party demanding the blood of Uthman and the party supporting Ali met. And whenever Ali turned his thoughts to the difficult situation that Islam and Muslims were going through in this terrible dispute, his worries rose, his tears fell, and his sobs rose louder..!! He was forced into the dilemma of Al-Waar. As the Caliph of the Muslims, he cannot and does not have the right to tolerate any rebellion against the state, or any armed opposition to legitimate authority. When he rises up to suppress a rebellion of this kind, he must confront his brothers, his companions, his friends, and the followers of his Messenger and his religion, those with whom he has always fought the armies of polytheism, and fought together under the banner of monotheism the battles that melted and polished them, and made them brothers, even mutually supportive brothers.. So what predicament is this..? What difficult test? In order to seek a way out of this impasse, and to preserve the blood of Muslims, Imam Ali did not leave any means but to beg for it, and no hope but to cling to it. But the elements that were working against Islam, and there were many of them, and that met their tragic fate at the hands of the Muslim state, during the days of its great monarch Omar, these elements had tightened the weave of strife, and began to nourish it and continue its course and exacerbate it... 
** 
Ali wept profusely when he saw the Mother of the Believers, Aisha, in her howdah at the head of the army that was now going out to fight him. And when he saw in the midst of the army Talha and Al-Zubayr, the two servants of the Messenger of God... So he called Talha and Al-Zubayr to go out to him, and they went out until their horses’ necks were separated. So he said to Talha: “O Talha, you have brought the wedding of the Messenger of God so that you can fight with it.” And you hid your wedding in the house”..?? Then he said to Zubair: “O Zubair, I called upon you by God. I remember the day the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, passed by you while we were in such and such place, and he said to you: O Zubair, don’t you love Ali..?” So I said: Don't I love my cousin, my cousin, and whoever follows my religion..?? He said to you: O Zubair, by God you will fight him while you are unjust to him. They took off as soon as they realized the matter, and when they saw Ammar bin Yasser fighting on the side of Ali, they remembered what the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, had said to Ammar: “The oppressive faction will kill you.” So if Ammar is killed in this battle in which Talha is participating, Talha will be a transgressor... 
** 
Talha and Al-Zubayr withdrew from the fighting, and paid the price for that withdrawal with their lives, but they met God, the comfort of their eyes, with the insight and guidance He bestowed upon them.. As for Al-Zubayr, a man named Amr bin Jarmuz pursued him and killed him by attack and treachery while he was praying..!! As for Talha, Marwan bin Al-Hakam shot him with an arrow that killed him. ** 
The killing of Othman had shaped Talha’s psyche, until it became the knot of his life... All this, even though he did not participate in the killing, nor did he incite it, but rather supported the opposition against him, at a time when it did not seem that the opposition would go further and deteriorate until it turned into that heinous crime... And when he took his place on the Day of the Camel with the army hostile to Ali bin Abi Talib and demanding Othman’s blood, he hoped that this position would be an atonement that would relieve him of the burden of his conscience... and he was Before the start of the battle, he prays and prays in a voice choked with tears, and says: “Oh God, take from me today for Uthman until you are satisfied.” When Ali and Al-Zubayr confronted him, Ali’s words illuminated the aspects of their souls, so they saw what was right and left the battlefield... However, martyrdom is a part of Talha’s luck. He realizes it and she realizes who he is... Didn’t the Messenger say about him: “This is one of those who has died, and whoever is pleased to see a martyr walking on the ground, let him look at Talha”..?? The martyr then met his fateful and great fate, and the Battle of the Camel ended. The Mother of the Believers realized that she had rushed matters, so she left Basra for the Sacred House and Medina, freeing herself from this conflict, and Imam Ali provided her with all means of comfort and honor on her journey. And when Ali was reviewing the martyrs of the battle, he began to pray for all of them, those who were with him and those who were against him... And when he finished burying Talha and Al-Zubayr, he stood up and bid them farewell with solemn words, concluding them by saying: “I hope that I, Talha, Al-Zubayr and Othman will be among those about whom God said: (And We removed from their breasts the hatred of our brothers on beds facing each other)”.. Then he joined their graves with his pure, tender gaze. Al-Asiyah and said: “These two ears of mine heard the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, saying: ‘Talha and Al-Zubayr, my neighbors in Paradise’...
