عمير بن سعد - نسيج وحده

أتذكرون سعيد بن عامر..؟؟ ذلك الزاهد العابد الأوّاب الذي حمله أمير المؤمنين عمر على قبول امارة الشام وولايتها.. لقد تحدثنا عنه في كتابنا هذا، ورأينا من زهده وترفعه، ومن ورعه العجب كله.. وها نحن أولاء، نلتقي على هذه الصفات بأخ له، بل توأم، في الورع وفي الزهد، وفي الترفع.. وفي عظمة النفس التي تجل عن النظير..!! انه عمير بن سعد.. كان المسلمون يلقبونه نشيج وحده!! وناهيك برجل يجمع على تلقيبه بهذا اللقب أصحاب رسول الله، وبما معهم من فضل وفهم ونور..!! 
** 
أبوه سعد القارئ رضي الله عنه.. شهد بدرا مع رسول الله والمشاهد بعدها.. وظلّ أمينا على العهد حتى لقي الله شهيدا في موقعة القادسية. ولقد اصطحب ابنه الى الرسول، فبايع النبي وأسلم.. ومنذ أسلم عمير وهو عابد مقيم في محراب الله. يهرب من الأضواء، ويفيئ الى سكينة الظلال. هيهات أن تعثر عليه في الصفوف الأولى، الا أن تكون صلاة، فهو يرابط في صفها الأول ليأخذ ثواب السابقين.. والا أن يكون جهاد، فهو يهرول الى الصفوف الأولى، راجيا أن يكون من المستشهدين..! وفيما عدا هذا، فهو هناك عاكف على نفسه ينمي برّها، وخيرها وصلاحها وتقاها..!! متبتل، ينشد أوبه..!! أوّاب، يبكي ذنبه..!! مسافر الى الله في كل ظعن، وفي كل مقام... 
** 
ولقد جعل الله له في قلوب الأصحاب ودّا، فكان قرّة أعينهم ومهوى أفئدتهم.. ذلم أن قوة ايمانه، وصفاء نفسه، وهدوء سمته، وعبير خصاله، واشراق طلعته، كان يجعله فرحة وبهجة لكل من يجالسه، أ، يراه. ولم يكن يؤثر على دينه أحدا، ولا شيئا. سمع يوما جلاس بن سويد بن الصامت، وكان قريبا له.. سمعه يوما وهو في دارهم يقول:" لئن كان الرجل صادقا، لنحن شرّ من الحمر"..!! وكان يعني بالرجل رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم. وكان جلاس من الذين دخلوا الاسلام رهبا. سمع عمير بن سعد هذه العبارات ففجرت في نفسه الوديعة الهادئة الغيظ والحيرة.. الغيظ، لأن واحدا يزعم أنه من المسلمين يتناول الرسول بهذه اللهجة الرديئة.. والحيرة، لأن خواطره دارت سريعا على مسؤوليته تجاه هذا الذي سمع وأنكر.. ينقل ما سمع الى رسول الله؟؟ كيف، والمجالس بالأمانة..؟؟ أيسكت ويطوي صدره ما سمع؟ كيف؟؟ وأين ولاؤه ووفاؤه للرسول الذي هداهم الله به من ضلالة، وأخرجهم من ظلمة..؟ لكن حيرته لم تطل، فصدق النفس يجددائما لصاحبه مخرجا.. وعلى الفور تصرّف عمير كرجل قوي، وكمؤمن تقي.. فوجه حديثه الى جلاس بن سويد.. " والله يا جلا، انك لمن أحب الناس الي، وأحسنهم عندي يدا، وأعزهم عليّ أن يصيبه شيء يكرهه.. ولقد قلت الآن مقالة لو أذعتها عنك لآذتك.. وان صمتّ عليها، ليهلكن ديني، وان حق الدين لأولى بالوفاء، واني مبلغ رسول الله ما قلت"..! وأرضى عمير ضميره الورع تماما.. فهو أولا أدّى أمانة المجلس حقها، وارتفع بنفسه الكبيرة عن ان يقوم بدور المتسمّع الواشي.. وهو ثانيا أدى لدينه حقه، فكشف عن نفاق مريب.. وهو ثالثا أعطى جلاس فرصة للرجوع عن خطئه واستغفار الله منه حين صارحه بأنه سيبلغ الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم، ولو أنه فعل آنئذ، لاستراح ضمير عمير ولم تعد به حاجة لابلاغ الرسول عليه السلام.. بيد أن جلاسا أخذته العزة بالاثم، ولم تتحرك شفتاه بكلمة أسف أو اعتذار، وغادرهم عمير وهو يقول: " لأبلغنّ رسول الله قبل أن ينزل وحي يشركني في اثمك"... وبعث رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم في طلب جلاس فأنكر أنه قال، بل حلف بالله كاذبا..!! لكن آية القرآن جاءت تفصل بين الحق والباطل: ( يحلفون بالله ما قالوا ولقد قالوا كلمة الكفر وكفروا بعد إسلامهم وهموا بما لم ينالوا وما نقموا إلا أن أغناهم الله ورسوله من فضله فإن يتوبوا يك خيرا لهم وإن يتولوا يعذبهم الله عذابا أليما في الدنيا والآخرة وما لهم في الأرض من ولي ولا نصير).. واضطر جلاس أن يعترف بمقاله، وأن يعتذر عن خطيئته، لا سيما حين رأى الآية الكريمة التي تقرر ادانته، تعده في نفس اللحظة برحمة اله ان تاب هو وأقلع: " فان يتوبوا، يك خيرا لهم".. وكان تصرّف عمير هذا خيرا وبركة على جلاس فقد تاب وحسن اسلامه.. وأخذ النبي بأذن عمير وقال له وهو يغمره بسناه: " يا غلام.. وفت اذنك.. وصدّقك ربك"..!! 
** 
لقد سعدت بلقاء عمير لأول مرة، وأنا أكتب كتابي بين يدي عمر. وبهرني، كما لم يبهرني شيء، نبأه مع أمير المؤمنين.. هذا النبأ الذي سأرويه الآن لكم، لتشهدوا من خلاله العظمة في أبهى مشارقها.. 
** 
تعلمون أن أمير المؤمنين عمر رضي الله عنه كان يختار ولاته وكأنه يختار قدره..!! كان يختارهم من الزاهدين الورعين، والأمناء الصادقين.. الذين يهربون من الامارة والولاية، ولا يقبلونها الا حين يكرههم عليها أمير المؤمنين.. وكان برغم بصيرته النافذة وخبرته المحيطة يستأني طويلا، ويدقق كثيرا في اختيار ولاته ومعاونيه.. وكان لا يفتأ يردد عبارته المأثورة: " أريد رجلا اذا كان في القوم، وليس أميرا عليهم بدا وكأنه أميرهم.. واذا كان فيهم وهو عليهم امير، بدا وكأنه واحد منهم..!! أريد واليا، لا يميز نفسه على الناس في ملبس، ولا في مطعم، ولا في مسكن.. يقيم فيهم الصلاة.. ويقسم بينهم بالحق.. ويحكم فيهم بالعدل.. ولا يغلق بابه دون حوائجهم".. وفي ضوء هذه المعايير الصارمة، اختار ذات يوم عمير بن سعد واليا على حمص.. وحاول عمير أن يخلص منها وينجو، ولكن أمير المؤمنين ألزمه بها الزاما، وفرضها عليه فرضا.. واستخار الله ،ومضى الى واجبخ وهمله.. وفي حمص مضى عليه عام كامل، لم يصل الى المدينة منه خراج.. بل ولم يبلغ أمير المؤمنين رضي الله عنه منه كتاب.. ونادى أمير المؤمنين كاتبه وقال له: " اكتب الى عمير ليأتي الينا".. وهنا أستأذنكم في أن أنقل صورة اللقاء بين عمر وعمير، كما هي في كتابي بين يدي عمر. " ذات يوم شهدت شوارع المدينة رجلا أشعث أغبر، تغشاه وعثاء السفر، يكاذ يقتلع خطاه من الأرض اقتلاعا، من طول ما لاقى من عناء، وما بذل من جهد.. على كتفه اليمنى جراب وقصعة.. وعلى كتفه اليسرى قربة صغيرة فيها ماء..! وانه ليتوكأ على عصا، لا يؤدها حمله الضامر الوهنان..!! ودلف الى مجلس عمر فى خطى وئيدة.. السلام عليك يا امير المؤمنين.. ويرد عمر السلام، ثم يسأله، وقد آلمه ما رآه عليه من جهد واعياء: ما شأنك يا عمير..؟؟ شأني ما ترى.. ألست تراني صحيح البدن، طاهر الدم، معي الدنيا أجرّها بقرنيها..؟؟!! قال عمر: وما معك..؟ قال عمير: معي جرابي أحمل فيه زادي.. وقصعتي آكل فيها.. واداوتي أحمل فيها وضوئي وشرابي.. وعصاي أتوكأ عليها، وأجاهد بها عدوّا ان عرض.. فوالله ما الدنيا الا تبع لمتاعي..!! قال عمر: أجئت ماشيا.. عمير: نعم.. عمر: أولم تجد من يعطيك دابة تركبها..؟ عمير: انهم لم يفعلوا.. واني لم أسألهم.. عمر: فماذا عملت فيما عهدنا اليك به...؟ عمير: أتيت البلد الذي يعثتني اليه، فجمعت صلحاء أهله، ووليتهم جباية فيئهم وأموالهم، حتى اذا جمعوها وضعوها في مواضعها.. ولو بقي لك منها شيء لأتيتك به..!! عمر: فما جئتنا بشيء..؟ عمير: لا.. فصاح عمر وهو منبهر سعيد: جدّدوا لعمير عهدا.. وأجابه عمير في استغناء عظيم: تلك أيام قد خلت.. لا عملت لك، ولا لأحد بعدك"..!! هذه لصورة ليست سيناريو نرسمه، وليست حوارا نبتدعه.. انما هي واقعة تاريخية، شهدتها ذات يوم أرض المدينة عاصمة الاسلام في أيام خلده وعظمته. فأي طراز من الرجال كان أولئك الأفذاذ الشاهقون..؟!! 
** 
وكان عمر رضي الله عنه يتمنى ويقول: " وددت لو أن لي رجالا مثل عمير أستعين بهم على أعمال المسلمين".. ذلك أن عميرا الذي وصفه أصحابه بحق بأنه نسيج وحده كان قد تفوّق على كل ضعف انساني يسببه وجودنا المادي، وحياتنا الشائكة.. ويوم كتب على هذا القدّيس العظيم أن يجتاز تجربة الولاية والحكم، لم يزدد ورعه بها اا مضاء ونماء وتألقا.. ولقد رسم وهو أمير على حمص واجبات الحاكم المسلم في كلمات طالما كان يصدح بها في حشود المسلمين من فوق المنبر. وها هي ذي: " ألا ان الاسلام حائط منيع، وباب وثيق فحائط الاسلام العدل.. وبابه الحق.. فاذا نقض الحائط، وحطّم الباب، استفتح الاسلام. ولا يزال الاسلام منيعا ما اشتدّ السلطان وليست شدّة السلطان قتلا بالسيف، ولا ضربا بالسوط.. ولكن قضاء بالحق، وأخذا بالعدل"..!! والآن نحن نودّع عميرا.. ونجييه في اجلال وخشوع، تعالوا نحن رؤوسنا وجباهنا: لخير المعلمين: محمد.. لامام المتقين: محمد.. لرحمة الله المهداة الى الناس في قيظ الحياة عليه من الله صلاته. وسلامه.. وتحياته وبركاته.. وسلام على آله الآطهار.. وسلام على أصحابه الأبرار...
number-en: The story of Umair bin Saad
label-en:
Omair bin Saad - Weaving alone

Do you remember Saeed bin Amer..?? That ascetic, devout, virtuous person whom Omar, the Commander of the Faithful, forced to accept the emirate of the Levant and its authority... We have talked about him in this book of ours, and we have seen his asceticism and elevation, and his piety, all the wonder... And here we are, meeting with these qualities a brother of his, even a twin, in piety, asceticism, and elevation... and in the greatness of the soul that is beyond compare...!! He is Umair bin Saad. Muslims used to call him Nasheed Alone!! Not to mention a man who is unanimously called by this title by the companions of the Messenger of God, and because of their virtue, understanding, and light..!! 
** 
His father, Saad Al-Qari, may God be pleased with him, witnessed Badr with the Messenger of God and the scenes after it. He remained faithful to the covenant until he met God as a martyr in the Battle of Al-Qadisiyah. He took his son to the Messenger, so he pledged allegiance to the Prophet and converted to Islam. Since Umair converted to Islam, he has been a worshiper residing in the shrine of God. He flees from the lights and retreats to the tranquility of the shadows. It is impossible for you to find him in the first rows, unless it is a prayer, as he stands in the first row to take the reward of those who preceded him. Otherwise it is jihad, then he runs to the first ranks, hoping to be among the martyrs..! In addition to this, he is there devoted to himself, developing his righteousness, goodness, righteousness, and piety..!! Wet, chanting his repentance..!! Repentant, crying over his sin..!! A traveler to God in every situation and in every position... 
** 
God placed love for him in the hearts of his companions, and he was the apple of their eyes and the darling of their hearts. The strength of his faith, the purity of his soul, the calmness of his countenance, the fragrance of his qualities, and the radiance of his countenance made him a joy and delight to everyone who sat with him, or saw him. He did not influence anyone or anything in his religion. One day he heard Glass bin Suwayd bin Al-Samit, who was close to him.. He heard him one day while he was in their house saying: “If the man were truthful, we would be worse than the reds”..!! By man he meant the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace. Glass was one of those who converted to Islam as a monk. Umair bin Saad heard these expressions, and anger and confusion exploded in his meek and quiet soul... anger, because someone claiming to be a Muslim addressed the Messenger with such a bad tone... and confusion, because his thoughts quickly turned to his responsibility towards this one who heard and denied... Conveying what he heard to the Messenger of God?? How, and the councils are honest..?? Did he remain silent and fold his chest over what he heard? how?? Where is his loyalty and loyalty to the Messenger through whom God guided them from misguidance and brought them out of darkness? But his confusion did not last long. Honesty always finds a way out for its owner. Immediately, Umair acted like a strong man and a pious believer. He directed his conversation to Jalas bin Suwayd. “By God, Jalla, you are one of the people I love the most, the best of, and the most dear to me. If something happens to him that he hates, I have just said something that if I were to broadcast it about you, I would hurt you.” And if I remain silent on her, my debt will be destroyed, and the right of the debt is more deserving of being fulfilled, and I will inform the Messenger of God of what I said..! Umair satisfied his pious conscience completely. Firstly, he fulfilled the council’s trustworthiness, and raised his great self from playing the role of a snitching listener. Secondly, he fulfilled his debt due, revealing suspicious hypocrisy. Thirdly, he gave Glass an opportunity to recant his mistake and seek God’s forgiveness from him when he made it clear that he would inform the Messenger. May God’s prayers and peace be upon him, and if he had done so at that time, Umair’s conscience would have been at ease and he would have no longer needed to inform the Messenger, peace be upon him. However, Jalasa’s pride took him to sin, and his lips did not move with a word of regret or apology, and Umair left them saying: “I will inform the Messenger of God before a revelation comes down that makes me a partner in your sin.” The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, sent for Jalasa, but he denied that he had said that. Rather, he swore to God falsely..!! But the verse of the Qur’an came to separate truth from falsehood: (They swear by God that they did not say, and indeed they did say the word of disbelief, and they disbelieved after their conversion to Islam, and they were anxious about what they did not obtain, and they did not take vengeance except that God and His Messenger enriched them of His bounty. If they repent, it will be better for them. But if they turn away, God will punish them with a painful punishment in this world and the Hereafter, and they will have no reward on earth. A guardian and no helper)... Glass was forced to confess his statement and apologize for his sin, especially when he saw the noble verse that condemned him, promising him at the same moment the mercy of God if he repented and gave up: “And if they repent, it will be better for them.” This action of Umair was good and a blessing for Glass, as he repented and converted to Islam. The Prophet took Umair’s ear and said to him while lapping his teeth: “Oh boy. Your permission..and your Lord has spoken the truth to you..!! 
** 
I had the pleasure of meeting Omair for the first time, while writing my book in Omair's hands. I was amazed, as nothing had amazed me, by his news with the Commander of the Faithful. This is the news that I will now tell you, so that you can witness greatness at its finest. 
** 
You know that the Commander of the Faithful Omar, may God be pleased with him, used to choose his governors as if he was choosing his destiny..!! He would choose them from among the pious ascetics and honest people... who would flee from emirate and guardianship, and would not accept it except when the Commander of the Faithful forced them to do so... and despite his penetrating insight and extensive experience, he would take his time for a long time and be very careful in choosing his governors and assistants... and he would not stop repeating his famous phrase: “I want a man who is among the people, and not their prince, who appears to be their prince.. And if there was a prince among them and he over them, he seemed as if he was one of them..!! I want a governor who does not distinguish himself from the people in terms of clothing, food, or residence. He performs prayers among them. He divides among them with justice. He rules over them justly. He does not close his door without their needs. In light of these strict criteria, one day he chose Umair bin Saad as governor of Homs. Umair tried to get rid of it and survive, but the Commander of the Faithful obligated him to do it and imposed it on him. He asked God for help and went on to do his duty. And he neglected him.. In Homs, a full year has passed, and no abscess has reached the city from him.. In fact, the Commander of the Faithful, may God be pleased with him, did not receive a letter from him.. The Commander of the Faithful called his clerk and said to him: “Write to Umayr so that he may come to us.” Here I ask your permission to convey the picture of the meeting between Omar and Umayr, as it is in my book in the hands of Omar. “One day, the streets of the city witnessed a disheveled, dusty man, covered by the turmoil of travel. His footsteps were almost uprooted from the ground, due to the long hardship he had endured and the effort he had exerted. On his right shoulder was a bag and a bowl. And on his left shoulder was a small waterskin containing water..! He was leaning on a stick, which his weak, atrophied burden could not support..!! And he entered Omar’s seat with slow steps.. Peace be upon you, O Commander of the Faithful.. Omar returned the greeting, then asked him, and he was pained by the effort and exhaustion he saw on him: What is the matter with you, O Amir..?? What do you see about me? Don’t you see that I am healthy in body, pure in blood, and have the world’s reward with its horns??!! Omar said: What do you have? Umair said: I have my sock in which I carry my food.. and my bowl in which I eat.. and my tools in which I carry my ablution and my drink.. and my staff on which I lean, and with which I fight an enemy, even if he shows up.. By God, the world is nothing but a subsidiary of my enjoyment..!! Omar said: I came walking.. Omair: Yes.. Omar: Didn’t you find someone to give you an animal to ride..? Omair: They did not.. and I did not ask them.. Omar: So what did you do with what we entrusted you with...? Umair: I came to the country to which you were sending me, gathered its righteous people, and appointed them to collect their livestock and their money, until when they collected them, they put them in their places.. If you had any of it left, I would have brought it to you..!! Omar: Why did you bring us anything? Omair: No.. Omar shouted in amazement. Saeed: Renew a covenant with Umair.. Umair answered him with great dispensation: Those are days that have passed.. I did not work for you, nor for anyone after you..!! This is an image that is not a scenario that we draw, nor a dialogue that we invent.. Rather, it is a historical incident, witnessed one day in the land of Medina, the capital of Islam in the days of its immortality and greatness. What kind of men were these towering figures?! 
** 
Omar, may God be pleased with him, wished and said: “I wish I had men like Umair whom I could use to help in the affairs of the Muslims.” This is because Umair, whom his companions rightly described as a fabricator alone, had surpassed every human weakness caused by our material existence and our thorny life. And on the day this great saint was destined to pass the experience of guardianship and rule, his piety for it only increased, grew, and shine. While he was Emir of Homs, he depicted the duties of a Muslim ruler in words that he had always cherished. It is chanted to crowds of Muslims from the pulpit. And here it is: “But Islam is an impenetrable wall and a close door, so the wall of Islam is justice... and its door is truth... so if the wall is broken down and the door is destroyed, Islam will be opened. Islam will remain invincible as long as the authority is strong, and the severity of the authority is not killing with the sword, nor striking with the whip... but adjudicating the truth and adhering to justice”..!! And now we bid farewell to Umair... and greet him with reverence and humility. Come, let us keep our heads and foreheads: For the best of teachers: Muhammad... For the imam of the pious: Muhammad... For the mercy of God given to people in the heat of life. May his prayers be upon him from God. And his peace.. and his greetings and blessings.. and peace be upon his pure family.. And peace be upon his righteous companions...

label:
عمران بن حصين - شبيه الملائكة

عام خيبر، أقبل على رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم مبايعا.. ومنذ وضع يمينه في يمين الرسول أصبحت يده اليمنى موضع تكريم كبير، فآلى على نفسه ألا يستخدمها الا في كل عمل طيّب، وكريم.. هذه الظاهرة تنبئ عما يتمتع به صاحبها من حسّ دقيق. 
** 
وعمران بن حصين رضي الله عنه صورة رضيّة من صور الصدق، والزهد، والورع، والتفاني وحب الله وطاعته... وان معه من توفيق الله ونعمة الهدى لشيئا كثيرا، ومع ذلك فهو لا يفتأ يبكي، ويبكي، ويقول: " يا ليتني كنت رمادا، تذروه الرياح"..!! ذلك أن هؤلاء الرجال لم يكونوا يخافون الله بسبب ما يدركون من ذنب، فقلما كانت لهم بعد اسلامهم ذنوب.. انما كانوا يخافونه ويخشونه بقدر ادراكهم لعظمته وجلاله،وبقدر ادراكهم لحقيقة عجزهم عن شكره وعبادته، فمهما يضرعوا، ويركعوا، ومهما يسجدوا، ويعبدوا.. ولقد سأل أصحاب الرسول يوما رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم فقالوا: " يا رسول الله، مالنا اذا كنا عندك رقت قلوبنا، وزهدنا دنيانا، وكأننا نرى الآخرة رأي العين.. حتى اذا خرجنا من عندك، ولقينا أهلنا، وأولادنا، ودنيانا، أنكرنا أنفسنا..؟؟" فأجابهم عليه السلام: " والذي نفسي بيده، لو تدومون على حالكم عندي، لصافحتكم الملائكة عيانا، ولكن ساعة.. وساعة. وسمع عمران بن حصين هذا الحديث. فاشتعلت أشواقه.. وكأنما آلى على نفسه ألا يقعد دون تلك الغاية الجليلة ولو كلفته حياته، وكأنما لم تقنع همّته بأن يحيا حياته ساعة.. وساعة.. فأراد أن تكون كلها ساعة واحدة موصولة النجوى والتبتل لله رب العالمين..!! 
** 
وفي خلافة أمير المؤمنين عمر بن الخطاب أرسله الخليفة الى البصرة ليفقه أهلها ويعلمهم.. وفي البصرة حطّ رحاله، وأقبل عليه أهلها مذ عرفوه يتبركون به، ويستضيؤن بتقواه. قال الحسن البصري، وابن سيرين: " ما قدم البصرة من أصحاب رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم أحد بفضل عمران بن حصين" كان عمران يرفض أن يشغله عن الله وعبادته شاغل، استغرق في العبادة، واستوعبته العبادة حتى صار كأنه لا ينتمي الى عالم الدنيا التي يعيش فوق أرضها وبين ناسها.. أجل.. صار كأنه ملك يحيا بين الملائكة، يحادثونه ويحادثهم.. ويصافحونه ويصافحهم.. 
** 
ولما وقع النزاع الكبير بين المسلمين، بين فريق علي وفريق معاوية، لم يقف عمران موقف الحيدة وحسب، بل راح يرفع صوته بين الناس داعيا ايّاهم أن يكفوا عن الاشتراك في تلك الحرب، حاضنا قضية الاسلام خير محتضن.. وراح يقول للناس: " لأن أرعى أعنزا حضنيات في رأس جبل حتى يدركني الموت، أحبّ اليّ من أن أرمي في أحد الفريقين بسهم، أخطأ أم أصاب".. وكان يوصي من يلقاه من المسلمين قائلا: " الزم مسجدك.. فان دخل عليك، فالزم بيتك.. فان دخل عليك بيتك من يريد نفسك ومالك فقاتله".. 
** 
وحقق ايمان عمران بن حصين أعظم نجاح، حين أصابه مرض موجع لبث معه ثلاثين عاما، ما ضجر منه ولا قال: أفّ.. بل كان مثابرا على عبادته قائما، وقاعدا وراقدا.. وكان اذا هوّن عليه اخوانه وعوّاده أمر علته بكلمات مشجعة، ابتسم لها وقال: " ان أحبّ الأشياء الى نفسي، أحبها الى الله"..!! وكانت وصيته لأهله واخوانه حين أدركه الموت: " اذا رجعتم من دفني، فانحروا وأطعموا".. أجل لينحروا ويطعموا، فموت مؤمن مثل عمران بن حصين ليس موتا، انما هو حف زفاف عظيم، ومجيد، تزف فيه روح عالية راضية الى جنّة عرضها السموات والأرض أعدّت للمتقين...
number-en: The story of Imran bin Hussein
label-en:
Imran bin Hussein - similar to angels

In the year of Khaybar, he came to the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, pledging allegiance. Since he placed his right hand in the right hand of the Messenger, his right hand became an object of great honor, so he vowed to himself not to use it except for every good and noble deed. This phenomenon indicates the precise sensitivity of its owner. 
** 
Imran bin Husayn, may God be pleased with him, is a pleasing example of honesty, asceticism, piety, devotion, love of God and obedience to Him... And he has with him God’s grace and the blessing of guidance for many things, and yet he does not stop crying and weeping and saying: “I wish I were ashes, blown away by the winds”..!! This is because these men did not fear God because of their perceived sins, as they rarely committed any sins after their conversion to Islam. Rather, they feared Him and feared Him to the extent of their awareness of His greatness and majesty, and to the extent of their awareness of the fact of their inability to thank and worship Him, no matter how much they prayed, bowed, how much they prostrated, and worshiped. The Companions of the Messenger one day asked the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, and they said: “O Messenger of God, What would happen to us if we were with you, our hearts were softened, and we renounced our worldly life, as if we saw the afterlife with our own eyes... until when we left you, and met our families, our children, and our worldly life, we denied ourselves...??” He, peace be upon him, replied to them: “By the One in Whose Hand is my soul, if you had continued as you are with me, the angels would have shaken your hand with our eyes, but for an hour... and an hour. And Imran bin Husayn heard this hadith, and his longings were kindled... as if he had vowed to himself not to sit without that solemn goal even if it cost him his life, and as if his determination was not satisfied to live his life for an hour... and an hour... so he wanted it all to be one hour, connected with sincerity and devotion to God.” Lord of the worlds..!! 
** 
During the caliphate of the Commander of the Faithful, Omar bin Al-Khattab, the Caliph sent him to Basra to teach its people and teach them... In Basra, he landed, and its people came to him since they knew him, seeking their blessings from him and being illuminated by his piety. Al-Hasan Al-Basri and Ibn Sirin said: “None of the Companions of the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, came to Basra thanks to Imran bin Husayn.” Imran refused to be distracted from God and worshiping Him. He became immersed in worship, and worship absorbed him until he became as if he did not belong to the world of the world on whose land he lived and among its people. 
** 
When the great conflict occurred between the Muslims, between the team of Ali and the team of Muawiyah, Imran not only took a neutral stance, but he began to raise his voice among the people, calling on them to stop participating in that war, embracing the cause of Islam with the best embrace... and he began to say to the people: “Because I take care of my goats at the top of a mountain until death overtakes me, is more beloved to me than shooting an arrow at one of the two teams, whether I am wrong or right.” He used to advise the Muslims he met, saying: “Stay committed.” Your mosque.. If he enters upon you, stay in your house.. If someone who wants your life and your money enters your house, then fight him.” 
** 
The faith of Imran bin Hussein achieved the greatest success when he was afflicted with a painful illness that remained with him for thirty years. He never got tired of it and did not say, “Ugh.” Rather, he was persistent in his worship, standing, sitting, and lying down.. And when his brothers and friends made things easy for him, he addressed his illness with encouraging words. He smiled at them and said, “If I love things to myself, I love them to God.” His advice to his family and brothers when death overtook him was: “When you return from my burial, sacrifice and feed yourself.” Yes, let them sacrifice and provide food. The death of a believer like Imran bin Husayn is not death, but rather a great and glorious wedding ceremony, in which a high, contented soul is led into a paradise as wide as the heavens and the earth, prepared for the righteous...

عمرو بن العاص - محرّر مصر من الرومان

كانوا ثلاثة في قريش، اتبعوا رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم بعنف مقاومتهم دعوته وايذائهم أصحابه.. وراح الرسول يدعو عليهم، ويبتهل الى ربه الكريم أن ينزل بهم عقابه.. واذ هو يدعو ويدعو، تنزل الوحي على قلبه بهذه الآية الكريمة.. ( ليس لك من الأمر شيء أو يتوب عليهم أو يعذبهم، فانهم ظالمون).. وفهم الرسول من الآية أنها أمر له بالكف عن الدعاء عليهم، وترك أمرهم الى الله وحده.. فامّا أن يظلوا على ظلمهم، فيحلّ بهم عذابه.. أو يتوب عليهم فيتوبوا، وتدركهم رحمته.. كان عمرو بن العاص أحد هؤلاء الثلاثة.. ولقد اختار الله لهم طريق التوبة والرحمة وهداهم الى الاسلام.. وتحول عمرو بن العاص الى مسلم مناضل. والى قائد من قادة الاسلام البواسل.. وعلى الرغم من بعض مواقف عمرو التي لا نستطيع أن نقتنع بوجهة نظره فيها، فان دوره كصحابيّ جليل بذل وأعطى، ونافح وكافح، سيظل يفتح على محيّاه أعيننا وقلوبنا.. وهنا في مصر بالذات، سيظل الذين يرون الاسلام دينا قيما مجيدا.. ويرون في رسوله رحمة مهداة، ونعمة موجاة، ورسول صدق عظيم، دعا الى الله على بصيرة، وألهم الحياة كثيرا من رشدها وتقاها.. سيظل الذين يحملون هذا الايمان مشحوذي الولاء للرجل الذي جعلته الأقدار سببا، وأي سبب، لاهداء الاسلام الى مصر، واهداء مصر الى الاسلام.. فنعمت الهداية ونعم مهديها.. ذلكم هو: عمرو بن العاص رضي الله عنه.. ولقد تعوّد المؤرخون أن ينعتوا عمرا بـ فاتح مصر.. بيد أنا نرى في هذا الوصف تجوزا وتجاوزا، ولعل أحق النعوت بعمرو أن ندعوه بـ محرر مصر.. فالاسلام لم يكن يفتح البلاد بالمفهوم الحديث للفتح، انما كان يحررها من تسلط امبراطوريتين سامتا العباد والبلاد سوء العذاب، تانك هما: امبراطورية الفرس.ز وامبراطورية الروم.. ومصر بالذات، يوم أهلت عليها طلائع الاسلام كانت نهبا للرومان وكان أهلها يقاومون دون جدوى.. ولما دوّت فوق مشارف بلادهم صيحات الكتائب المؤمنة أن: " الله أكبر.. الله أكبر".. سارعوا جميعا في زحام مجيد صوب الفجر الوافد وعانقوه، واجدين فيه خلاصهم من قيصر ومن الرومان.. فعمرو بن العاص ورجاله، لم يفتحوا مصر اذن.. انما فتحوا الطريق أمام مصر لتصل بالحق مصايرها.. وتربط بالعدل مقاديرها.. وتجد نفسها وحقيقتها في ضوء كلمات الله، ومبادئ الاسلام.. ولقد كان رضي الله عنه حريصا على أن يباعد أهل مصر وأقباطها عن المعركة، ليظل القتال محصورا بينه وبين جنود الرومان الين يحتلون البلاد ويسرقون أرزاق أهلها.. من أجل ذلك نجده يتحدث الى زعماء النصارى يومئذ وكبار أشاقفتهم، فيقول: "... ان الله بعث محمدا بالحق وأمره به.. وانه عليه الصلاة والسلام، قد أدّى رسالته، ومضى بعد أن تركنا على الواضحة أي الطريق الواضح المستقيم.. وكان مما أمرنا به الاعذار الى الناس، فنحن ندعوكم الى الاسلام.. فمن أجابنا، فهو منا، له ما لنا وعليه ما علينا.. ومن لم يجبنا الى الاسلام، عرضنا عليه الجزية أي الضرائب وبذلنا له الحماية والمنعة.. ولقد أخبرنا نبينا أن مصر ستفتح علينا، وأوصانا بأهلها خيرا فقال:" ستفتح عليكم بعدي مصر، فاستوصوا بقبطها خيرا، فان لهم ذمّة ورحما".. فان أجبتمونا الى ما ندعوكم اليه كانت لكم ذمة الى ذمة"... وفرغ عمرو من كلماته، فصاح بعض الأساقفة والرهبان قائلا: " ان الرحم التي أوصاكم بها نبيّكم، لهي قرابة بعيدة، لا يصل مثلها الا الأنبياء"..!! وكانت هذه بداية طيبة للتفاهم المرجو بين عمرو أقباط مصر.. وان يكن قادة الرومان قد حاولوا العمل لاحباطها.. 
** 
وعمرو بن العاص لم يكن من السابقين الى الاسلام، فقد أسلم مع خالد بن الوليد قبيل فتح مكة بقليل.. ومن عجب أن اسلامه بدأ على يد النجاشي بالحبشة وذلك أن النجاشي يعرف عمرا ويحترمه بسبب تردده الكثير على الحبشة والهدايا الجزيلة التي كان يحملها للنجاشي، وفي زيارته الأخيرة لتلك البلاد جاء ذكر لرسول الذي يهتف بالتوحيد وبمكارم الأخلاق في جزيرة العرب.. وسأل عاهل الحبشة عمرا، كيف لم يؤمن به ويتبعه، وهو رسول من الله حقا..؟؟ وسأل عمرو النجاشي قائلا: " أهو كذلك؟؟" وأجابه النجاشي: " نعم، فأطعني يا عمرو واتبعه، فانه والله لعلى الحق، وليظهرنّ على من خالفه"..؟! وركب عمرو ثبج البحر من فوره، عائدا الى بلاده، وميمّما وجهه شطر المدينة ليسلم لله رب العالمين.. وفي الطريق المقضية الى المدينة التقى بخالد بن الوليد قادما من مكة ساعيا الى الرسول ليبايعه على الاسلام.. ولك يكد الرسول يراهما قادمين حتى تهلل وجهه وقال لأصحابه: " لقد رمتكم مكة بأفلاذ أكبادها".. وتقدم خالد فبايع.. ثم تقدم عمرو فقال: " اني أبايعك على أن يغفر الله لي ما تقدّم من ذنبي".. فأجابه الرسول عليه السلام قائلا: " يا عمرو.. بايع، فان الاسلام يجبّ ما كان قبله".. وبايع عمرو ووضع دهاءه وشجاعته في خدمة الدين الجديد. وعندما انتقل الرسول الى الرفيق الأعلى، كان عمرو واليا على عمان.. وفي خلافة عمر أبلى بلاءه المشهود في حروب الشام، ثم في تحرير مصر من حكم الرومان. 
** 
وياليت عمرو بن العاص كان قد قاوم نفسه في حب الامارة.. اذن لكان قد تفوّق كثيرا على بعض المواقف التي ورّطه فيها الحب. على أن حب عمرو الامارة، كان الى حد ما، تعبيرا تلقائيا عن طبيعته الجياشة بالمواهب.. بل ان شكله الخارجي، وطريقته في المشي وفي الحديث، كانت تومي الى أنه خلق للامارة..!! حتى لقد روي أن أمير المؤمنين عمر بن الخطاب رآه ذات يوم مقبلا، فابتسم لمشيته وقال: " ما ينبغي لأبي عبدالله أن يمشي على الأرض الا أميرا"..! والحق أن أبا عبدالله لم يبخس نفسه هذا الحق.. وحتى حين كانت الأحداث الخطيرة تجتاح المسلمين.. كان عمرو يتعامل مع هذه الأحداث بأسلوب أمير، أمير معه من الذكاء والدهاء، والمقدرة ما يجعله واثقا بنفسه معتزا بتفوقه..!! ولكن معه كذلك من الأمانة ما جعل عمر بن الخطاب وهو الصارم في اختيار ولاته، واليا على فلسطين والأردن، ثم على مصر طوال حياة أمير المؤمنين عمر... حين علم أمير المؤمنين عمر أن عمرا قد جاوز في رخاء معيشته الحد الذي كان أمير المؤمنين يطلب من ولاته أن يقفوا عنده، ليظلوا دائما في مستوى، أو على الأقل قريبين من مستوى عامة الناس.. نقول: لو علم الخليفة عن عمرو كثرة رخائه، لم يعزله، انما أرسل اليه محمد بن مسلمة وأمره أن يقاسم عمرا جميع أمواله وأشيائه، فيبقي له نصفها ويحمل معه الى بيت المال بالمدينة نصفها الآخر. ولو قد علم أمير المؤمنين أن حب عمرو للامارة، يحمله على التفريط في مسؤولياته، لما احتمل ضميره الرشيد ابقاءه في الولاية لحظة. 
** 
وكان عمرو رضي الله عنه حادّ الذكاء، قوي البديهة عميق الرؤية.. حتى لقد كان أمير المؤمنين عمر رضي الله عنه، كلما رأى انسانا عاجز الحيلة، صكّ كفيّه عجبا وقال: " سبحان الله..!! ان خالق هذا، وخالق عمرو بن العاص اله واحد!! كما كان بالغ الجرأة مقداما ولقد كان يمزج جرأته بدهائه في بعض المواطن، فيظن به الجبن أو الهلع.. بيد أنها سعة الحيلة، كان عمرو يجيد استعمالها في حذق هائل ليخرج نفسه من المآزق المهلكة..!! ولقد كام أمير المؤمنين عمر يعرف مواهبه هذه ويقدرها قدرها، من أجل ذلك عندما أرسله الى الشام قبل مجيئه الى مصر، قيل لأمير المؤمنين: ان على رأس جيوش الروم بالشام أرطبونا أي قائدا وأميرا من الشجعان الدهاة، فكان جواب عمر: " لقد رمينا أرطبون الروم، بأرطبون العرب، فلننظر عمّ تنفرج الأمور"..!! ولقد انفرجت عن غلبة ساحقة لأرطبون العرب، وداهيتهم الخطير عمرو ابن العاص، على أرطبون الروم الذي ترك جيشه للهزيمة وولى هاربا الى مصر، التي سيلحقه بها عمرو بعد قليل، ليرفع فوق ربوعها الآمنة راية الاسلام. 
** 
وما أكثر المواقف التي تألق فيها ذكاء عمرو ودهاؤه. وان كنا لا نحسب منها بحال موقفه من أبي موسى الأشعري في واقعة التحكيم حين اتفقا على أن يخلع كل منهما عليا ومعاوية، ليرجع الأمر شورى بين المسلمين، فأنفذ أبو موسى الاتفاق، وقعد عن انفاذه عمرو. واذا اردنا أن نشهد صورة لدهائه، وحذق بديهته، ففي موقفه من قائد حصن بابليون أثناء حربه مع الرومان في مصر وفي رواية تاريخية أخرى أنها الواقعة التي سنذكرها وقعت في اليرموك مع أرطبون الروم.. اذ دعاه الأرطبون والقائد ليحادثه، وكان قد أعطى أمرا لبعض رجاله بالقاء صخرة فوقه اثر انصرافه من الحصن، وأعدّ كل شيء ليكون قتل عمرو أمرا محتوما.. ودخل عمرو على القائد، لا يريبه شيء، وانفض لقاؤهما، وبينما هو في الطريق الى خارج الحصن، لمح فوق أسواره حركة مريبة حركت فيه حاسة الحذر بشدّة. وعلى الفور تصرّف بشكل باهر. لقد عاد الى قائد الحصن في خطوات آمنة مطمئنة وئيدة ومشاعر متهللة واثقة، كأن لم يفرّعه شيء قط، ولم يثر شكوكه أمر!! ودخل على القائد وقال له: لقد بادرني خاطر أردت أن أطلعك عليه.. ان معي حيث يقيم أصحابي جماعة من أصحاب الرسول السابقين الى الاسلام، لا يقطع أمير المؤمنين أمرا دونمشورتهم، ولا يرسل جيشا من جيوش الاسلام الا جعلهم على رأس مقاتلته وجنوده، وقد رأيت أن آتيك بهم، حتى يسمعوا منك مثل الذي سمعت، ويكونوا من الأمر على مثل ما أنا عليه من بيّنة.. وأدرك قائد الروم أن عمرا بسذاجة قد منحه فرصة العمر..!! فليوافقه اذن على رأيه، حتى اذا عاد ومعه هذا العدد من زعماء المسلمين وخيرة رجالهم وقوادهم، أجهز عليهم جميعا، بدلا من أن يجهز على عمرو وحده.. وبطريقة غير منظورة أعطى أمره بارجاء الخطة التي كانت معدّة لاغتيال عمرو.. ودّع عمرو بحفاوة، وصافحه بحرارة، وابتسم داهية العرب، وهو يغادر الحصن.. وفي الصباح عاد عمرو على رأس جيشه الى الحصن، ممتطيا صهوة فرسه، التي راحت تقهقه في صهيل شامت وساخر. أجل فهي الأخرى كانت تعرف من دهاء صاحبها الشيء الكثير..!! 
** 
وفي السنة الثالثة والأربعين من الهجرة أدركت الوفاة عمرو بن العاص بمصر، حيث كان واليا عليها.. وراح يستعرض حياته في لحظات الرحيل فقال: ".. كنت أول أمري كافرا.. وكنت أشد الناس على رسول الله، فلو مت يومئذ لوجبت لي النار.. ثم بايعت رسول الله، فما كان في الناس أحد أحب اليّ منه، ولا أجلّ في عيني منه.. ولو سئلت أن أنعته ما استطعت، لأني لم أكن أقدر أن أملأ عيني منه اجلالا له.. فلو متّ يومئذ لرجوت أن أكون من أهل الجنة.. ثم بليت بعد ذلك بالسلطان، وبأشياء لاأدري أهي لي أم عليّ".. 
** 
ثم رفع بصره الى السماء في ضراعة، مناجيا ربه الرحيم العظيم قائلا: " اللهم لا بريء فأعتذر، ولا عزيز فأنتصر، والا تدركني رحمتك أكن من الهالكين"!! وظل في ضراعاته، وابتهالاته حتى صعدت الى الله روحه. وكانت آخر كلماته لا اله الا الله.. وتحت ثرى مصر، التي عرّفها عمرو طريق الاسلام، ثوى رفاته.. وفوق أرضها الصلبة، لا يزال مجلسه حيث كان يعلم، ويقضي ويحكم.. قائما عبر القرون تحت سقف مسجده العتيق جامع عمرو، أول ميجد في مصر يذكر فيه اسم الله الواحد الأحد، وأعلنت بين أرجائه ومن فوق منبره كلمات الله، ومبادئ الاسلام.
number-en: The story of Amr ibn al-Aas
label-en:
Amr ibn al-Aas - the liberator of Egypt from the Romans

They were three of the Quraysh, who followed the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, violently resisting his call and harming his companions. The Messenger began praying against them, imploring his generous Lord to inflict His punishment on them. And as he prayed and supplicated, the revelation descended on his heart with this noble verse: (You have nothing to do with the matter, whether he repents to them or tortures them, for they are wrongdoers)... and the Messenger understood from the verse that it was an order for him to stop praying against them, and to leave their matter to God. Alone.. Either they continue their injustice, and His torment befalls them.. or He turns to them, so they repent, and His mercy overtakes them.. Amr ibn al-Aas was one of these three.. God chose for them the path of repentance and mercy and guided them to Islam.. Amr ibn al-Aas turned into a struggling Muslim. And to one of the brave leaders of Islam.. Despite some of Amr’s positions in which we cannot be convinced of his point of view, his role as a great companion who gave and gave, who worked and struggled, will continue to open our eyes and hearts to his life.. And here in Egypt in particular, those who see Islam as a valuable and glorious religion will continue to exist.. They see in his Messenger a mercy guided, a blessing granted, and a messenger of great truth, who called to God with insight, and inspired many lives with its guidance and piety.. Those who hold this faith will remain motivated by their loyalty to the man whom fate made a reason, and any reason, to guide Islam to Egypt, and to guide Egypt to Islam.. So blessed was the guidance and blessed was its guide.. That is: Amr bin Al-Aas, may God be pleased with him.. Historians have become accustomed to calling Amr the “conqueror of Egypt.” However, we see in this description an impossibility and transgression, and perhaps the most deserving epithets of Amr are to call him “the liberator of Egypt.” Islam was not conquering the country with the modern concept of conquest, but rather liberating it from the rule of two empires that poisoned the people and the country with terrible torment, namely: the Persian Empire and the Roman Empire... And Egypt in particular, on the day the vanguards of Islam invaded it, was plundered by the Romans and its people were resisting in vain... and when the cries of the faithful battalions rang out over the outskirts of their country: “God is great... God is great.” Akbar.. They all rushed in a glorious crowd towards the coming dawn and embraced it, finding in it their salvation from Caesar and from the Romans.. Amr bin Al-Aas and his men did not conquer Egypt then.. Rather, they opened the way for Egypt to achieve its destiny with justice... and to connect its destiny with justice... and to find itself and its truth in the light of the words of God and the principles of Islam... And he, may God be pleased with him, was keen to keep the people of Egypt and its Copts away from the battle, so that the fight would remain confined between him and the Roman soldiers who were occupying the country and stealing the livelihood of its people... For this reason, we find him speaking to the Christian leaders of that day and their senior sheikhs, He says: “... God sent Muhammad with the truth and commanded him to do it... and that he, peace and blessings be upon him, fulfilled his message and proceeded after leaving us on the clear path, that is, the clear and straight path... Among the things we were commanded to do was to make excuses to the people, so we invite you to Islam.. Whoever responds to us, then he is one of us, and he has what we have and what we owe.. And whoever does not respond to us to Islam, we offer him the jizyah, that is, taxes, and we give him protection and protection.. And our Prophet informed us that Egypt will be conquered upon us, and he advised us to be kind to its people, saying: “Egypt will be conquered for you after me, so be kind to its Copts, for they have a duty and a kinship.” So... You responded to what we called you to, and you were bound by a duty... Amr finished his words, and some of the bishops and monks shouted, saying: “The kinship that your Prophet enjoined upon you is a distant relative, the like of which only the prophets can reach.” This was a good beginning for the desired understanding between Amr and the Copts of Egypt... even if the Roman leaders tried to work to thwart it... 
** 
Amr ibn al-Aas was not one of the first to convert to Islam, as he converted to Islam with Khalid ibn al-Walid shortly before the conquest of Mecca. It is surprising that his conversion to Islam began at the hands of the Negus in Abyssinia. This is because the Negus knew and respected Omar because of his many visits to Abyssinia and the many gifts he brought to the Negus. During his last visit to that country, there was a mention of the Messenger who chanted monotheism and good morals in the Arabian Peninsula.. The King of Abyssinia asked Omar, how could he not believe in him and follow him, when he was truly a messenger from God..?? Amr Al-Najashi asked: “Is it so?” The Negus answered him: “Yes, so obey me, O Amr, and follow him, for by God he is upon the truth, and he will prevail over those who disagree with him.”..?! Amr Thabej immediately boarded the sea, returning to his country, and turned his face towards Medina to surrender to God, Lord of the Worlds. On the way to Medina, he met Khalid bin Al-Walid, coming from Mecca, seeking the Messenger to pledge his allegiance to Islam. The Messenger had hardly seen them coming until his face beamed and he said to his companions: “Mecca has thrown away the pieces of its livers at you.” Khaled came forward and pledged allegiance. Then Amr came forward and said: “I pledge allegiance to you on the condition that God forgives me for my previous sins.” The Messenger, peace be upon him, answered him, saying: “O Amr... pledge allegiance, for Islam obligates what came before it.” Amr pledged allegiance and put his cunning and courage in the service of the new religion. When the Messenger moved to the highest companion, Amr was governor of Oman.. During the succession of Omar, he performed his well-known calamity in the wars of the Levant, and then in liberating Egypt from Roman rule. 
** 
I wish Amr ibn al-Aas had resisted himself in his love of the emirate...then he would have far surpassed some of the situations in which love had gotten him involved. However, Amr's love for the emirate was, to some extent, a spontaneous expression of his nature full of talents.. Indeed, his external appearance, and the way he walked and spoke, suggested that he was created for the emirate..!! It was even narrated that the Commander of the Faithful, Omar bin Al-Khattab, saw him coming one day, and smiled at his gait and said: “Abu Abdullah should not walk on the earth except as a prince”..! The truth is that Abu Abdullah did not deprive himself of this right... even when dangerous events were sweeping the Muslims... Amr was dealing with these events in the manner of a prince, a prince with intelligence, cunning, and ability that made him self-confident and proud of his superiority..!! But he also had such honesty that he made Omar ibn al-Khattab, who was strict in choosing his governors, governor of Palestine and Jordan, and then of Egypt throughout the life of the Commander of the Faithful Omar... when the Commander of the Faithful Omar learned that Omar had exceeded the level of prosperity in his living that the Commander of the Faithful had asked his governors to stand by, so that they would always remain on a level, or at least close to the level of the common people... We say: If the Caliph had known about Amr’s great prosperity, he would not have dismissed him, but rather sent Muhammad ibn Maslama to him and ordered him to share all his money and things with Amr, leaving half of it for him and carrying the other half with him to the treasury in Medina. If the Commander of the Faithful had known that Amr's love for the emirate was causing him to neglect his responsibilities, his rational conscience would not have tolerated keeping him in charge for a moment. 
** 
Amr, may God be pleased with him, was sharp in mind, strong intuitive, and profound in his vision. Even the Commander of the Faithful, Omar, may God be pleased with him, whenever he saw a helpless person, he would clench his palms in amazement and say: “Glory be to God...!! The Creator of this and the Creator of Amr ibn Al-Aas is one God!! He was also extremely bold and courageous, and he used to mix his audacity with his cunning in some situations, making him think he was cowardly or panicking... However, it was resourcefulness, and Amr was good at using it with great skill to get himself out of troubles. Deadly..!! The Commander of the Faithful, Omar, came to know these talents of his and appreciated them. For this reason, when he sent him to the Levant before he came to Egypt, the Commander of the Faithful was told: At the head of the Roman armies in the Levant is Artubunna, that is, a brave and shrewd leader and prince. So Omar’s answer was: “We have defeated the Artubun of the Romans, with the Artubun of the Arabs, so let us see if things will improve.”!! An overwhelming victory was achieved by the Arabs' Artubun, and their dangerous cunning Amr Ibn Al-Aas, over the Roman Artubun, who abandoned his army in defeat and fled to Egypt, where Amr would join him shortly, to raise the banner of Islam over its safe regions. ** 
There are many situations in which Amr's intelligence and cunning shine. Although we do not count it in the case of his position with Abu Musa Al-Ash’ari in the arbitration incident when they agreed that each of them would depose Ali and Muawiyah, so that the matter would return to consultation among the Muslims, so Abu Musa implemented the agreement, and Amr refrained from implementing it. If we want to see a picture of his cunning and clever intuition, it is in his position towards the commander of the Babylonian fortress during his war with the Romans in Egypt and in another historical account that the incident that we will mention occurred in Yarmouk with the Romans’ Artabun. Al-Artubun and the commander invited him to talk to him, and he had given an order to some of his men to throw a rock on top of him after he left the fort, and he prepared everything so that the killing of Amr would be inevitable. Amr entered the commander, not suspecting anything, and their meeting broke up, and while he was on the way outside the fort, he noticed a suspicious movement above its walls that greatly stirred his sense of caution. Immediately he acted brilliantly. He returned to the commander of the fort with safe, reassuring, and steady steps, and with joyful and confident feelings, as if nothing had ever bothered him, and nothing had raised his doubts!! He entered the leader and said to him: A thought came to me that I wanted to share with you. I have with me, where my companions reside, a group of the Messenger’s former companions who converted to Islam. The Commander of the Faithful does not decide on a matter without their advice, nor does he send an army of the armies of Islam without placing them at the head of his fighters and soldiers. I thought I would bring them to you, so that they would hear from you as I heard, and be of the matter as clear as I am.. And the Roman commander realized that Omar, in his naivety, had given him the opportunity of a lifetime..!! Then let him agree with his opinion, so that when he returns with this number of Muslim leaders and their best men and commanders, he will finish them all off, instead of finishing off Amr alone.. In an unseen way, he gave his order to postpone the plan that was prepared to assassinate Amr. He bid Amr a warm farewell, shook his hand warmly, and the shrewd Arab smiled as he left the fort. In the morning, Amr returned at the head of his army to the fort, riding on the back of his horse, which began to laugh in a gloating and sarcastic neigh. Yes, she also knew a lot about her owner’s cleverness..!! 
** 
In the forty-third year of the Hijra, Amr ibn al-Aas died in Egypt, where he was its governor. He began reviewing his life in the moments of departure and said: “...I was an infidel at the beginning of my life... And I was the most severe of people towards the Messenger of God. If I had died that day, Hell would have been necessary for me. Then I pledged allegiance to the Messenger of God, and there was no one among the people dearer to me than him, nor more honorable in my eyes than him. And if I had been asked, I would have called him as much as I could, because I was not able to fill my eyes with reverence for him. If I had died on that day, I would have hoped to be among the people of Paradise. Then after that I was afflicted with power and with things that I do not know whether they were for me or for me. ** 
Then he raised his gaze to the sky in supplication, calling on his great, merciful Lord, saying: “Oh God, there is no innocent, so I can apologize, and there is no mighty, so I can be victorious, and if Your mercy does not reach me, I will be among the perished”!! He remained in his supplications and supplications until his soul ascended to God. His last words were, “There is no god but God.” Under the soil of Egypt, which Amr introduced to the path of Islam, his remains were resting. It has stood throughout the centuries under the roof of its ancient mosque, the Amr Mosque, the first mosque in Egypt in which the name of the One and Only God is mentioned, and the words of God and the principles of Islam are announced between its chambers and from above its pulpit.
